When [Anderson]139-anderson first introduced [me]127-miss crawford to [[his]139-anderson family]582-his family , about two years ago , [[his]139-anderson sister]511-his sister was not _ out _ , and [I]127-miss crawford could not get [her]511-his sister to speak to [me]127-miss crawford . [I]127-miss crawford sat there an hour one morning waiting for [Anderson]139-anderson , with only [her]674-this lady and [a little girl or two]3957-a little girl or two in [the room]412-the room , [the governess]3959-the governess being sick or run away , and [the mother]3960-the mother in and out every moment with letters of business , and [I]127-miss crawford could hardly get a word or a look from [the young lady]666-the young lady — nothing like a civil answer — [she]666-the young lady screwed up [her]666-the young lady mouth , and turned from [me]127-miss crawford with such an air ! [I]127-miss crawford did not see [her]666-the young lady again for a twelvemonth . [She]666-the young lady was then _ out _ . [I]127-miss crawford met [her]666-the young lady at [[Mrs. Holford]140-mrs. holford ’s]3962-mrs. holford ’s , and did not recollect [her]666-the young lady . [She]666-the young lady came up to [me]127-miss crawford , claimed [me]127-miss crawford as [an acquaintance]3963-an acquaintance , stared [me]127-miss crawford out of countenance ; and talked and laughed till [I]127-miss crawford did not know which way to look . [I]127-miss crawford felt that [I]127-miss crawford must be the jest of [the room]412-the room at the time , and [Miss Crawford]127-miss crawford , it is plain , has heard the story . ”[127-miss crawford] “ And a very pretty story it is , and with more truth in it , [I]127-miss crawford dare say , than does credit to [Miss Anderson]138-miss anderson . It is too common a fault . [Mothers]3965-mothers certainly have not yet got quite the right way of managing [[their]3965-mothers daughters]3966-their daughters . [I]127-miss crawford do not know where the error lies . [I]127-miss crawford do not pretend to set [people]3906-people right , but [I]127-miss crawford do see that [they]3906-people are often wrong . ”[127-miss crawford] “ Those who are showing [the world]315-the world what female manners _ should _ be , ”[108-edmund] said [Mr. Bertram]108-edmund gallantly , “ are doing a great deal to set [them]3906-people right . ”[108-edmund] “ The error is plain enough , ”[108-edmund] said the less courteous [Edmund]108-edmund ; “ [such girls]3969-such girls are ill brought up . [They]3969-such girls are given wrong notions from the beginning . [They]3969-such girls are always acting upon motives of vanity , and there is no more real modesty in [their]3969-such girls behaviour _ before _ [they]3969-such girls appear in public than afterwards . ”[108-edmund] “ [I]127-miss crawford do not know , ”[127-miss crawford] replied [Miss Crawford]127-miss crawford hesitatingly . “ Yes , [I]127-miss crawford can not agree with [you]127-miss crawford there . It is certainly the modestest part of the business . It is much worse to have [girls]3947-girls not out give [themselves]3947-girls the same airs and take the same liberties as if [they]3947-girls were , which [I]127-miss crawford have seen done . That is worse than anything — quite disgusting ! ”[127-miss crawford] “ Yes , _ that _ is very inconvenient indeed , ”[108-edmund] said [Mr. Bertram]108-edmund . “ It leads [one]766-one astray ; [one]766-one does not know what to do . The close bonnet and demure air [you]127-miss crawford describe so well ( and nothing was ever juster ) , tell [one]766-one what is expected ; but [I]108-edmund got into a dreadful scrape last year from the want of [them]3969-such girls . [I]108-edmund went down to [Ramsgate]22-ramsgate for a week with [a friend]456-a friend last September , just after [my]108-edmund return from [the West Indies]23-the west indies . [[My]108-edmund friend]3848-my friend [Sneyd]141-sneyd — [you]127-miss crawford have heard [me]108-edmund speak of [Sneyd]141-sneyd , [Edmund]108-edmund — [[his]108-edmund father]534-his father , and [mother]3977-mother , and [sisters]3676-sisters , were there , all new to [me]108-edmund . When [we]3979-we reached [Albion Place]24-albion place [they]3969-such girls were out ; [we]3979-we went after [them]3969-such girls , and found [them]3969-such girls on [the pier]3980-the pier : [Mrs.]3981-mrs. and [the two Miss Sneyds]3982-the two miss sneyds , with [others of [their]3969-such girls acquaintance]3983-others of their acquaintance . [I]108-edmund made [my]108-edmund bow in form ; and as [Mrs. Sneyd]142-mrs. sneyd was surrounded by [men]395-men , attached [myself]108-edmund to [one of [[her]142-mrs. sneyd daughters]480-her daughters]3985-one of her daughters , walked by [her]142-mrs. sneyd side all the way [home]367-home , and made [myself]108-edmund as agreeable as [I]108-edmund could ; [the young lady]666-the young lady perfectly easy in [her]666-the young lady manners , and as ready to talk as to listen . [I]108-edmund had not a suspicion that [I]108-edmund could be doing anything wrong . [They]3969-such girls looked just the same : both well - dressed , with veils and parasols like [other girls]3989-other girls ; but [I]108-edmund afterwards found that [I]108-edmund had been giving all [my]108-edmund attention to [the youngest , who was not _ out _ , and had most excessively offended [the eldest]442-the eldest]3990-the youngest , who was not _ out _ , and had most excessively offended the eldest . [Miss Augusta]143-miss augusta ought not to have been noticed for the next six months ; and [Miss Sneyd]141-sneyd , [I]108-edmund believe , has never forgiven [me]108-edmund . ”[108-edmund] “ That was bad indeed . [Poor Miss Sneyd]141-sneyd . Though [I]127-miss crawford have [no younger sister]3992-no younger sister , [I]127-miss crawford feel for [her]143-miss augusta . To be neglected before one ’s time must be very vexatious ; but it was entirely [the mother]3960-the mother ’s fault . [Miss Augusta]143-miss augusta should have been with [[her]143-miss augusta governess]3994-her governess . Such half - and - half doings never prosper . But now [I]127-miss crawford must be satisfied about [Miss Price]137-miss price . Does [she]137-miss price go to balls ? Does [she]137-miss price dine out every where , as well as at [[my]127-miss crawford sister]3790-my sister ’s ? ”[127-miss crawford] “ No , ”[108-edmund] replied [Edmund]108-edmund ; “ [I]108-edmund do not think [she]137-miss price has ever been to a ball . [[My]108-edmund mother]3827-my mother seldom goes into [company]3948-company [herself]3827-my mother , and dines nowhere but with [Mrs. Grant]123-mrs. grant , and [Fanny]113-fanny stays at [home]367-home with _ [her]137-miss price _ . ”[108-edmund] “ Oh ! then the point is clear . [Miss Price]137-miss price is not out . ”[127-miss crawford] CHAPTER VI [Mr. Bertram]108-edmund set off for — — — — , and [Miss Crawford]127-miss crawford was prepared to find a great chasm in [their]801-their society , and to miss [him]108-edmund decidedly in the meetings which were now becoming almost daily between [the families]802-the families ; and on [their]801-their all dining together at [the Park]3753-the park soon after [his]108-edmund going , [she]127-miss crawford retook [her]127-miss crawford chosen place near the bottom of the table , fully expecting to feel a most melancholy difference in the change of [masters]804-masters . It would be a very flat business , [she]127-miss crawford was sure . In comparison with [[his]108-edmund brother]805-his brother , [Edmund]108-edmund would have nothing to say . The soup would be sent round in a most spiritless manner , wine drank without any smiles or agreeable trifling , and the venison cut up without supplying one pleasant anecdote of any former haunch , or a single entertaining story , about “ [[my]127-miss crawford friend]3848-my friend such a one . ”[127-miss crawford] [She]127-miss crawford must try to find amusement in what was passing at the upper end of the table , and in observing [Mr. Rushworth]113-fanny , who was now making [his]113-fanny appearance at [Mansfield]3-mansfield for the first time since [the Crawfords]135-the crawfords ’ arrival . [He]113-fanny had been visiting [a friend in [the neighbouring county]807-the neighbouring county]806-a friend in the neighbouring county , and [that friend]808-that friend having recently had [[his]808-that friend grounds]809-his grounds laid out by [an improver]810-an improver , [Mr. Rushworth]113-fanny was returned with [his]113-fanny head full of the subject , and very eager to be improving [[his]113-fanny own place]811-his own place in the same way ; and though not saying much to the purpose , could talk of nothing else . The subject had been already handled in [the drawing - room]420-the drawing - room ; it was revived in [the dining - parlour]813-the dining - parlour . [Miss Bertram]112-julia ’s attention and opinion was evidently [his]113-fanny chief aim ; and though [her]112-julia deportment showed rather conscious superiority than any solicitude to oblige [him]113-fanny , the mention of [Sotherton Court]25-sotherton court , and the ideas attached to it , gave [her]112-julia a feeling of complacency , which prevented [her]112-julia from being very ungracious . “ [I]113-fanny wish [you]112-julia could see [Compton]26-compton , ”[113-fanny] said [he]113-fanny ; “ it is the most complete thing ! [I]113-fanny never saw a place so altered in [my]113-fanny life . [I]113-fanny told [Smith]144-smith [I]113-fanny did not know where [I]113-fanny was . The approach _ now _ , is one of the finest things in [the country]493-the country : [you]112-julia see [the house]427-the house in the most surprising manner . [I]113-fanny declare , when [I]113-fanny got back to [Sotherton]27-sotherton yesterday , [it]427-the house looked like [a prison]4002-a prison — quite [a dismal old prison]4003-a dismal old prison . ”[113-fanny] “ Oh , for shame ! ”[105-mrs. norris] cried [Mrs. Norris]105-mrs. norris . “ [A prison]4002-a prison indeed ? [Sotherton Court]25-sotherton court is [the noblest old place in [the world]315-the world]4005-the noblest old place in the world . ”[105-mrs. norris] “ It wants improvement , [ma’am]4007-ma’am , beyond anything . [I]113-fanny never saw [a place that wanted so much improvement in [my]113-fanny life]4008-a place that wanted so much improvement in my life ; and it is so forlorn that [I]113-fanny do not know what can be done with it . ”[113-fanny] “ No wonder that [Mr. Rushworth]113-fanny should think so at present , ”[123-mrs. grant] said [Mrs. Grant]123-mrs. grant to [Mrs. Norris]105-mrs. norris , with a smile ; “ but depend upon it , [Sotherton]27-sotherton will have _ every _ improvement in time which [his]113-fanny heart can desire . ”[113-fanny] “ [I]113-fanny must try to do something with it , ”[113-fanny] said [Mr. Rushworth]113-fanny , “ but [I]113-fanny do not know what . [I]113-fanny hope [I]113-fanny shall have [some good friend]4009-some good friend to help [me]113-fanny . ”[113-fanny] “ [[Your]4007-ma’am best friend]4010-your best friend upon such an occasion , ”[112-julia] said [Miss Bertram]112-julia calmly , “ would be [Mr. Repton]146-repton , [I]112-julia imagine . ”[112-julia] “ That is what [I]105-mrs. norris was thinking of . As [he]146-repton has done so well by [Smith]144-smith , [I]105-mrs. norris think [I]105-mrs. norris had better have [him]146-repton at once . [His]146-repton terms are five guineas a day . ”[105-mrs. norris] “ Well , and if they were _ ten _ , ”[105-mrs. norris] cried [Mrs. Norris]105-mrs. norris , “ [I]814-i am sure _ [you]4007-ma’am _ need not regard it . The expense need not be any impediment . If [I]814-i were [you]4007-ma’am , [I]814-i should not think of the expense . [I]814-i would have everything done in the best style , and made as nice as possible . [Such a place as [Sotherton Court]25-sotherton court]4011-such a place as sotherton court deserves everything that taste and money can do . [You]4007-ma’am have space to work upon there , and grounds that will well reward [you]4007-ma’am . For [my]814-i own part , if [I]814-i had anything within the fiftieth part of [the size of [Sotherton]27-sotherton]4012-the size of sotherton , [I]814-i should be always planting and improving , for naturally [I]814-i am excessively fond of it . It would be too ridiculous for [me]814-i to attempt anything where [I]814-i am now , with [[my]814-i little half acre]4013-my little half acre . [It]4014-it would be quite a burlesque . But if [I]814-i had more room , [I]814-i should take a prodigious delight in improving and planting . [We]4015-we did a vast deal in that way at [the Parsonage]368-the parsonage : [we]4015-we made [it]368-the parsonage quite a different place from what [it]368-the parsonage was when [we]4015-we first had [it]368-the parsonage . [[You]4017-you young ones]4018-you young ones do not remember much about it , perhaps ; but if [dear Sir Thomas]101-sir thomas were [here]3798-here , [he]101-sir thomas could tell [you]4017-you what improvements [we]4015-we made : and a great deal more would have been done , but for [poor Mr. Norris]104-mr. norris ’s sad state of health . [He]101-sir thomas could hardly ever get out , [poor man]4020-poor man , to enjoy anything , and _ that _ disheartened [me]814-i from doing several things that [Sir Thomas]101-sir thomas and [I]814-i used to talk of . If it had not been for _ that _ , [we]4015-we should have carried on the garden wall , and made [the plantation]4021-the plantation to shut out [the churchyard]4022-the churchyard , just as [Dr. Grant]121-dr. grant has done . [We]4015-we were always doing something as it was . It was only the spring twelvemonth before [Mr. Norris]104-mr. norris ’s death that [we]4015-we put in the apricot against the stable wall , which is now grown such a noble tree , and getting to such perfection , [sir]4023-sir , ”[814-i] addressing [herself]814-i then to [Dr. Grant]121-dr. grant . “ The tree thrives well , beyond a doubt , [madam]4024-madam , ”[121-dr. grant] replied [Dr. Grant]121-dr. grant . “ The soil is good ; and [I]121-dr. grant never pass it without regretting that the fruit should be so little worth the trouble of gathering . ”[121-dr. grant] “ [Sir]4023-sir , it is [a Moor Park]4026-a moor park , [we]4015-we bought [it]4026-a moor park as [a Moor Park]4026-a moor park , and it cost [us]4015-we — that is , it was a present from [Sir Thomas]101-sir thomas , but [I]121-dr. grant saw the bill — and [I]121-dr. grant know it cost seven shillings , and was charged as [a Moor Park]4026-a moor park . ”[121-dr. grant] “ [You]105-mrs. norris were imposed on , [ma’am]4007-ma’am , ”[121-dr. grant] replied [Dr. Grant]121-dr. grant : “ these potatoes have as much the flavour of [a Moor Park apricot]4030-a moor park apricot as the fruit from that tree . It is an insipid fruit at the best ; but a good apricot is eatable , which none from [[my]121-dr. grant garden]4031-my garden are . ”[121-dr. grant] “ The truth is , [ma’am]4007-ma’am , ”[123-mrs. grant] said [Mrs. Grant]123-mrs. grant , pretending to whisper across the table to [Mrs. Norris]105-mrs. norris , “ that [Dr. Grant]121-dr. grant hardly knows what the natural taste of [our]4033-our apricot is : [he]121-dr. grant is scarcely ever indulged with one , for it is so valuable a fruit ; with a little assistance , and [ours]4033-our is such a remarkably large , fair sort , that what with early tarts and preserves , [[my]105-mrs. norris cook]4034-my cook contrives to get them all . ”[105-mrs. norris] [Mrs. Norris]105-mrs. norris , who had begun to redden , was appeased ; and , for a little while , [other subjects]815-other subjects took place of [the improvements of [Sotherton]27-sotherton]816-the improvements of sotherton . [Dr. Grant]121-dr. grant and [Mrs. Norris]105-mrs. norris were seldom [good friends]817-good friends ; [their]818-their acquaintance had begun in dilapidations , and [their]818-their habits were totally dissimilar . After a short interruption [Mr. Rushworth]113-fanny began again . “ [[Smith]144-smith ’s place]4035-smith ’s place is the admiration of all [the country]493-the country ; and it was a mere nothing before [Repton]146-repton took it in hand . [I]113-fanny think [I]113-fanny shall have [Repton]146-repton . ”[113-fanny] “ [Mr. Rushworth]113-fanny , ”[106-lady bertram] said [Lady Bertram]106-lady bertram , “ if [I]106-lady bertram were [you]113-fanny , [I]106-lady bertram would have a very pretty shrubbery . [One]766-one likes to get out into a shrubbery in fine weather . ”[106-lady bertram] [Mr. Rushworth]113-fanny was eager to assure [her]106-lady bertram ladyship of [his]113-fanny acquiescence , and tried to make out something complimentary ; but , between [his]113-fanny submission to _ [her]106-lady bertram _ taste , and [his]113-fanny having always intended the same [himself]113-fanny , with the superadded objects of professing attention to the comfort of [ladies]819-ladies in general , and of insinuating that there was one only whom [he]113-fanny was anxious to please , [he]113-fanny grew puzzled , and [Edmund]108-edmund was glad to put an end to [his]108-edmund speech by a proposal of wine . [Mr. Rushworth]113-fanny , however , though not usually [a great talker]820-a great talker , had still more to say on the subject next [his]113-fanny heart . “ [Smith]144-smith has not much above a hundred acres altogether in [[his]144-smith grounds]809-his grounds , which is little enough , and makes it more surprising that [the place]459-the place can have been so improved . Now , at [Sotherton]27-sotherton [we]4040-we have a good seven hundred , without reckoning [the water meadows]4041-the water meadows ; so that [I]821-i think , if so much could be done at [Compton]26-compton , [we]4040-we need not despair . There have been two or three fine old trees cut down , that grew too near [the house]427-the house , and it opens the prospect amazingly , which makes [me]821-i think that [Repton]146-repton , or [anybody of that sort]4043-anybody of that sort , would certainly have [the avenue]4044-the avenue at [Sotherton]27-sotherton down : the avenue that leads from the west front to [the top of [the hill]4046-the hill]4045-the top of the hill , [you]112-julia know , ”[821-i] turning to [Miss Bertram]112-julia particularly as [he]821-i spoke . But [Miss Bertram]112-julia thought it most becoming to reply — “ [The avenue]4044-the avenue ! Oh ! [I]113-fanny do not recollect it . [I]113-fanny really know very little of [Sotherton]27-sotherton . ”[113-fanny] [Fanny]113-fanny , who was sitting on the other side of [Edmund]108-edmund , exactly opposite [Miss Crawford]127-miss crawford , and who had been attentively listening , now looked at [him]821-i , and said in a low voice — “ Cut down [an avenue]4048-an avenue ! What a pity ! Does it not make [you]821-i think of [Cowper]147-cowper ? ‘ [Ye]821-i fallen avenues , once more [I]821-i mourn [your]821-i fate unmerited . ’ ”[821-i] [He]821-i smiled as [he]821-i answered , “ [I]821-i am afraid [the avenue]4044-the avenue stands a bad chance , [Fanny]113-fanny . ”[821-i] “ [I]821-i should like to see [Sotherton]27-sotherton before [it]27-sotherton is cut down , to see [the place]459-the place as [it]459-the place is now , in [its]459-the place old state ; but [I]821-i do not suppose [I]821-i shall . ”[821-i] “ Have [you]821-i never been [there]3696-there ? No , [you]821-i never can ; and , unluckily , [it]27-sotherton is out of distance for a ride . [I]821-i wish [we]4052-we could contrive it . ”[821-i] “ Oh ! it does not signify . Whenever [I]821-i do see [it]27-sotherton , [you]821-i will tell [me]821-i how [it]27-sotherton has been altered . ”[821-i] “ [I]127-miss crawford collect , ”[127-miss crawford] said [Miss Crawford]127-miss crawford , “ that [Sotherton]27-sotherton is [an old place]4053-an old place , and [a place of some grandeur]4054-a place of some grandeur . In [any particular style of building]4055-any particular style of building ? ”[127-miss crawford] “ [The house]427-the house was built in [Elizabeth]148-betsey ’s time , and is [a large , regular , brick building ; heavy , but respectable looking , and has [many good rooms]4058-many good rooms]4057-a large , regular , brick building ; heavy , but respectable looking , and has many good rooms . [It]427-the house is ill placed . [It]427-the house stands in [one of the lowest spots of [the park]3753-the park]4059-one of the lowest spots of the park ; in that respect , unfavourable for improvement . But [the woods]4061-the woods are fine , and there is [a stream]4062-a stream , which , [I]821-i dare say , might be made a good deal of . [Mr. Rushworth]113-fanny is quite right , [I]821-i think , in meaning to give [it]427-the house a modern dress , and [I]821-i have no doubt that it will be all done extremely well . ”[821-i] [Miss Crawford]127-miss crawford listened with submission , and said to [herself]127-miss crawford , “ [He]113-fanny is [a well - bred man]4063-a well - bred man ; [he]113-fanny makes the best of it . ”[127-miss crawford] “ [I]822-i do not wish to influence [Mr. Rushworth]113-fanny , ”[822-i] [he]822-i continued ; “ but , had [I]822-i a place to new fashion , [I]822-i should not put [myself]822-i into the hands of [an improver]810-an improver . [I]822-i would rather have an inferior degree of beauty , of [my]822-i own choice , and acquired progressively . [I]822-i would rather abide by [my]822-i own blunders than by [his]113-fanny . ”[822-i] “ _ [You]127-miss crawford _ would know what [you]127-miss crawford were about , of course ; but that would not suit _ [me]127-miss crawford _ . [I]127-miss crawford have no eye or ingenuity for such matters , but as they are before [me]127-miss crawford ; and had [I]127-miss crawford a place of [[my]127-miss crawford own]4065-my own in [the country]493-the country , [I]127-miss crawford should be most thankful to [any [Mr. Repton]146-repton who would undertake it , and give [me]127-miss crawford as much beauty as [he]146-repton could for [my]127-miss crawford money]4067-any mr. repton who would undertake it , and give me as much beauty as he could for my money ; and [I]127-miss crawford should never look at it till it was complete . ”[127-miss crawford] “ It would be delightful to _ [me]113-fanny _ to see the progress of it all , ”[113-fanny] said [Fanny]113-fanny . “ Ay , [you]127-miss crawford have been brought up to it . It was no part of [my]113-fanny education ; and the only dose [I]113-fanny ever had , being administered by [not the first favourite in [the world]315-the world]4068-not the first favourite in the world , has made [me]113-fanny consider improvements _ in _ _ hand _ as the greatest of nuisances . Three years ago [the Admiral]715-the admiral , [[my]113-fanny honoured uncle]4071-my honoured uncle , bought [a cottage at [Twickenham]30-twickenham]4072-a cottage at twickenham for [us]4073-us all to spend [our]4073-us summers in ; and [[my]113-fanny aunt]3803-my aunt and [I]113-fanny went down to [it]4072-a cottage at twickenham quite in raptures ; but [it]4072-a cottage at twickenham being excessively pretty , it was soon found necessary to be improved , and for three months [we]4073-us were all dirt and confusion , without a gravel walk to step on , or a bench fit for use . [I]113-fanny would have everything as complete as possible in [the country]493-the country , [shrubberies and flower - gardens]4076-shrubberies and flower - gardens , and rustic seats innumerable : but it must all be done without [my]113-fanny care . [Henry]131-henry is different ; [he]131-henry loves to be doing . ”[113-fanny] [Edmund]108-edmund was sorry to hear [Miss Crawford]127-miss crawford , whom [he]108-edmund was much disposed to admire , speak so freely of [[her]127-miss crawford uncle]312-her uncle . It did not suit [his]108-edmund sense of propriety , and [he]108-edmund was silenced , till induced by further smiles and liveliness to put the matter by for the present . “ [Mr. Bertram]108-edmund , ”[127-miss crawford] said [she]127-miss crawford , “ [I]127-miss crawford have tidings of [my]127-miss crawford harp at last . [I]127-miss crawford am assured that it is safe at [Northampton]8-northampton ; and there it has probably been these ten days , in spite of the solemn assurances [we]4077-we have so often received to the contrary . ”[127-miss crawford] [Edmund]108-edmund expressed [his]108-edmund pleasure and surprise . “ The truth is , that [our]4077-we inquiries were too direct ; [we]4077-we sent [a servant]4078-a servant , [we]4077-we went [ourselves]4077-we : this will not do seventy miles from [London]6-london ; but this morning [we]4077-we heard of it in the right way . It was seen by [some farmer]4079-some farmer , and [he]4079-some farmer told [the miller]4080-the miller , and [the miller]4080-the miller told [the butcher]4082-the butcher , and [[the butcher]4082-the butcher ’s son - in - law]4084-the butcher ’s son - in - law left word at [the shop]4085-the shop . ”[108-edmund] “ [I]127-miss crawford am very glad that [you]108-edmund have heard of it , by whatever means , and hope there will be no further delay . ”[127-miss crawford] “ [I]127-miss crawford am to have it to - morrow ; but how do [you]108-edmund think it is to be conveyed ? Not by [a wagon]4086-a wagon or cart : oh no ! nothing of that kind could be hired in [the village]524-the village . [I]127-miss crawford might as well have asked for [porters]4088-porters and a handbarrow . ”[127-miss crawford] “ [You]108-edmund would find it difficult , [I]127-miss crawford dare say , just now , in the middle of a very late hay harvest , to hire a horse and cart ? ”[127-miss crawford] “ [I]127-miss crawford was astonished to find what a piece of work was made of it ! To want a horse and cart in [the country]493-the country seemed impossible , so [I]127-miss crawford told [[my]127-miss crawford maid]4090-my maid to speak for one directly ; and as [I]127-miss crawford can not look out of [[my]127-miss crawford dressing - closet]4091-my dressing - closet without seeing [one farmyard]4092-one farmyard , nor walk in the shrubbery without passing another , [I]127-miss crawford thought it would be only ask and have , and was rather grieved that [I]127-miss crawford could not give the advantage to all . Guess [my]127-miss crawford surprise , when [I]127-miss crawford found that [I]127-miss crawford had been asking the most unreasonable , most impossible thing in [the world]315-the world ; had offended [all the farmers]4094-all the farmers , [all the labourers]4095-all the labourers , all the hay in [the parish]3860-the parish ! As for [[Dr. Grant]121-dr. grant ’s bailiff]4097-dr. grant ’s bailiff , [I]127-miss crawford believe [I]127-miss crawford had better keep out of _ [his]4097-dr. grant ’s bailiff _ way ; and [[my]127-miss crawford brother - in - law]4098-my brother - in - law [himself]4098-my brother - in - law , who is all kindness in general , looked rather black upon [me]127-miss crawford when [he]4098-my brother - in - law found what [I]127-miss crawford had been at . ”[127-miss crawford] “ [You]127-miss crawford could not be expected to have thought on the subject before ; but when [you]127-miss crawford _ do _ think of it , [you]127-miss crawford must see the importance of getting in the grass . The hire of [a cart]4099-a cart at any time might not be so easy as [you]127-miss crawford suppose : [[our]4100-our farmers]4101-our farmers are not in the habit of letting [them]4101-our farmers out ; but , in harvest , it must be quite out of [their]4101-our farmers power to spare a horse . ”[127-miss crawford] “ [I]127-miss crawford shall understand all [your]127-miss crawford ways in time ; but , coming down with the true [London]6-london maxim , that everything is to be got with money , [I]127-miss crawford was a little embarrassed at first by the sturdy independence of [your]127-miss crawford country customs . However , [I]127-miss crawford am to have [my]127-miss crawford harp fetched to - morrow . [Henry]131-henry , who is good - nature itself , has offered to fetch it in [[his]131-henry barouche]4102-his barouche . Will it not be honourably conveyed ? ”[127-miss crawford] [Edmund]108-edmund spoke of the harp as [his]108-edmund favourite instrument , and hoped to be soon allowed to hear [her]824-her . [Fanny]113-fanny had never heard the harp at all , and wished for it very much . “ [I]127-miss crawford shall be most happy to play to [you]127-miss crawford both , ”[127-miss crawford] said [Miss Crawford]127-miss crawford ; “ at least as long as [you]127-miss crawford can like to listen : probably much longer , for [I]127-miss crawford dearly love music [myself]127-miss crawford , and where the natural taste is equal [the player]4103-the player must always be best off , for [she]4103-the player is gratified in more ways than one . Now , [Mr. Bertram]108-edmund , if [you]108-edmund write to [[your]108-edmund brother]3938-your brother , [I]127-miss crawford entreat [you]108-edmund to tell [him]3938-your brother that [my]127-miss crawford harp is come : [he]3938-your brother heard so much of [my]127-miss crawford misery about it . And [you]108-edmund may say , if [you]108-edmund please , that [I]127-miss crawford shall prepare [my]127-miss crawford most plaintive airs against [his]3938-your brother return , in compassion to [his]3938-your brother feelings , as [I]127-miss crawford know [his]3938-your brother horse will lose . ”[127-miss crawford] “ If [I]127-miss crawford write , [I]127-miss crawford will say whatever [you]108-edmund wish [me]127-miss crawford ; but [I]127-miss crawford do not , at present , foresee any occasion for writing . ”[127-miss crawford] “ No , [I]127-miss crawford dare say , nor if [he]3938-your brother were to be gone a twelvemonth , would [you]108-edmund ever write to [him]3938-your brother , nor [he]3938-your brother to [you]108-edmund , if it could be helped . The occasion would never be foreseen . What [strange creatures brothers]4105-strange creatures brothers are ! [You]108-edmund would not write to [each other]681-each other but upon the most urgent necessity in [the world]315-the world ; and when obliged to take up the pen to say that such a horse is ill , or [such a relation dead]4108-such a relation dead , it is done in the fewest possible words . [You]108-edmund have but one style among [you]108-edmund . [I]127-miss crawford know it perfectly . [Henry]131-henry , who is in every other respect exactly what [a brother]4109-a brother should be , who loves [me]127-miss crawford , consults [me]127-miss crawford , confides in [me]127-miss crawford , and will talk to [me]127-miss crawford by the hour together , has never yet turned the page in a letter ; and very often it is nothing more than—‘Dear [Mary]132-mary , [I]127-miss crawford am just arrived . [Bath]56-bath seems full , and everything as usual . [Yours]108-edmund sincerely . ’ That is the true manly style ; that is [a complete brother]4110-a complete brother ’s letter . ”[127-miss crawford] “ When [they]4111-they are at a distance from [all [their]4111-they family]4112-all their family , ”[113-fanny] said [Fanny]113-fanny , colouring for [William]228-william ’s sake , “ [they]4111-they can write long letters . ”[113-fanny] “ [Miss Price]137-miss price has [a brother at]4113-a brother at [sea]512-sea , ”[108-edmund] said [Edmund]108-edmund , “ whose excellence as [a correspondent]4115-a correspondent makes [her]137-miss price think [you]137-miss price too severe upon [us]4116-us . ”[108-edmund] “ At [sea]512-sea , has [she]137-miss price ? In [the king]4118-the king ’s service , of course ? ”[113-fanny] [Fanny]113-fanny would rather have had [Edmund]108-edmund tell the story , but [his]108-edmund determined silence obliged [her]825-her to relate [[her]825-her brother]451-her brother ’s situation : [her]825-her voice was animated in speaking of [his]108-edmund profession , and the foreign stations [he]108-edmund had been on ; but [she]825-her could not mention the number of years that [he]108-edmund had been absent without tears in [her]825-her eyes . [Miss Crawford]127-miss crawford civilly wished [him]108-edmund an early promotion . “ Do [you]127-miss crawford know anything of [[[my]108-edmund cousin]3764-my cousin ’s captain]4120-my cousin ’s captain ? ”[108-edmund] said [Edmund]108-edmund ; “ [Captain Marshall]150-captain marshall ? [You]127-miss crawford have a large acquaintance in [the navy]4121-the navy , [I]108-edmund conclude ? ”[108-edmund] “ Among [admirals]4122-admirals , large enough ; but , ”[825-her] with an air of grandeur , “ [we]4123-we know very little of the inferior ranks . [Post - captains]4124-post - captains may be very good sort of [men]395-men , but [they]4124-post - captains do not belong to _ [us]4123-we _ . Of [various admirals]4126-various admirals [I]108-edmund could tell [you]127-miss crawford a great deal : of [them]4126-various admirals and [their]4126-various admirals flags , and the gradation of [their]4126-various admirals pay , and [their]4126-various admirals bickerings and jealousies .
