[Fanny]113-fanny was [the only one of [the party who found anything to dislike]1183-the party who found anything to dislike]1182-the only one of the party who found anything to dislike ; but since the day at [Sotherton]27-sotherton , [she]1182-the only one of the party who found anything to dislike could never see [Mr. Crawford]133-mr. crawford with [either sister]1184-either sister without observation , and seldom without wonder or censure ; and had [her]1182-the only one of the party who found anything to dislike confidence in [her]1182-the only one of the party who found anything to dislike own judgment been equal to [her]1182-the only one of the party who found anything to dislike exercise of it in every other respect , had [she]1182-the only one of the party who found anything to dislike been sure that [she]1182-the only one of the party who found anything to dislike was seeing clearly , and judging candidly , [she]1182-the only one of the party who found anything to dislike would probably have made some important communications to [[her]1182-the only one of the party who found anything to dislike usual confidant]1185-her usual confidant . As it was , however , [she]1182-the only one of the party who found anything to dislike only hazarded a hint , and the hint was lost . “ [I]1182-the only one of the party who found anything to dislike am rather surprised , ”[1182-the only one of the party who found anything to dislike] said [she]1182-the only one of the party who found anything to dislike , “ that [Mr. Crawford]133-mr. crawford should come back again so soon , after being [here]3798-here so long before , full seven weeks ; for [I]1182-the only one of the party who found anything to dislike had understood [he]133-mr. crawford was so very fond of change and moving about , that [I]1182-the only one of the party who found anything to dislike thought something would certainly occur , when [he]133-mr. crawford was once gone , to take [him]133-mr. crawford elsewhere . [He]133-mr. crawford is used to [much gayer places than [Mansfield]3-mansfield]4580-much gayer places than mansfield . ”[1182-the only one of the party who found anything to dislike] “ It is to [his]133-mr. crawford credit , ”[108-edmund] was [Edmund]108-edmund ’s answer ; “ and [I]108-edmund dare say it gives [[his]133-mr. crawford sister]511-his sister pleasure . [Mrs. Grant]123-mrs. grant , [I]108-edmund believe , suspects [him]133-mr. crawford of a preference for [Julia]112-julia ; [I]108-edmund have never seen much symptom of it , but [I]108-edmund wish it may be so . [He]133-mr. crawford has no faults but what a serious attachment would remove . ”[108-edmund] “ If [Miss Bertram]112-julia were not engaged , ”[113-fanny] said [Fanny]113-fanny cautiously , “ [I]113-fanny could sometimes almost think that [he]133-mr. crawford admired [her]112-julia more than [Julia]112-julia . ”[113-fanny] “ Which is , perhaps , more in favour of [his]133-mr. crawford liking [Julia]112-julia best , than [you]113-fanny , [Fanny]113-fanny , may be aware ; for [I]108-edmund believe it often happens that [a man]4410-a man , before [he]4410-a man has quite made up [his]4410-a man own mind , will distinguish [the sister or intimate friend of [the woman [he]4410-a man is really thinking of more than [the woman]4587-the woman [herself]4587-the woman]4586-the woman he is really thinking of more than the woman herself]4585-the sister or intimate friend of the woman he is really thinking of more than the woman herself . [Crawford]133-mr. crawford has too much sense to stay [here]3798-here if [he]133-mr. crawford found [himself]133-mr. crawford in any danger from [Maria]126-maria ; and [I]108-edmund am not at all afraid for [her]126-maria , after such a proof as [she]126-maria has given that [her]126-maria feelings are not strong . ”[108-edmund] [Fanny]113-fanny supposed [she]1186-she must have been mistaken , and meant to think differently in future ; but with all that submission to [Edmund]108-edmund could do , and all the help of the coinciding looks and hints which [she]1186-she occasionally noticed in some of the others , and which seemed to say that [Julia]112-julia was [Mr. Crawford]133-mr. crawford ’s choice , [she]1186-she knew not always what to think . [She]1186-she was privy , one evening , to the hopes of [[her]1186-she aunt]463-her aunt [Norris]105-mrs. norris on the subject , as well as to [her]1186-she feelings , and the feelings of [Mrs. Rushworth]126-maria , on a point of some similarity , and could not help wondering as [she]1186-she listened ; and glad would [she]1186-she have been not to be obliged to listen , for it was while [all the other young people]1188-all the other young people were dancing , and [she]1186-she sitting , most unwillingly , among [the chaperons at the fire]1189-the chaperons at the fire , longing for the re - entrance of [[her]1186-she elder cousin]1190-her elder cousin , on whom all [her]1186-she own hopes of [a partner]1191-a partner then depended . It was [Fanny]113-fanny ’s first ball , though without the preparation or splendour of many [a young lady]1192-a young lady ’s first ball , being the thought only of the afternoon , built on the late acquisition of [a violin player in [[the servants]601-the servants ’ hall]1195-the servants ’ hall]1193-a violin player in the servants ’ hall , and the possibility of raising [five couple]1196-five couple with the help of [Mrs. Grant]123-mrs. grant and [a new intimate friend of [Mr. Bertram]108-edmund ’s]1197-a new intimate friend of mr. bertram ’s just arrived on a visit . It had , however , been a very happy one to [Fanny]113-fanny through four dances , and [she]1186-she was quite grieved to be losing even a quarter of an hour . While waiting and wishing , looking now at [the dancers]1198-the dancers and now at the door , this dialogue between [the two above - mentioned ladies]1199-the two above - mentioned ladies was forced on [her]1186-she — “ [I]105-mrs. norris think , [ma’am]4007-ma’am , ”[105-mrs. norris] said [Mrs. Norris]105-mrs. norris , [her]105-mrs. norris eyes directed towards [Mr. Rushworth]113-fanny and [Maria]126-maria , who were [partners]1200-partners for the second time , “ [we]4590-we shall see [some happy faces]4591-some happy faces again now . ”[105-mrs. norris] “ Yes , [ma’am]4007-ma’am , indeed , ”[477-the other] replied [the other]477-the other , with a stately simper , “ there will be some satisfaction in looking on _ now _ , and [I]477-the other think it was rather a pity [they]1199-the two above - mentioned ladies should have been obliged to part . [Mr. Rushworth]113-fanny is never remiss . [Mrs. Norris]105-mrs. norris continued , “ It is quite delightful , [ma’am]4007-ma’am , to see [young people]4599-young people so properly happy , so well suited , and so much the thing ! [I]105-mrs. norris can not but think of dear Sir [Thomas]101-sir thomas ’s delight . And what do [you]4007-ma’am say , [ma’am]4007-ma’am , to the chance of another match ? [Mr. Rushworth]113-fanny has set a good example , and such things are very catching . ”[105-mrs. norris] [Mrs. Rushworth]126-maria , who saw nothing but [[her]126-maria son]637-her son , was quite at a loss . “ [The couple above]4601-the couple above , [ma’am]4007-ma’am . What is [his]133-mr. crawford property ? ”[105-mrs. norris] “ Four thousand a year . ”[105-mrs. norris] “ Very well . [Those who have not more]4603-those who have not more must be satisfied with what [they]4603-those who have not more have . Four thousand a year is [a pretty estate]4604-a pretty estate , and [he]133-mr. crawford seems [a very genteel , steady young man]4605-a very genteel , steady young man , so [I]126-maria hope [Miss Julia]112-julia will be very happy . ”[126-maria] “ It is not a settled thing , [ma’am]4007-ma’am , yet . [We]4607-we only speak of it among [friends]3751-friends . But [I]113-fanny have very little doubt it _ will _ be . [He]133-mr. crawford is growing extremely particular in [his]133-mr. crawford attentions . ”[113-fanny] [Fanny]113-fanny could listen no farther . Listening and wondering were all suspended for a time , for [Mr. Bertram]108-edmund was in [the room]412-the room again ; and though feeling it would be a great honour to be asked by [him]108-edmund , [she]1206-her thought it must happen . [He]108-edmund came towards [their]1207-their little circle ; but instead of asking [her]1206-her to dance , drew a chair near [her]1206-her , and gave [her]1206-her an account of the present state of a sick horse , and the opinion of [the groom]1208-the groom , from whom [he]108-edmund had just parted . [Fanny]113-fanny found that it was not to be , and in the modesty of [her]1206-her nature immediately felt that [she]1206-her had been unreasonable in expecting it . When [he]108-edmund had told of [his]108-edmund horse , [he]108-edmund took a newspaper from the table , and looking over it , said in a languid way , “ If [you]1206-her want to dance , [Fanny]113-fanny , [I]108-edmund will stand up with [you]1206-her . ”[108-edmund] With more than equal civility the offer was declined ; [she]1206-her did not wish to dance . “ [I]108-edmund am glad of it , ”[108-edmund] said [he]108-edmund , in a much brisker tone , and throwing down the newspaper again , “ for [I]108-edmund am tired to death . [I]108-edmund only wonder how [the good people]4609-the good people can keep it up so long . [They]4609-the good people had need be _ all _ in love , to find any amusement in such folly ; and so [they]4609-the good people are , [I]108-edmund fancy . If [you]4610-you look at [them]4609-the good people [you]4610-you may see [they]4609-the good people are so many couple of [lovers]4611-lovers — all but [Yates]174-mr. yates and [Mrs. Grant]123-mrs. grant — and , between [ourselves]4612-ourselves , [she]123-mrs. grant , [poor woman]384-poor woman , must want [a lover]4614-a lover as much as [any one of [them]4609-the good people]4615-any one of them . A desperate dull life [hers]123-mrs. grant must be with [the doctor]572-the doctor , ”[108-edmund] making a sly face as [he]1209-i spoke towards the chair of [the latter]972-the latter , who proving , however , to be close at [his]1209-i elbow , made so instantaneous a change of expression and subject necessary , as [Fanny]113-fanny , in spite of everything , could hardly help laughing at . “ A strange business this in [America]41-america , [Dr. Grant]121-dr. grant ! What is [your]121-dr. grant opinion ? [I]1209-i always come to [you]121-dr. grant to know what [I]1209-i am to think of public matters . ”[1209-i] “ [[My]630-his aunt dear]3657-my dear [Tom]101-sir thomas , ”[630-his aunt] cried [[his]1209-i aunt]630-his aunt soon afterwards , “ as [you]101-sir thomas are not dancing , [I]630-his aunt dare say [you]101-sir thomas will have no objection to join [us]4618-we in a rubber ; shall [you]101-sir thomas ? ”[630-his aunt] Then leaving [her]630-his aunt seat , and coming to [him]1209-i to enforce the proposal , added in a whisper , “ [We]4618-we want to make a table for [Mrs. Rushworth]126-maria , [you]101-sir thomas know . [[Your]101-sir thomas mother]4140-your mother is quite anxious about it , but can not very well spare time to sit down [herself]4140-your mother , because of [her]4140-your mother fringe . Now , [you]101-sir thomas and [I]630-his aunt and [Dr. Grant]121-dr. grant will just do ; and though _ [we]4618-we _ play but half - crowns , [you]101-sir thomas know , [you]101-sir thomas may bet half - guineas with _ [him]1209-i _ . ”[630-his aunt] “ [I]1209-i should be most happy , ”[1209-i] replied [he]1209-i aloud , and jumping up with alacrity , “ it would give [me]1209-i the greatest pleasure ; but that [I]1209-i am this moment going to dance . Come , [Fanny]113-fanny , ”[1209-i] taking [her]1212-her hand , “ do not be dawdling any longer , or the dance will be over . ”[1209-i] [Fanny]113-fanny was led off very willingly , though it was impossible for [her]1212-her to feel much gratitude towards [[her]1212-her cousin]3692-her cousin , or distinguish , as [he]1209-i certainly did , between the selfishness of [another person]1214-another person and [his]1209-i own . “ A pretty modest request upon [my]1209-i word , ”[1209-i] [he]1209-i indignantly exclaimed as [they]1215-they walked away . “ To want to nail [me]1209-i to a card - table for the next two hours with [herself]113-fanny and [Dr. Grant]121-dr. grant , who are always quarrelling , and that [poking old woman , who knows no more of whist than of algebra]4620-poking old woman , who knows no more of whist than of algebra . [I]1209-i wish [[my]1209-i good aunt]4621-my good aunt would be a little less busy ! And to ask [me]1209-i in such a way too ! without ceremony , before [them]1215-they all , so as to leave [me]1209-i no possibility of refusing . _ That _ is what [I]1209-i dislike most particularly . It raises [my]1209-i spleen more than anything , to have the pretence of being asked , of being given a choice , and at the same time addressed in such a way as to oblige one to do the very thing , whatever it be ! If [I]1209-i had not luckily thought of standing up with [you]4622-you [I]1209-i could not have got out of it . It is a great deal too bad . But when [[my]1209-i aunt]3803-my aunt has got a fancy in [her]3803-my aunt head , nothing can stop [her]3803-my aunt . ”[1209-i] CHAPTER XIII [The Honourable John Yates]175-the honourable john yates , [this new friend]1216-this new friend , had not much to recommend [him]175-the honourable john yates beyond habits of fashion and expense , and being [the younger son of [a lord with a tolerable independence]1218-a lord with a tolerable independence]1217-the younger son of a lord with a tolerable independence ; and [Sir Thomas]101-sir thomas would probably have thought [his]101-sir thomas introduction at [Mansfield]3-mansfield by no means desirable . [Mr. Bertram]108-edmund ’s acquaintance with [him]175-the honourable john yates had begun at [Weymouth]40-weymouth , where [they]1219-they had spent ten days together in the same society , and the friendship , if friendship it might be called , had been proved and perfected by [Mr. Yates]174-mr. yates ’s being invited to take [Mansfield]3-mansfield in [his]174-mr. yates way , whenever [he]174-mr. yates could , and by [his]174-mr. yates promising to come ; and [he]174-mr. yates did come rather earlier than had been expected , in consequence of the sudden breaking - up of a large party assembled for gaiety at [the house of [another friend]1221-another friend]1220-the house of another friend , which [he]174-mr. yates had left [Weymouth]40-weymouth to join . [He]174-mr. yates came on the wings of disappointment , and with [his]174-mr. yates head full of acting , for it had been a theatrical party ; and the play in which [he]174-mr. yates had borne a part was within two days of representation , when the sudden death of [one of [the nearest connexions of [the family]3724-the family]1223-the nearest connexions of the family]1222-one of the nearest connexions of the family had destroyed the scheme and dispersed [the performers]1225-the performers . To be so near happiness , so near fame , so near the long paragraph in praise of [the private theatricals at [Ecclesford]42-ecclesford]1226-the private theatricals at ecclesford , the seat of [the Right Hon .]1227-the right hon . [Lord Ravenshaw]176-lord ravenshaw , in [Cornwall]43-cornwall , which would of course have immortalised [the whole party]1003-the whole party for at least a twelvemonth ! and being so near , to lose it all , was an injury to be keenly felt , and [Mr. Yates]174-mr. yates could talk of nothing else . [Ecclesford]42-ecclesford and [[its]42-ecclesford theatre]1229-its theatre , with [its]42-ecclesford arrangements and dresses , rehearsals and jokes , was [his]174-mr. yates never - failing subject , and to boast of the past [his]174-mr. yates only consolation . Happily for [him]174-mr. yates , a love of [the theatre]1230-the theatre is so general , an itch for acting so strong among [young people]4599-young people , that [he]174-mr. yates could hardly out - talk the interest of [[his]174-mr. yates hearers]1232-his hearers . From the first casting of the parts to the epilogue it was all bewitching , and there were [few who did not wish to have been a party concerned]1233-few who did not wish to have been a party concerned , or would have hesitated to try [their]1233-few who did not wish to have been a party concerned skill . The play had been [Lovers]177-lovers ’ Vows , and [Mr. Yates]174-mr. yates was to have been [Count Cassel]178-anhalt . “ A trifling part , ”[174-mr. yates] said [he]174-mr. yates , “ and not at all to [my]174-mr. yates taste , and such a one as [I]174-mr. yates certainly would not accept again ; but [I]174-mr. yates was determined to make no difficulties . [Lord Ravenshaw]176-lord ravenshaw and [the duke]4624-the duke had appropriated the only two characters worth playing before [I]174-mr. yates reached [Ecclesford]42-ecclesford ; and though [Lord Ravenshaw]176-lord ravenshaw offered to resign [his]176-lord ravenshaw to [me]174-mr. yates , it was impossible to take it , [you]4625-you know . [I]174-mr. yates was sorry for _ [him]176-lord ravenshaw _ that [he]176-lord ravenshaw should have so mistaken [his]176-lord ravenshaw powers , for [he]176-lord ravenshaw was no more equal to [the Baron]4626-the baron — [a little man with a weak voice , always hoarse after the first ten minutes]4627-a little man with a weak voice , always hoarse after the first ten minutes . It must have injured the piece materially ; but _ [I]174-mr. yates _ was resolved to make no difficulties . [Sir Henry]179-sir henry thought [the duke]4624-the duke not equal to [Frederick]180-frederick , but that was because [Sir Henry]179-sir henry wanted the part [himself]179-sir henry ; whereas it was certainly in the best hands of [the two]390-the two . [I]174-mr. yates was surprised to see [Sir Henry]179-sir henry such a stick . Luckily the strength of the piece did not depend upon [him]179-sir henry . [Our]4630-our [Agatha]181-agatha was inimitable , and [the duke]4624-the duke was thought very great by [many]4303-many . And upon the whole , it would certainly have gone off wonderfully . ”[174-mr. yates] “ It was a hard case , upon [my]177-lovers word ”[177-lovers] ; and , “ [I]174-mr. yates do think [you]4633-you were very much to be pitied , ”[174-mr. yates] were the kind responses of listening sympathy . “ It is not worth complaining about ; but to be sure [the poor old dowager]4634-the poor old dowager could not have died at a worse time ; and it is impossible to help wishing that the news could have been suppressed for just the three days [we]4630-our wanted . It was but three days ; and being only [a grandmother]4635-a grandmother , and all happening two hundred miles off , [I]174-mr. yates think there would have been no great harm , and it was suggested , [I]174-mr. yates know ; but [Lord Ravenshaw]176-lord ravenshaw , who [I]174-mr. yates suppose is [one of [the most correct men in [England]14-england]4637-the most correct men in england]4636-one of the most correct men in england , would not hear of it . ”[174-mr. yates] “ An afterpiece instead of a comedy , ”[108-edmund] said [Mr. Bertram]108-edmund . “ [Lovers]4611-lovers ’ Vows were at an end , and [Lord]4639-lord and [Lady Ravenshaw]182-lady ravenshaw left to act [[My]108-edmund Grandmother]4640-my grandmother by [themselves]4641-themselves . Well , the jointure may comfort _ [him]176-lord ravenshaw _ ; and perhaps , between [friends]3751-friends , [he]176-lord ravenshaw began to tremble for [his]176-lord ravenshaw credit and [his]176-lord ravenshaw lungs in [the Baron]4626-the baron , and was not sorry to withdraw ; and to make _ [you]4644-you _ amends , [Yates]174-mr. yates , [I]108-edmund think [we]4645-we must raise [a little theatre at [Mansfield]3-mansfield]4646-a little theatre at mansfield , and ask [you]4644-you to be [[our]4645-we manager]4647-our manager . ”[108-edmund] This , though the thought of the moment , did not end with the moment ; for the inclination to act was awakened , and in [no one]404-no one more strongly than in [him]1235-him who was now [master of [the house]427-the house]1236-master of the house ; and who , having so much leisure as to make almost any novelty a certain good , had likewise such a degree of lively talents and comic taste , as were exactly adapted to the novelty of acting . The thought returned again and again . “ Oh for the Ecclesford theatre and scenery to try something with . ”[332-each sister] [Each sister]332-each sister could echo the wish ; and [Henry Crawford]131-henry , to whom , in all the riot of [his]131-henry gratifications it was yet an untasted pleasure , was quite alive at the idea . “ [I]131-henry really believe , ”[131-henry] said [he]131-henry , “ [I]131-henry could be fool enough at this moment to undertake any character that ever was written , from [Shylock]183-shylock or [Richard III]180-frederick down to [the singing hero of a farce in [his]131-henry scarlet coat and cocked hat]4648-the singing hero of a farce in his scarlet coat and cocked hat . [I]131-henry feel as if [I]131-henry could be anything or everything ; as if [I]131-henry could rant and storm , or sigh or cut capers , in any tragedy or comedy in the English language . Let [us]4645-we be doing something . Be it only half a play , an act , a scene ; what should prevent [us]4645-we ? Not these countenances , [I]131-henry am sure , ”[131-henry] looking towards [the Miss Bertrams]114-the miss bertrams ; “ and for [a theatre]4649-a theatre , what signifies [a theatre]4649-a theatre ? [We]4645-we shall be only amusing [ourselves]4645-we . [Any room in [this house]3707-this house]4651-any room in this house might suffice . ”[131-henry] “ [We]4645-we must have a curtain , ”[101-sir thomas] said [Tom Bertram]101-sir thomas ; “ a few yards of green baize for a curtain , and perhaps that may be enough . ”[101-sir thomas] “ Oh , quite enough , ”[174-mr. yates] cried [Mr. Yates]174-mr. yates , “ with only just a side wing or two run up , doors in flat , and three or four scenes to be let down ; nothing more would be necessary on such a plan as this . For mere amusement among [ourselves]4645-we [we]4645-we should want nothing more . ”[174-mr. yates] “ [I]126-maria believe [we]4645-we must be satisfied with _ less _ , ”[126-maria] said [Maria]126-maria . “ There would not be time , and other difficulties would arise . [We]4645-we must rather adopt [Mr. Crawford]133-mr. crawford ’s views , and make the _ performance _ , not the _ theatre _ , [our]4645-we object . Many parts of [our]4645-we best plays are independent of scenery . ”[126-maria] “ Nay , ”[108-edmund] said [Edmund]108-edmund , who began to listen with alarm . “ Let [us]4645-we do nothing by halves . If [we]4645-we are to act , let it be in [a theatre completely fitted up with pit , boxes , and [gallery]4654-gallery]4653-a theatre completely fitted up with pit , boxes , and gallery , and let [us]4645-we have a play entire from beginning to end ; so as it be a German play , no matter what , with a good tricking , shifting afterpiece , and a figure - dance , and a hornpipe , and a song between the acts . If [we]4645-we do not outdo [Ecclesford]42-ecclesford , [we]4645-we do nothing . ”[108-edmund] “ Now , [Edmund]108-edmund , do not be disagreeable , ”[112-julia] said [Julia]112-julia . “ [Nobody]360-nobody loves a play better than [you]108-edmund do , or can have gone much farther to see one . ”[112-julia] “ True , to see real acting , good hardened real acting ; but [I]126-maria would hardly walk from [this room]4656-this room to the next to look at the raw efforts of [those who have not been bred to the trade]4657-those who have not been bred to the trade : a set of [gentlemen]789-gentlemen and [ladies , who have all the disadvantages of education and decorum to struggle through]4659-ladies , who have all the disadvantages of education and decorum to struggle through . ”[126-maria] After a short pause , however , the subject still continued , and was discussed with unabated eagerness , [every one]1239-every one ’s inclination increasing by the discussion , and a knowledge of the inclination of the rest ; and though nothing was settled but that [Tom Bertram]101-sir thomas would prefer a comedy , and [[his]101-sir thomas sisters]4166-his sisters and [Henry Crawford]131-henry a tragedy , and that nothing in [the world]315-the world could be easier than to find a piece which would please [them]1242-them all , the resolution to act something or other seemed so decided as to make [Edmund]108-edmund quite uncomfortable . [He]108-edmund was determined to prevent it , if possible , though [[his]108-edmund mother]629-his mother , who equally heard the conversation which passed at table , did not evince the least disapprobation . The same evening afforded [him]108-edmund an opportunity of trying [his]108-edmund strength . [Maria]126-maria , [Julia]112-julia , [Henry Crawford]131-henry , and [Mr. Yates]174-mr. yates were in [the billiard - room]1244-the billiard - room . [Tom]101-sir thomas , returning from [them]1242-them into [the drawing - room]420-the drawing - room , where [Edmund]108-edmund was standing thoughtfully by the fire , while [Lady Bertram]106-lady bertram was on the sofa at a little distance , and [Fanny]113-fanny close beside [her]106-lady bertram arranging [her]106-lady bertram work , thus began as [he]108-edmund entered—“Such a horribly vile billiard - table as ours is not to be met with , [I]113-fanny believe , above ground . [I]113-fanny can stand it no longer , and [I]113-fanny think , [I]113-fanny may say , that nothing shall ever tempt [me]113-fanny to it again ; but one good thing [I]113-fanny have just ascertained : it is [the very room for [a theatre]4649-a theatre]4660-the very room for a theatre , precisely the shape and length for [it]4649-a theatre ; and the doors at the farther end , communicating with each other , as they may be made to do in five minutes , by merely moving the bookcase in [[[my]113-fanny father]3762-my father ’s room]4663-my father ’s room , is the very thing [we]4664-we could have desired , if [we]4664-we had sat down to wish for it ; and [[[my]113-fanny father]3762-my father ’s room]4663-my father ’s room will be [an excellent greenroom]4667-an excellent greenroom . It seems to join [the billiard - room]1244-the billiard - room on purpose . ”[113-fanny] “ [You]108-edmund are not serious , [Tom]101-sir thomas , in meaning to act ? ”[108-edmund] said [Edmund]108-edmund , in a low voice , as [[his]108-edmund brother]805-his brother approached the fire . “ Not serious ! never more so , [I]108-edmund assure [you]108-edmund . What is there to surprise [you]108-edmund in it ? ”[108-edmund] “ [I]113-fanny think it would be very wrong . In a _ general _ light , private theatricals are open to some objections , but as _ [we]4664-we _ are circumstanced , [I]113-fanny must think it would be highly injudicious , and more than injudicious to attempt anything of the kind . It would [shew]4669-shew great want of feeling on [[my]113-fanny father]3762-my father ’s account , absent as [he]3762-my father is , and in some degree of constant danger ; and it would be imprudent , [I]113-fanny think , with regard to [Maria]126-maria , whose situation is a very delicate one , considering everything , extremely delicate . ”[113-fanny] “ [You]108-edmund take up a thing so seriously ! as if [we]4664-we were going to act three times a week till [[my]1247-i father]3762-my father ’s return , and invite all [the country]493-the country . But it is not to be a display of that sort . [We]4664-we mean nothing but a little amusement among [ourselves]4664-we , just to vary the scene , and exercise [our]4664-we powers in something new . [We]4664-we want [no audience]4673-no audience , no publicity . [We]4664-we may be trusted , [I]1247-i think , in chusing some play most perfectly unexceptionable ; and [I]1247-i can conceive no greater harm or danger to any of [us]4664-we in conversing in the elegant written language of [some respectable author]4674-some respectable author than in chattering in words of [our]4664-we own . [I]1247-i have no fears and no scruples . And as to [[my]1247-i father]3762-my father ’s being absent , it is so far from an objection , that [I]1247-i consider it rather as a motive ; for the expectation of [his]3762-my father return must be a very anxious period to [[my]1247-i mother]3827-my mother ; and if [we]4664-we can be the means of amusing that anxiety , and keeping up [her]3827-my mother spirits for the next few weeks , [I]1247-i shall think [our]4664-we time very well spent , and so , [I]1247-i am sure , will [he]3762-my father . It is a _ very _ anxious period for [her]3827-my mother . ”[1247-i] As [he]1247-i said this , [each]1248-each looked towards [[their]1248-each mother]1249-their mother . [Lady Bertram]106-lady bertram , sunk back in one corner of the sofa , the picture of health , wealth , ease , and tranquillity , was just falling into a gentle doze , while [Fanny]113-fanny was getting through the few difficulties of [her]106-lady bertram work for [her]106-lady bertram . [Edmund]108-edmund smiled and shook [his]108-edmund head . “ By [Jove]185-jove ! this wo n’t do , ”[101-sir thomas] cried [Tom]101-sir thomas , throwing [himself]101-sir thomas into a chair with a hearty laugh . “ To be sure , [[my]101-sir thomas dear mother]4677-my dear mother , [your]4677-my dear mother anxiety — [I]101-sir thomas was unlucky there . ”[101-sir thomas] “ What is the matter ? ”[921-her ladyship] asked [[her]1249-their mother ladyship]921-her ladyship , in the heavy tone of one half - roused ; “ [I]921-her ladyship was not asleep . ”[921-her ladyship] “ Oh dear , no , [ma’am]4007-ma’am , [nobody]360-nobody suspected [you]921-her ladyship ! Well , [Edmund]108-edmund , ”[108-edmund] [he]108-edmund continued , returning to the former subject , posture , and voice , as soon as [Lady Bertram]106-lady bertram began to nod again , “ but _ this _ [I]106-lady bertram _ will _ maintain , that [we]4680-we shall be doing no harm . ”[106-lady bertram] “ [I]921-her ladyship can not agree with [you]108-edmund ; [I]921-her ladyship am convinced that [[my]921-her ladyship father]3762-my father would totally disapprove it . ”[921-her ladyship] “ And [I]106-lady bertram am convinced to the contrary . [Nobody]360-nobody is fonder of the exercise of talent in [young people]4599-young people , or promotes it more , than [[my]106-lady bertram father]3762-my father , and for anything of the acting , spouting , reciting kind , [I]106-lady bertram think [he]3762-my father has always a decided taste . [I]106-lady bertram am sure [he]3762-my father encouraged it in [us]4680-we as [boys]4685-boys . How many a time have [we]4680-we mourned over the dead body of [Julius Caesar]186-julius caesar , and to _ be’d _ and not _ to _ _ be’d _ , in [this very room]4686-this very room , for [his]3762-my father amusement ? And [I]106-lady bertram am sure , _ [my]106-lady bertram _ _ name _ _ was _ _ Norval _ , every evening of [my]106-lady bertram life through one Christmas holidays . ”[106-lady bertram] “ It was a very different thing . [You]106-lady bertram must see the difference [yourself]106-lady bertram . [[My]106-lady bertram father]3762-my father wished [us]4680-we , as [schoolboys]4688-schoolboys , to speak well , but [he]3762-my father would never wish [[his]3762-my father grown - up daughters]4689-his grown - up daughters to be acting plays . [His]3762-my father sense of decorum is strict . ”[106-lady bertram] “ [I]101-sir thomas know all that , ”[101-sir thomas] said [Tom]101-sir thomas , displeased . “ [I]101-sir thomas know [[my]101-sir thomas father]3762-my father as well as [you]106-lady bertram do ; and [I]101-sir thomas ’ll take care that [[his]3762-my father daughters]498-his daughters do nothing to distress [him]3762-my father . Manage [your]106-lady bertram own concerns , [Edmund]108-edmund , and [I]101-sir thomas ’ll take care of [the rest of [the family]3724-the family]618-the rest of the family . ”[101-sir thomas] “ If [you]106-lady bertram are resolved on acting , ”[108-edmund] replied the persevering [Edmund]108-edmund , “ [I]108-edmund must hope it will be in a very small and quiet way ; and [I]108-edmund think a theatre ought not to be attempted . It would be taking liberties with [[[my]108-edmund father]3762-my father ’s house]4695-my father ’s house in [his]3762-my father absence which could not be justified . ”[108-edmund] “ For everything of that nature [I]101-sir thomas will be answerable , ”[101-sir thomas] said [Tom]101-sir thomas , in a decided tone . “ [[His]3762-my father house]4696-his house shall not be hurt . [I]101-sir thomas have quite as great an interest in being careful of [[his]3762-my father house]4696-his house as [you]106-lady bertram can have ; and as to such alterations as [I]101-sir thomas was suggesting just now , such as moving a bookcase , or unlocking a door , or even as using [the billiard - room]1244-the billiard - room for the space of a week without playing at billiards in it , [you]106-lady bertram might just as well suppose [he]3762-my father would object to [our]4699-we sitting more in [this room]4656-this room , and less in [the breakfast - room]3756-the breakfast - room , than [we]4699-we did before [he]3762-my father went away , or to [[my]101-sir thomas sister]3790-my sister ’s pianoforte being moved from one side of [the room]412-the room to the other . Absolute nonsense ! ”[101-sir thomas] “ The innovation , if not wrong as an innovation , will be wrong as an expense . ”[108-edmund] “ Yes , the expense of such an undertaking would be prodigious ! Perhaps it might cost a whole twenty pounds . Something of a theatre [we]4699-we must have undoubtedly , but it will be on the simplest plan : a green curtain and [a little carpenter]4704-a little carpenter ’s work , and that ’s all ; and as [the carpenter]4705-the carpenter ’s work may be all done at [home]367-home by [Christopher Jackson]187-christopher jackson [himself]187-christopher jackson , it will be too absurd to talk of expense ; and as long as [Jackson]187-christopher jackson is employed , everything will be right with [Sir Thomas]101-sir thomas . Do n’t imagine that [[nobody]360-nobody in [this house]3707-this house]4708-nobody in this house can see or judge but [yourself]108-edmund . Do n’t act [yourself]108-edmund , if [you]108-edmund do not like it , but do n’t expect to govern [everybody else]458-everybody else . ”[101-sir thomas] “ No , as to acting [myself]108-edmund , ”[108-edmund] said [Edmund]108-edmund , “ _ that _ [I]108-edmund absolutely protest against . ”[108-edmund] [Tom]101-sir thomas walked out of [the room]412-the room as [he]101-sir thomas said it , and [Edmund]108-edmund was left to sit down and stir the fire in thoughtful vexation . [Fanny]113-fanny , who had heard it all , and [borne Edmund]108-edmund company in every feeling throughout the whole , now ventured to say , in [her]1252-i anxiety to suggest some comfort , “ Perhaps [they]4711-they may not be able to find any play to suit [them]4711-they . [[Your]108-edmund brother]3938-your brother ’s taste and [[your]108-edmund sisters]4713-your sisters ’ seem very different . ”[1252-i] “ [I]1252-i have no hope there , [Fanny]113-fanny . If [they]4711-they persist in the scheme , [they]4711-they will find something . [I]1252-i shall speak to [[my]1252-i sisters]4714-my sisters and try to dissuade _ [them]4714-my sisters _ , and that is all [I]1252-i can do . ”[1252-i] “ [I]1252-i should think [[my]1252-i aunt]3803-my aunt [Norris]105-mrs. norris would be on [your]1252-i side . ”[1252-i] “ [I]1253-i dare say [she]105-mrs. norris would , but [she]105-mrs. norris has no influence with either [Tom]101-sir thomas or [[my]1253-i sisters]4714-my sisters that could be of any use ; and if [I]1253-i can not convince [them]4714-my sisters [myself]1253-i , [I]1253-i shall let things take [their]4714-my sisters course , without attempting it through [her]105-mrs. norris . Family squabbling is the greatest evil of all , and [we]4717-we had better do anything than be altogether by the ears . ”[1253-i] [[His]1253-i sisters]4166-his sisters , to whom [he]1253-i had an opportunity of speaking the next morning , were quite as impatient of [his]1253-i advice , quite as unyielding to [his]1253-i representation , quite as determined in the cause of pleasure , as [Tom]101-sir thomas . [[Their]4166-his sisters mother]1249-their mother had no objection to the plan , and [they]4166-his sisters were not in the least afraid of [[their]4166-his sisters father]398-their father ’s disapprobation . There could be no harm in what had been done in so many [respectable families]1257-respectable families , and by so many [women of the first consideration]1258-women of the first consideration ; and it must be scrupulousness run mad that could see anything to censure in a plan like [theirs]4166-his sisters , comprehending only [brothers]3675-brothers and [sisters]3676-sisters and [intimate friends]1261-intimate friends , and which would never be heard of beyond [themselves]4166-his sisters . [Julia]112-julia _ did _ seem inclined to admit that [Maria]126-maria ’s situation might require particular caution and delicacy — but that could not extend to _ [her_—she]1262-her_—she was at liberty ; and [Maria]126-maria evidently considered [her]126-maria engagement as only raising [her]126-maria so much more above restraint , and leaving [her]126-maria less occasion than [Julia]112-julia to consult either [father]1263-father or [mother]3977-mother . [Edmund]108-edmund had little to hope , but [he]108-edmund was still urging the subject when [Henry Crawford]131-henry entered [the room]412-the room , fresh from [the Parsonage]368-the parsonage , calling out , “ No want of hands in [[our]4718-our theatre]4719-our theatre , [Miss Bertram]112-julia . No want of understrappers : [[my]131-henry sister]3790-my sister desires [her]3790-my sister love , and hopes to be admitted into [the company]4721-the company , and will be happy to take the part of [any old duenna]4722-any old duenna or [tame confidante]4723-tame confidante , that [you]108-edmund may not like to do [yourselves]108-edmund . ”[131-henry] [Maria]126-maria gave [Edmund]108-edmund a glance , which meant , “ What say [you]108-edmund now ? Can [we]4724-we be wrong if [Mary Crawford]132-mary feels the same ? ”[108-edmund] And [Edmund]108-edmund , silenced , was obliged to acknowledge that the charm of acting might well carry fascination to the mind of genius ; and with the ingenuity of love , to dwell more on the obliging , accommodating purport of the message than on anything else . The scheme advanced . [Opposition]188-opposition was vain ; and as to [Mrs. Norris]105-mrs. norris , [he]108-edmund was mistaken in supposing [she]105-mrs. norris would wish to make any . [She]105-mrs. norris started no difficulties that were not talked down in five minutes by [[her]105-mrs. norris eldest nephew]1267-her eldest nephew and niece , who were all - powerful with [her]105-mrs. norris ; and as the whole arrangement was to bring very little expense to [anybody]3668-anybody , and none at all to [herself]105-mrs. norris , as [she]105-mrs. norris foresaw in it all the comforts of hurry , bustle , and importance , and derived the immediate advantage of fancying [herself]105-mrs. norris obliged to leave [[her]105-mrs. norris own house]1269-her own house , where [she]105-mrs. norris had been living a month at [her]105-mrs. norris own cost , and take up [her]105-mrs. norris abode in [theirs]1270-theirs , that every hour might be spent in [their]1270-theirs service , [she]105-mrs. norris was , in fact , exceedingly delighted with the project . [CHAPTER XIV Fanny]113-fanny seemed nearer being right than [Edmund]108-edmund had supposed . The business of finding a play that would suit [everybody]408-everybody proved to be no trifle ; and [the carpenter]4705-the carpenter had received [his]4705-the carpenter orders and taken [his]4705-the carpenter measurements , had suggested and removed at least two sets of difficulties , and having made the necessity of an enlargement of plan and expense fully evident , was already at work , while a play was still to seek . Other preparations were also in hand . An enormous roll of green baize had arrived from [Northampton]8-northampton , and been cut out by [Mrs. Norris]105-mrs. norris ( with a saving by [her]105-mrs. norris good management of full three - quarters of a yard ) , and was actually forming into a curtain by [the housemaids]3718-the housemaids , and still the play was wanting ; and as two or three days passed away in this manner , [Edmund]108-edmund began almost to hope that none might ever be found . There were , in fact , so many things to be attended to , so many [people]3906-people to be pleased , so many best characters required , and , above all , such a need that the play should be at once both tragedy and comedy , that there did seem as little chance of a decision as anything pursued by youth and zeal could hold out . On the tragic side were [the Miss Bertrams]114-the miss bertrams , [Henry Crawford]131-henry , and [Mr. Yates]174-mr. yates ; on the comic , [Tom Bertram]101-sir thomas , not _ quite _ alone , because it was evident that [Mary Crawford]132-mary ’s wishes , though politely kept back , inclined the same way : but [his]101-sir thomas determinateness and [his]101-sir thomas power seemed to make [allies]1275-allies unnecessary ; and , independent of this great irreconcilable difference , [they]1276-they wanted a piece containing [very few characters in the whole]1277-very few characters in the whole , but every character first - rate , and [three principal women]1278-three principal women . All the best plays were run over in vain . Neither Hamlet , nor [Macbeth]190-macbeth , nor Othello , nor [Douglas]191-douglas , nor [The Gamester]1279-the gamester , presented anything that could satisfy even [the tragedians]1280-the tragedians ; and [The Rivals]1281-the rivals , [The School for Scandal]44-the school for scandal , [Wheel of Fortune]192-wheel of fortune , Heir at Law , and a long et cetera , were successively dismissed with yet warmer objections . No piece could be proposed that did not supply [somebody]1115-somebody with a difficulty , and on one side or the other it was a continual repetition of , “ Oh no , _ that _ will never do ! Let [us]4725-we have no ranting tragedies . [Too many characters]4726-too many characters . Not [a tolerable woman]4727-a tolerable woman ’s part in the play . Anything but _ that _ , [[my]113-fanny dear]3657-my dear [Tom]101-sir thomas . It would be impossible to fill it up . [One]766-one could not expect [anybody]3668-anybody to take such a part . Nothing but buffoonery from beginning to end . _ That _ might do , perhaps , but for the low parts . If [I]113-fanny _ must _ give [my]113-fanny opinion , [I]113-fanny have always thought it the most insipid play in the English language . _ [I]113-fanny _ do not wish to make objections ; [I]113-fanny shall be happy to be of any use , but [I]113-fanny think [we]4725-we could not chuse worse . ”[113-fanny] [Fanny]113-fanny looked on and listened , not unamused to observe the selfishness which , more or less disguised , seemed to govern [them]1283-them all , and wondering how it would end . For [her]1284-she own gratification [she]1284-she could have wished that something might be acted , for [she]1284-she had never seen even half a play , but everything of higher consequence was against it . “ This will never do , ”[101-sir thomas] said [Tom Bertram]101-sir thomas at last . “ [We]4725-we are wasting time most abominably . Something must be fixed on . No matter what , so that something is chosen . [We]4725-we must not be so nice . A few characters too many must not frighten [us]4725-we . [We]4725-we must _ double _ [them]1283-them . [We]4725-we must descend a little . If a part is insignificant , the greater [our]4725-we credit in making anything of it . From this moment [I]101-sir thomas make no difficulties . [I]101-sir thomas take any part [you]4731-you chuse to give [me]101-sir thomas , so as it be comic . Let it but be comic , [I]101-sir thomas condition for nothing more . ”[101-sir thomas] For about the fifth time [he]101-sir thomas then proposed [the Heir at Law]1285-the heir at law , doubting only whether to prefer [Lord Duberley]193-lord duberley or [Dr. Pangloss]194-dr. pangloss for [himself]101-sir thomas ; and very earnestly , but very unsuccessfully , trying to persuade [the others]347-the others that there were some fine tragic parts in the rest of [the Dramatis Personæ]1287-the dramatis personæ . The pause which followed this fruitless effort was ended by the same speaker , who , taking up one of the many volumes of plays that lay on the table , and turning it over , suddenly exclaimed—“Lovers ’ Vows ! And why should not [Lovers]177-lovers ’ Vows do for _ [us]4725-we _ as well as for [the Ravenshaws]195-the ravenshaws ? How came it never to be thought of before ? [It]4732-it strikes [me]1287-the dramatis personæ as if it would do exactly . What say [you]4731-you all ? Here are two capital tragic parts for [Yates]174-mr. yates and [Crawford]131-henry , and here is the rhyming Butler for [me]1287-the dramatis personæ , if [nobody else]4733-nobody else wants it ; a trifling part , but the sort of thing [I]1287-the dramatis personæ should not dislike , and , as [I]1287-the dramatis personæ said before , [I]1287-the dramatis personæ am determined to take anything and do [my]1287-the dramatis personæ best . And as for the rest , they may be filled up by [anybody]3668-anybody . It is only [Count Cassel]178-anhalt and [Anhalt]178-anhalt . ”[1287-the dramatis personæ] The suggestion was generally welcome . [Everybody]408-everybody was growing weary of indecision , and the first idea with [everybody]408-everybody was , that nothing had been proposed before so likely to suit [them]408-everybody all . [Mr. Yates]174-mr. yates was particularly pleased : [he]174-mr. yates had been sighing and longing to do [the Baron at [Ecclesford]42-ecclesford]1290-the baron at ecclesford , had grudged every rant of [Lord Ravenshaw]176-lord ravenshaw ’s , and been forced to re - rant it all in [[his]174-mr. yates own room]1291-his own room . The storm through [Baron Wildenheim]196-baron wildenheim was the height of [his]174-mr. yates theatrical ambition ; and with the advantage of knowing half the scenes by heart already , [he]174-mr. yates did now , with the greatest alacrity , offer [his]174-mr. yates services for the part . To do [him]174-mr. yates justice , however , [he]174-mr. yates did not resolve to appropriate it ; for remembering that there was some very good ranting - ground in [Frederick]180-frederick , [he]174-mr. yates professed an equal willingness for that . [Henry Crawford]131-henry was ready to take either . [Whichever Mr. Yates]174-mr. yates did not chuse would perfectly satisfy [him]131-henry , and a short parley of compliment ensued . [Miss Bertram]112-julia , feeling all the interest of an [Agatha]181-agatha in the question , took on [her]112-julia to decide it , by observing to [Mr. Yates]174-mr. yates that this was a point in which height and figure ought to be considered , and that _ [his]174-mr. yates _ being the tallest , seemed to fit [him]174-mr. yates peculiarly for [the Baron]4626-the baron . [She]112-julia was acknowledged to be quite right , and the two parts being accepted accordingly , [she]112-julia was certain of the proper [Frederick]180-frederick . [Three of [the characters]1294-the characters]1293-three of the characters were now cast , besides [Mr. Rushworth]113-fanny , who was always answered for by [Maria]126-maria as willing to do anything ; when [Julia]112-julia , meaning , like [[her]112-julia sister]331-her sister , to be [Agatha]181-agatha , began to be scrupulous on [Miss Crawford]127-miss crawford ’s account . “ This is not behaving well by [the absent]4735-the absent , ”[112-julia] said [she]112-julia . “ Here are not [women]988-women enough . [Amelia]197-amelia and [Agatha]181-agatha may do for [Maria]126-maria and [me]112-julia , but here is nothing for [[your]133-mr. crawford sister]4444-your sister , [Mr. Crawford]133-mr. crawford . ”[112-julia] [Mr. Crawford]133-mr. crawford desired _ that _ might not be thought of : [he]133-mr. crawford was very sure [[his]133-mr. crawford sister]511-his sister had no wish of acting but as [she]511-his sister might be useful , and that [she]511-his sister would not allow [herself]511-his sister to be considered in the present case . But this was immediately opposed by [Tom Bertram]101-sir thomas , who asserted the part of [Amelia]197-amelia to be in every respect the property of [Miss Crawford]127-miss crawford , if [she]127-miss crawford would accept it . “ It falls as naturally , as necessarily to [her]511-his sister , ”[133-mr. crawford] said [he]133-mr. crawford , “ as [Agatha]181-agatha does to [one or other of [[my]133-mr. crawford sisters]4714-my sisters]4738-one or other of my sisters . It can be no sacrifice on [their]4738-one or other of my sisters side , for it is highly comic . ”[133-mr. crawford] A short silence followed . [Each sister]332-each sister looked anxious ; for [each]1248-each felt the best claim to [Agatha]181-agatha , and was hoping to have it pressed on [her]1248-each by [the rest]441-the rest . [Henry Crawford]131-henry , who meanwhile had taken up the play , and with seeming carelessness was turning over the first act , soon settled the business . “ [I]133-mr. crawford must entreat [Miss _ Julia _ Bertram]112-julia , ”[133-mr. crawford] said [he]133-mr. crawford , “ not to engage in the part of [Agatha]181-agatha , or it will be the ruin of all [my]133-mr. crawford solemnity . [You]1300-you must not , indeed [you]1300-you must not ”[133-mr. crawford] ( turning to [her]1300-you ) . “ [I]133-mr. crawford could not stand [your]1300-you countenance dressed up in woe and paleness . The many laughs [we]4740-we have had together would infallibly come across [me]133-mr. crawford , and [Frederick]180-frederick and [his]180-frederick knapsack would be obliged to run away . ”[133-mr. crawford] Pleasantly , courteously , it was spoken ; but the manner was lost in the matter to [Julia]112-julia ’s feelings . [She]112-julia saw a glance at [Maria]126-maria which confirmed the injury to [herself]112-julia : it was a scheme , a trick ; [she]112-julia was slighted , [Maria]126-maria was preferred ; the smile of triumph which [Maria]126-maria was trying to suppress shewed how well it was understood ; and before [Julia]112-julia could command [herself]112-julia enough to speak , [[her]112-julia brother]451-her brother gave [his]451-her brother weight against [her]112-julia too , by saying , “ Oh yes ! [Maria]126-maria must be [Agatha]181-agatha . [Maria]126-maria will be the best [Agatha]181-agatha . Though [Julia]112-julia fancies [she]112-julia prefers tragedy , [I]451-her brother would not trust [her]112-julia in it . There is nothing of tragedy about [her]112-julia . [She]112-julia has not the look of it . [Her]112-julia features are not tragic features , and [she]112-julia walks too quick , and speaks too quick , and would not keep [her]112-julia countenance . [She]112-julia had better do [the old countrywoman]4741-the old countrywoman : [[the Cottager]4742-the cottager ’s wife]4743-the cottager ’s wife ; [you]112-julia had , indeed , [Julia]112-julia . [Cottager ’s wife]4744-cottager ’s wife is a very pretty part , [I]451-her brother assure [you]112-julia . [The old lady]4745-the old lady relieves the high - flown benevolence of [[her]4745-the old lady husband]325-her husband with a good deal of spirit . [You]112-julia shall be [[Cottager]198-cottager ’s wife]4744-cottager ’s wife . ”[451-her brother] “ [Cottager ’s wife]4744-cottager ’s wife ! ”[174-mr. yates] cried [Mr. Yates]174-mr. yates . “ What are [you]174-mr. yates talking of ? The most trivial , paltry , insignificant part ; the merest commonplace ; not a tolerable speech in the whole . [[Your]112-julia sister]4444-your sister do that ! It is an insult to propose it . At [Ecclesford]42-ecclesford [the governess]3959-the governess was to have done it . [We]4751-we all agreed that it could not be offered to [anybody else]4752-anybody else . A little more justice , [Mr. Manager]199-mr. manager , if [you]112-julia please . [You]112-julia do not deserve the office , if [you]112-julia can not appreciate the talents of [[your]112-julia company]4753-your company a little better . ”[451-her brother] “ Why , as to _ that _ , [[my]451-her brother good friend]4754-my good friend , till [I]451-her brother and [[my]451-her brother company]4755-my company have really acted there must be some guesswork ; but [I]451-her brother mean no disparagement to [Julia]112-julia . [We]4751-we can not have [two Agathas]4756-two agathas , and [we]4751-we must have [one Cottager ’s wife]4757-one cottager ’s wife ; and [I]451-her brother am sure [I]451-her brother set [her]4757-one cottager ’s wife the example of moderation [myself]451-her brother in being satisfied with [the old Butler]4758-the old butler . If the part is trifling [she]4757-one cottager ’s wife will have more credit in making something of it ; and if [she]4757-one cottager ’s wife is so desperately bent against everything humorous , let [her]4757-one cottager ’s wife take [Cottager]198-cottager ’s speeches instead of [[Cottager]198-cottager ’s wife]4744-cottager ’s wife ’s , and so change the parts all through ; _ [he]198-cottager _ is solemn and pathetic enough , [I]451-her brother am sure . It could make no difference in the play , and as for [Cottager]198-cottager [himself]198-cottager , when [he]198-cottager has got [[his]198-cottager wife]546-his wife ’s speeches , _ [I]451-her brother _ would undertake [him]198-cottager with all [my]451-her brother heart . ”[451-her brother] “ With all [your]451-her brother partiality for [[Cottager]198-cottager ’s wife]4744-cottager ’s wife , ”[131-henry] said [Henry Crawford]131-henry , “ it will be impossible to make anything of it fit for [[your]451-her brother sister]4444-your sister , and [we]4763-we must not suffer [her]4444-your sister good - nature to be imposed on . [We]4763-we must not _ allow _ [her]4444-your sister to accept the part . [She]4444-your sister must not be left to [her]4444-your sister own complaisance . [Her]4444-your sister talents will be wanted in [Amelia]197-amelia . [Amelia]197-amelia is a character more difficult to be well represented than even [Agatha]181-agatha . [I]131-henry consider [Amelia]197-amelia is the most difficult character in the whole piece . It requires great powers , great nicety , to give [her]197-amelia playfulness and simplicity without extravagance . [I]131-henry have seen [good actresses]4764-good actresses fail in the part . Simplicity , indeed , is beyond the reach of [almost every actress by profession]4765-almost every actress by profession . It requires a delicacy of feeling which [they]4765-almost every actress by profession have not . It requires [a gentlewoman]3683-a gentlewoman — a [Julia Bertram]112-julia . [You]4767-you _ will _ undertake it , [I]131-henry hope ? ”[131-henry] turning to [her]1302-you with a look of anxious entreaty , which softened [her]1302-you a little ; but while [she]1302-you hesitated what to say , [[her]1302-you brother]451-her brother again interposed with [Miss Crawford]127-miss crawford ’s better claim . “ No , no , [Julia]112-julia must not be [Amelia]197-amelia . It is not at all the part for [her]112-julia . [She]112-julia would not like it . [She]112-julia would not do well . [She]112-julia is too tall and robust . [Amelia]197-amelia should be [a small , light , girlish , skipping figure]4768-a small , light , girlish , skipping figure . It is fit for [Miss Crawford]127-miss crawford , and [Miss Crawford]127-miss crawford only . [She]112-julia looks the part , and [I]127-miss crawford am persuaded will do it admirably . ”[127-miss crawford] Without attending to this , [Henry Crawford]131-henry continued [his]131-henry supplication . “ [You]1302-you must oblige [us]4769-us , ”[131-henry] said [he]131-henry , “ indeed [you]1302-you must . When [you]1302-you have studied the character , [I]131-henry am sure [you]1302-you will feel it suit [you]1302-you . [Tragedy]200-tragedy may be [your]1302-you choice , but it will certainly appear that comedy chuses _ [you]1302-you _ . [You]1302-you will be to visit [me]131-henry in [prison]4770-prison with a basket of provisions ; [you]1302-you will not refuse to visit [me]131-henry in [prison]4770-prison ? [I]131-henry think [I]131-henry see [you]1302-you coming in with [your]1302-you basket . ”[131-henry] The influence of [his]131-henry voice was felt . [Julia]112-julia wavered ; but was [he]131-henry only trying to soothe and pacify [her]112-julia , and make [her]112-julia overlook the previous affront ? [She]112-julia distrusted [him]131-henry . [The slight]1304-the slight had been most determined . [He]131-henry was , perhaps , but at treacherous play with [her]112-julia . [She]112-julia looked suspiciously at [[her]112-julia sister]331-her sister ; [Maria]126-maria ’s countenance was to decide it : if [she]126-maria were vexed and alarmed — but [Maria]126-maria looked all serenity and satisfaction , and [Julia]112-julia well knew that on this ground [Maria]126-maria could not be happy but at [her]112-julia expense . With hasty indignation , therefore , and a tremulous voice , [she]112-julia said to [him]131-henry , “ [You]131-henry do not seem afraid of not keeping [your]131-henry countenance when [I]112-julia come in with a basket of provisions — though one might have supposed — but it is only as [Agatha]181-agatha that [I]112-julia was to be so overpowering ! ”[112-julia] [She]112-julia stopped — [Henry Crawford]131-henry looked rather foolish , and as if [he]131-henry did not know what to say . [Tom Bertram]101-sir thomas began again — “ [Miss Crawford]127-miss crawford must be [Amelia]197-amelia . [She]197-amelia will be [an excellent Amelia]4772-an excellent amelia . ”[101-sir thomas] “ Do not be afraid of _ [my]112-julia _ wanting the character , ”[112-julia] cried [Julia]112-julia , with angry quickness : “ [I]112-julia am _ not _ to be [Agatha]181-agatha , and [I]112-julia am sure [I]112-julia will do nothing else ; and as to [Amelia]197-amelia , it is of all parts in [the world]315-the world the most disgusting to [me]112-julia . [I]112-julia quite detest [her]197-amelia . [An odious , little , pert , unnatural , impudent girl]4774-an odious , little , pert , unnatural , impudent girl . [I]112-julia have always protested against comedy , and this is comedy in its worst form . ”[112-julia] And so saying , [she]112-julia walked hastily out of [the room]412-the room , leaving awkward feelings to more than one , but exciting small compassion in any except [Fanny]113-fanny , who had been [a quiet auditor of the whole]1307-a quiet auditor of the whole , and who could not think of [her]112-julia as under the agitations of _ jealousy _ without great pity . A short silence succeeded [her]112-julia leaving [them]1308-them ; but [[her]112-julia brother]451-her brother soon returned to business and [[Lovers]177-lovers ’ Vows]1310-lovers ’ vows , and was eagerly looking over the play , with [Mr. Yates]174-mr. yates ’s help , to ascertain what scenery would be necessary — while [Maria]126-maria and [Henry Crawford]131-henry conversed together in an under - voice , and the declaration with which [she]112-julia began of , “ [I]112-julia am sure [I]112-julia would give up the part to [Julia]112-julia most willingly , but that though [I]112-julia shall probably do it very ill , [I]112-julia feel persuaded _ [she]112-julia _ would do it worse , ”[112-julia] was doubtless receiving all the compliments it called for . When this had lasted some time , the division of [the party]907-the party was completed by [Tom Bertram]101-sir thomas and [Mr. Yates]174-mr. yates walking off together to consult farther in [the room]412-the room now beginning to be called _ [the _ _ Theatre _]1313-the _ _ theatre _ , and [Miss Bertram]112-julia ’s resolving to go down to [the Parsonage]368-the parsonage [herself]112-julia with the offer of [Amelia]197-amelia to [Miss Crawford]127-miss crawford ; and [Fanny]113-fanny remained alone . The first use [she]112-julia made of [her]112-julia solitude was to take up the volume which had been left on the table , and begin to acquaint [herself]112-julia with the play of which [she]112-julia had heard so much . [Her]112-julia curiosity was all awake , and [she]112-julia ran through it with an eagerness which was suspended only by intervals of astonishment , that it could be chosen in the present instance , that it could be proposed and accepted in [a private theatre]1315-a private theatre ! [Agatha]181-agatha and [Amelia]197-amelia appeared to [her]112-julia in [their]1316-their different ways so totally improper for [home]367-home representation — the situation of one , and the language of the other , so unfit to be expressed by [any woman of modesty]1318-any woman of modesty , that [she]112-julia could hardly suppose [[her]112-julia cousins]3671-her cousins could be aware of what [they]3671-her cousins were engaging in ; and longed to have [them]3671-her cousins roused as soon as possible by the remonstrance which [Edmund]108-edmund would certainly make . [CHAPTER XV Miss Crawford]127-miss crawford accepted the part very readily ; and soon after [Miss Bertram]112-julia ’s return from [the Parsonage]368-the parsonage , [Mr. Rushworth]113-fanny arrived , and [another character]1321-another character was consequently cast . [He]113-fanny had the offer of [Count Cassel and Anhalt]178-anhalt , and at first did not know which to chuse , and wanted [Miss Bertram]112-julia to direct [him]113-fanny ; but upon being made to understand the different style of [the characters]1294-the characters , and which was which , and recollecting that [he]113-fanny had once seen the play in [London]6-london , and had thought [Anhalt]178-anhalt [a very stupid fellow]3885-a very stupid fellow , [he]113-fanny soon decided for [the Count]1324-the count . [Miss Bertram]112-julia approved the decision , for the less [he]113-fanny had to learn the better ; and though [she]112-julia could not sympathise in [his]113-fanny wish that [the Count]1324-the count and [Agatha]181-agatha might be to act together , nor wait very patiently while [he]113-fanny was slowly turning over the leaves with the hope of still discovering such a scene , [she]112-julia very kindly took [his]113-fanny part in hand , and curtailed every speech that admitted being shortened ; besides pointing out the necessity of [his]113-fanny being very much dressed , and chusing [his]113-fanny colours . [Mr. Rushworth]113-fanny liked the idea of [his]113-fanny finery very well , though affecting to despise it ; and was too much engaged with what [his]113-fanny own appearance would be to think of [the others]347-the others , or draw any of those conclusions , or feel any of that displeasure which [Maria]126-maria had been half prepared for . Thus much was settled before [Edmund]108-edmund , who had been out all the morning , knew anything of the matter ; but when [he]108-edmund entered [the drawing - room]420-the drawing - room before dinner , the buzz of discussion was high between [Tom]101-sir thomas , [Maria]126-maria , and [Mr. Yates]174-mr. yates ; and [Mr. Rushworth]113-fanny stepped forward with great alacrity to tell [him]113-fanny the agreeable news . “ [We]4775-we have got a play , ”[113-fanny] said [he]113-fanny . “ It is to be [Lovers]177-lovers ’ Vows ; and [I]113-fanny am to be [Count Cassel]178-anhalt , and am to come in first with a blue dress and a pink satin cloak , and afterwards am to have another fine fancy suit , by way of a shooting - dress . [I]113-fanny do not know how [I]113-fanny shall like it . ”[113-fanny] [Fanny]113-fanny ’s eyes followed [Edmund]108-edmund , and [her]126-maria heart beat for [him]108-edmund as [she]126-maria heard this speech , and saw [his]108-edmund look , and felt what [his]108-edmund sensations must be . “ [Lovers]4611-lovers ’ Vows ! ”[108-edmund] in a tone of the greatest amazement , was [his]108-edmund only reply to [Mr. Rushworth]113-fanny , and [he]108-edmund turned towards [[his]108-edmund brother]805-his brother and [sisters]3676-sisters as if hardly doubting a contradiction . “ Yes , ”[174-mr. yates] cried [Mr. Yates]174-mr. yates . “ After all [our]4777-we debatings and difficulties , [we]4777-we find there is nothing that will suit [us]4777-we altogether so well , nothing so unexceptionable , as [Lovers]177-lovers ’ Vows . The wonder is that it should not have been thought of before . [My]174-mr. yates stupidity was abominable , for here [we]4777-we have all the advantage of what [I]174-mr. yates saw at [Ecclesford]42-ecclesford ; and it is so useful to have anything of [a model]4778-a model ! [We]4777-we have cast almost every part . ”[174-mr. yates] “ But what do [you]126-maria do for [women]988-women ? ”[108-edmund] said [Edmund]108-edmund gravely , and looking at [Maria]126-maria . [Maria]126-maria blushed in spite of [herself]126-maria as [she]126-maria answered , “ [I]126-maria take the part which [Lady Ravenshaw]182-lady ravenshaw was to have done , and ”[126-maria] ( with a bolder eye ) “ [Miss Crawford]127-miss crawford is to be [Amelia]197-amelia . ”[126-maria] “ [I]108-edmund should not have thought it the sort of play to be so easily filled up , with _ [us]4780-us _ , ”[108-edmund] replied [Edmund]108-edmund , turning away to the fire , where sat [[his]108-edmund mother]629-his mother , [aunt]3769-aunt , and [Fanny]113-fanny , and seating [himself]108-edmund with a look of great vexation . [Mr. Rushworth]113-fanny followed [him]108-edmund to say , “ [I]113-fanny come in three times , and have two - and - forty speeches . That ’s something , is not it ? But [I]113-fanny do not much like the idea of being so fine . [I]113-fanny shall hardly know [myself]113-fanny in a blue dress and a pink satin cloak . ”[113-fanny] [Edmund]108-edmund could not answer [him]113-fanny . In a few minutes [Mr. Bertram]108-edmund was called out of [the room]412-the room to satisfy some doubts of [the carpenter]4705-the carpenter ; and being accompanied by [Mr. Yates]174-mr. yates , and followed soon afterwards by [Mr. Rushworth]113-fanny , [Edmund]108-edmund almost immediately took the opportunity of saying , “ [I]108-edmund can not , before [Mr. Yates]174-mr. yates , speak what [I]108-edmund feel as to this play , without reflecting on [[his]174-mr. yates friends]533-his friends at [Ecclesford]42-ecclesford ; but [I]108-edmund must now , [[my]108-edmund dear]3657-my dear [Maria]126-maria , tell _ [you]126-maria _ , that [I]108-edmund think it exceedingly unfit for private representation , and that [I]108-edmund hope [you]126-maria will give it up . [I]108-edmund can not but suppose [you]126-maria _ will _ when [you]126-maria have read it carefully over . Read only the first act aloud to either [[your]126-maria mother]4140-your mother or [aunt]3769-aunt , and see how [you]126-maria can approve it . It will not be necessary to send [you]126-maria to [[your]126-maria _ father]4785-your _ father ’s _ judgment , [I]108-edmund am convinced . ”[108-edmund] “ [We]4786-we see things very differently , ”[126-maria] cried [Maria]126-maria . “ [I]126-maria am perfectly acquainted with the play , [I]126-maria assure [you]126-maria ; and with a very few omissions , and so forth , which will be made , of course , [I]126-maria can see nothing objectionable in it ; and _ [I]126-maria _ am not [the _ only _ young woman [you]126-maria find who thinks it very fit for private representation]4787-the _ only _ young woman you find who thinks it very fit for private representation . ”[126-maria] “ [I]1334-i am sorry for it , ”[1334-i] was [his]1334-i answer ; “ but in this matter it is _ [you]126-maria _ who are to lead . _ [You]126-maria _ must set the example . If [others]361-others have blundered , it is [your]126-maria place to put [them]361-others right , and shew [them]361-others what true delicacy is . In all points of decorum _ [your]126-maria _ conduct must be law to the rest of [the party]907-the party . ”[1334-i] This picture of [her]126-maria consequence had some effect , for [no one]404-no one loved better to lead than [Maria]126-maria ; and with far more good - humour [she]126-maria answered , “ [I]126-maria am much obliged to [you]126-maria , [Edmund]108-edmund ; [you]126-maria mean very well , [I]126-maria am sure : but [I]126-maria still think [you]126-maria see things too strongly ; and [I]126-maria really can not undertake to harangue all the rest upon a subject of this kind . _ There _ would be the greatest indecorum , [I]126-maria think . ”[126-maria] “ Do [you]126-maria imagine that [I]1334-i could have such an idea in [my]1334-i head ? No ; let [your]126-maria conduct be the only harangue . Say that , on examining the part , [you]126-maria feel [yourself]126-maria unequal to it ; that [you]126-maria find it requiring more exertion and confidence than [you]126-maria can be supposed to have . Say this with firmness , and it will be quite enough . [All who can distinguish]4790-all who can distinguish will understand [your]126-maria motive . The play will be given up , and [your]126-maria delicacy honoured as it ought . ”[1334-i] “ Do not act anything improper , [[my]106-lady bertram dear]3657-my dear , ”[106-lady bertram] said [Lady Bertram]106-lady bertram . “ [Sir Thomas]101-sir thomas would not like it.—Fanny , ring the bell ; [I]106-lady bertram must have [my]106-lady bertram dinner.—To be sure , [Julia]112-julia is dressed by this time . ”[106-lady bertram] “ [I]108-edmund am convinced , [madam]4024-madam , ”[108-edmund] said [Edmund]108-edmund , preventing [Fanny]113-fanny , “ that [Sir Thomas]101-sir thomas would not like it . ”[108-edmund] “ There , [[my]106-lady bertram dear]3657-my dear , do [you]3657-my dear hear what [Edmund]108-edmund says ? ”[106-lady bertram] “ If [I]126-maria were to decline the part , ”[126-maria] said [Maria]126-maria , with renewed zeal , “ [Julia]112-julia would certainly take it . ”[126-maria] “ What ! ”[108-edmund] cried [Edmund]108-edmund , “ if [she]112-julia knew [your]126-maria reasons ! ”[108-edmund] “ Oh ! [she]112-julia might think the difference between [us]4794-we — the difference in [our]4794-we situations — that _ [she]112-julia _ need not be so scrupulous as _ [I]106-lady bertram _ might feel necessary . [I]106-lady bertram am sure [she]112-julia would argue so . No ; [you]126-maria must excuse [me]106-lady bertram ; [I]106-lady bertram can not retract [my]106-lady bertram consent ; it is too far settled , [everybody]408-everybody would be so disappointed , [Tom]101-sir thomas would be quite angry ; and if [we]4794-we are so very nice , [we]4794-we shall never act anything . ”[106-lady bertram] “ [I]105-mrs. norris was just going to say the very same thing , ”[105-mrs. norris] said [Mrs. Norris]105-mrs. norris . “ If every play is to be objected to , [you]126-maria will act nothing , and the preparations will be all so much money thrown away , and [I]105-mrs. norris am sure _ that _ would be a discredit to [us]4794-we all . [I]105-mrs. norris do not know the play ; but , as [Maria]126-maria says , if there is anything a little too warm ( and it is so with most of [them]4796-them ) it can be easily left out . [We]4794-we must not be over - precise , [Edmund]108-edmund . As [Mr. Rushworth]113-fanny is to act too , there can be no harm . [I]105-mrs. norris only wish [Tom]101-sir thomas had known [his]101-sir thomas own mind when [the carpenters]4797-the carpenters began , for there was the loss of half a day ’s work about those side - doors . The curtain will be a good job , however . [The maids]4798-the maids do [their]4798-the maids work very well , and [I]105-mrs. norris think [we]4794-we shall be able to send back some dozens of the rings . There is no occasion to put them so very close together . [I]105-mrs. norris _ am _ of some use , [I]105-mrs. norris hope , in preventing waste and making the most of things . There should always be one steady head to superintend [so many young ones]4799-so many young ones . [I]105-mrs. norris forgot to tell [Tom]101-sir thomas of something that happened to [me]105-mrs. norris this very day . [I]105-mrs. norris had been looking about [me]105-mrs. norris in [the poultry - yard]4800-the poultry - yard , and was just coming out , when who should [I]105-mrs. norris see but [Dick Jackson]201-dick jackson making up to [the servants]601-the servants ’ hall - door with two bits of deal board in [his]201-dick jackson hand , bringing them to [father]1263-father , [you]4803-you may be sure ; [mother]3977-mother had chanced to send [him]201-dick jackson of a message to [father]1263-father , and then [father]1263-father had bid [him]201-dick jackson bring up them two bits of board , for [he]201-dick jackson could not no how do without them . [I]105-mrs. norris knew what all this meant , for [the servants]601-the servants ’ dinner - bell was ringing at the very moment over [our]4808-our heads ; and as [I]105-mrs. norris hate [such encroaching people]4809-such encroaching people ( [the Jacksons]202-the jacksons are very encroaching , [I]105-mrs. norris have always said so : just the sort of people to get all [they]4809-such encroaching people can ) , [I]105-mrs. norris said to [the boy]513-the boy directly ( [a great lubberly fellow of ten years old , [you]4803-you know , who ought to be ashamed of [himself]513-the boy]4811-a great lubberly fellow of ten years old , you know , who ought to be ashamed of himself ) , ‘ _ [I]105-mrs. norris ’ll _ take the boards to [[your]513-the boy father]4493-your father , [Dick]201-dick jackson , so get [you]513-the boy [home]367-home again as fast as [you]513-the boy can . ’ [The boy]513-the boy looked very silly , and turned away without offering a word , for [I]105-mrs. norris believe [I]105-mrs. norris might speak pretty sharp ; and [I]105-mrs. norris dare say it will cure [him]4493-your father of coming marauding about [the house]427-the house for one while . [I]105-mrs. norris hate such greediness — so good as [[your]513-the boy father]4493-your father is to [the family]3724-the family , employing [the man]4818-the man all the year round ! ”[105-mrs. norris] [Nobody]360-nobody was at the trouble of an answer ; [the others]347-the others soon returned ; and [Edmund]108-edmund found that to have endeavoured to set [them]1338-them right must be [his]108-edmund only satisfaction . Dinner passed heavily . [Mrs. Norris]105-mrs. norris related again [her]105-mrs. norris triumph over [Dick Jackson]201-dick jackson , but neither play nor preparation were otherwise much talked of , for [Edmund]108-edmund ’s disapprobation was felt even by [[his]108-edmund brother]805-his brother , though [he]108-edmund would not have owned it . [Maria]126-maria , wanting [Henry Crawford]131-henry ’s animating support , thought the subject better avoided . [Mr. Yates]174-mr. yates , who was trying to make [himself]174-mr. yates agreeable to [Julia]112-julia , found [her]112-julia gloom less impenetrable on any topic than that of [his]174-mr. yates regret at [her]112-julia secession from [[their]1340-their company]1341-their company ; and [Mr. Rushworth]113-fanny , having only [his]113-fanny own part and [his]113-fanny own dress in [his]113-fanny head , had soon talked away all that could be said of either . But the concerns of [the theatre]1230-the theatre were suspended only for an hour or two : there was still a great deal to be settled ; and the spirits of evening giving fresh courage , [Tom]101-sir thomas , [Maria]126-maria , and [Mr. Yates]174-mr. yates , soon after [their]1340-their being reassembled in [the drawing - room]420-the drawing - room , seated [themselves]1340-their in committee at a separate table , with the play open before [them]1340-their , and were just getting deep in the subject when a most welcome interruption was given by the entrance of [Mr.]1344-mr. and [Miss Crawford]127-miss crawford , who , late and dark and dirty as it was , could not help coming , and were received with the most grateful joy . “ Well , how do [you]131-henry go on ? ”[1344-mr.] and “ What have [you]131-henry settled ? ”[1344-mr.] and “ Oh ! [we]4819-we can do nothing without [you]131-henry , ”[1344-mr.] followed the first salutations ; and [Henry Crawford]131-henry was soon seated with [the other three at the table]1345-the other three at the table , while [[his]131-henry sister]511-his sister made [her]511-his sister way to [Lady Bertram]106-lady bertram , and with pleasant attention was complimenting [_]117-_ [her]106-lady bertram _ . “ [I]106-lady bertram must really congratulate [[your]131-henry ladyship]4820-your ladyship , ”[106-lady bertram] said [she]106-lady bertram , “ on the play being chosen ; for though [you]131-henry have borne it with exemplary patience , [I]106-lady bertram am sure [you]131-henry must be sick of all [our]4819-we noise and difficulties . [The actors]4821-the actors may be glad , but [the bystanders]4822-the bystanders must be infinitely more thankful for a decision ; and [I]106-lady bertram do sincerely give [you]131-henry joy , [madam]4024-madam , as well as [Mrs. Norris]105-mrs. norris , and [everybody else who is in the same predicament]4824-everybody else who is in the same predicament , ”[106-lady bertram] glancing half fearfully , half slyly , beyond [Fanny]113-fanny to [Edmund]108-edmund . [She]106-lady bertram was very civilly answered by [Lady Bertram]106-lady bertram , but [Edmund]108-edmund said nothing . [His]108-edmund being only [a bystander]1347-a bystander was not disclaimed . After continuing in chat with [the party]907-the party round the fire a few minutes , [Miss Crawford]127-miss crawford returned to the party round the table ; and standing by [them]907-the party , seemed to interest [herself]127-miss crawford in [their]907-the party arrangements till , as if struck by a sudden recollection , [she]127-miss crawford exclaimed , “ [[My]127-miss crawford good friends]4825-my good friends , [you]4825-my good friends are most composedly at work upon [these cottages]4826-these cottages and [alehouses]4827-alehouses , inside and out ; but pray let [me]127-miss crawford know [my]127-miss crawford fate in the meanwhile . Who is to be [Anhalt]178-anhalt ?
