Did [she]127-miss crawford think of being up before [you]127-miss crawford set off ? ”[101-sir thomas] “ Oh ! yes , [sir]4023-sir , ”[113-fanny] cried [Fanny]113-fanny , rising eagerly from [her]2250-her seat to be nearer [[her]2250-her uncle]312-her uncle ; “ [I]113-fanny must get up and breakfast with [him]312-her uncle . It will be the last time , [you]4023-sir know ; the last morning . ”[113-fanny] “ [You]113-fanny had better not . [He]312-her uncle is to have breakfasted and be gone by half - past nine . [Mr. Crawford]133-mr. crawford , [I]113-fanny think [you]133-mr. crawford call for [him]312-her uncle at half - past nine ? ”[113-fanny] [Fanny]113-fanny was too urgent , however , and had too many tears in [her]2250-her eyes for denial ; and it ended in a gracious “ Well , well ! ”[113-fanny] which was permission . “ Yes , half - past nine , ”[133-mr. crawford] said [Crawford]133-mr. crawford to [William]228-william as [the latter]972-the latter was leaving [them]2253-them , “ and [I]133-mr. crawford shall be punctual , for there will be [no kind sister]5510-no kind sister to get up for _ [me]133-mr. crawford _ . ”[133-mr. crawford] And in a lower tone to [Fanny]113-fanny , “ [I]133-mr. crawford shall have only [a desolate house]5511-a desolate house to hurry from . [[Your]113-fanny brother]3938-your brother will find [my]133-mr. crawford ideas of time and [his]3938-your brother own very different to - morrow . ”[133-mr. crawford] After a short consideration , [Sir Thomas]101-sir thomas asked [Crawford]133-mr. crawford to join the early breakfast party in [that house]1793-that house instead of eating alone : [he]133-mr. crawford should [himself]133-mr. crawford be of it ; and the readiness with which [his]133-mr. crawford invitation was accepted convinced [him]133-mr. crawford that the suspicions whence , [he]133-mr. crawford must confess to [himself]133-mr. crawford , this very ball had in great measure sprung , were well founded . [Mr. Crawford]133-mr. crawford was in love with [Fanny]113-fanny . [He]133-mr. crawford had a pleasing anticipation of what would be . [[His]133-mr. crawford niece]724-his niece , meanwhile , did not thank [him]133-mr. crawford for what [he]133-mr. crawford had just done . [She]724-his niece had hoped to have [William]228-william all to [herself]724-his niece the last morning . It would have been an unspeakable indulgence . But though [her]724-his niece wishes were overthrown , there was no spirit of murmuring within [her]724-his niece . On the contrary , [she]724-his niece was so totally unused to have [her]724-his niece pleasure consulted , or to have anything take place at all in the way [she]724-his niece could desire , that [she]724-his niece was more disposed to wonder and rejoice in having carried [her]724-his niece point so far , than to repine at the counteraction which followed . Shortly afterward , [Sir Thomas]101-sir thomas was again interfering a little with [her]724-his niece inclination , by advising [her]724-his niece to go immediately to bed . “ Advise ”[133-mr. crawford] was [his]133-mr. crawford word , but it was the advice of absolute power , and [she]724-his niece had only to rise , and , with [Mr. Crawford]133-mr. crawford ’s very cordial adieus , pass quietly away ; stopping at the entrance - door , like [the Lady of [Branxholm Hall]76-branxholm hall]2256-the lady of branxholm hall , “ one moment and no more , ”[2256-the lady of branxholm hall] to view the happy scene , and take a last look at [the five or six determined couple who were still hard at work]2257-the five or six determined couple who were still hard at work ; and then , creeping slowly up [the principal staircase]2258-the principal staircase , pursued by [the ceaseless country - dance , feverish with hopes and fears , soup and negus]2259-the ceaseless country - dance , feverish with hopes and fears , soup and negus , sore - footed and fatigued , restless and agitated , yet feeling , in spite of everything , that a ball was indeed delightful . In thus sending [her]724-his niece away , [Sir Thomas]101-sir thomas perhaps might not be thinking merely of [her]724-his niece health . It might occur to [him]101-sir thomas that [Mr. Crawford]133-mr. crawford had been sitting by [her]724-his niece long enough , or [he]101-sir thomas might mean to recommend [her]724-his niece as [a wife]537-a wife by shewing [her]724-his niece persuadableness . CHAPTER XXIX The ball was over , and the breakfast was soon over too ; the last kiss was given , and [William]228-william was gone . [Mr. Crawford]133-mr. crawford had , as [he]133-mr. crawford foretold , been very punctual , and short and pleasant had been the meal . After seeing [William]228-william to the last moment , [Fanny]113-fanny walked back to [the breakfast - room]3756-the breakfast - room with a very saddened heart to grieve over the melancholy change ; and there [[her]724-his niece uncle]312-her uncle kindly left [her]724-his niece to cry in peace , conceiving , perhaps , that the deserted chair of [each young man]2263-each young man might exercise [her]724-his niece tender enthusiasm , and that the remaining cold pork bones and mustard in [William]228-william ’s plate might but divide [her]724-his niece feelings with the broken egg - shells in [Mr. Crawford]133-mr. crawford ’s . [She]724-his niece sat and cried _ con _ _ amore _ as [[her]724-his niece uncle]312-her uncle intended , but it was _ con _ _ amore _ fraternal and no other . [William]228-william was gone , and [she]724-his niece now felt as if [she]724-his niece had wasted half [his]228-william visit in idle cares and selfish solicitudes unconnected with [him]228-william . [Fanny]113-fanny ’s disposition was such that [she]724-his niece could never even think of [[her]724-his niece aunt]463-her aunt [Norris]105-mrs. norris in the meagreness and cheerlessness of [[her]724-his niece own small house]2266-her own small house , without reproaching [herself]724-his niece for some little want of attention to [her]724-his niece when [they]2267-they had been last together ; much less could [her]724-his niece feelings acquit [her]724-his niece of having done and said and thought everything by [William]228-william that was due to [him]228-william for a whole fortnight . It was a heavy , melancholy day . Soon after the second breakfast , [Edmund]108-edmund bade [them]2267-they good - bye for a week , and mounted [his]108-edmund horse for [Peterborough]75-peterborough , and then all were gone . Nothing remained of last night but remembrances , which [she]724-his niece had [nobody]360-nobody to share in . [She]724-his niece talked to [[her]724-his niece aunt]463-her aunt [Bertram]108-edmund — [she]724-his niece must talk to [somebody of the ball]2270-somebody of the ball ; but [[her]724-his niece aunt]463-her aunt had seen so little of what had passed , and had so little curiosity , that it was heavy work . [Lady Bertram]106-lady bertram was not certain of [anybody]3668-anybody ’s dress or [anybody]3668-anybody ’s place at supper but [her]106-lady bertram own . “ [She]106-lady bertram could not recollect what it was that [she]106-lady bertram had heard about [one of [the Miss Maddoxes]238-the miss maddoxes]5513-one of the miss maddoxes , or what it was that [Lady Prescott]239-lady prescott had noticed in [Fanny]113-fanny : [she]106-lady bertram was not sure whether [Colonel Harrison]240-colonel harrison had been talking of [Mr. Crawford]133-mr. crawford or of [William]228-william when [he]228-william said [he]228-william was [the finest young man in [the room]412-the room]5514-the finest young man in the room — [somebody]1115-somebody had whispered something to [her]106-lady bertram ; [she]106-lady bertram had forgot to ask [Sir Thomas]101-sir thomas what it could be . ”[106-lady bertram] And these were [her]106-lady bertram longest speeches and clearest communications : the rest was only a languid “ Yes , yes ; very well ; did [you]105-mrs. norris ? did [he]228-william ? [I]106-lady bertram did not see _ that _ ; [I]106-lady bertram should not know one from the other . ”[106-lady bertram] This was very bad . It was only better than [Mrs. Norris]105-mrs. norris ’s sharp answers would have been ; but [she]106-lady bertram being gone [home]367-home with all the supernumerary jellies to nurse [a sick maid]2275-a sick maid , there was peace and good - humour in [their]2276-their little party , though it could not boast much beside . The evening was heavy like the day . “ [I]106-lady bertram can not think what is the matter with [me]106-lady bertram , ”[106-lady bertram] said [Lady Bertram]106-lady bertram , when the tea - things were removed . “ [I]106-lady bertram feel quite stupid . It must be sitting up so late last night . [Fanny]113-fanny , [you]113-fanny must do something to keep [me]106-lady bertram awake . [I]106-lady bertram can not work . Fetch the cards ; [I]106-lady bertram feel so very stupid . ”[106-lady bertram] The cards were brought , and [Fanny]113-fanny played at cribbage with [[her]106-lady bertram aunt]463-her aunt till bedtime ; and as [Sir Thomas]101-sir thomas was reading to [himself]101-sir thomas , no sounds were heard in [the room]412-the room for the next two hours beyond the reckonings of the game—“And _ that _ makes thirty - one ; four in hand and eight in crib . [You]113-fanny are to deal , [ma’am]4007-ma’am ; shall [I]113-fanny deal for [you]113-fanny ? ”[113-fanny] [Fanny]113-fanny thought and thought again of the difference which twenty - four hours had made in [that room]1389-that room , and all that part of [the house]427-the house . Last night it had been hope and smiles , bustle and motion , noise and brilliancy , in [the drawing - room]420-the drawing - room , and out of [the drawing - room]420-the drawing - room , and everywhere . Now it was languor , and all but solitude . A good night ’s rest improved [her]106-lady bertram spirits . [She]106-lady bertram could think of [William]228-william the next day more cheerfully ; and as the morning afforded [her]106-lady bertram an opportunity of talking over Thursday night with [Mrs. Grant]123-mrs. grant and [Miss Crawford]127-miss crawford , in a very handsome style , with all the heightenings of imagination , and all the laughs of playfulness which are so essential to the shade of a departed ball , [she]106-lady bertram could afterwards bring [her]106-lady bertram mind without much effort into its everyday state , and easily conform to the tranquillity of the present quiet week . [They]2283-they were indeed a smaller party than [she]106-lady bertram had ever known there for a whole day together , and _ [he]228-william _ was gone on whom the comfort and cheerfulness of [every family meeting]2284-every family meeting and every meal chiefly depended . But this must be learned to be endured . [He]228-william would soon be always gone ; and [she]106-lady bertram was thankful that [she]106-lady bertram could now sit in [the same room]2285-the same room with [[her]106-lady bertram uncle]312-her uncle , hear [his]228-william voice , receive [his]228-william questions , and even answer [them]2287-them , without such wretched feelings as [she]106-lady bertram had formerly known . “ [We]2283-they miss [[our]2283-they two young men]5518-our two young men , ”[101-sir thomas] was [Sir Thomas]101-sir thomas ’s observation on both the first and second day , as [they]2283-they formed [their]2283-they very reduced circle after dinner ; and in consideration of [Fanny]113-fanny ’s swimming eyes , nothing more was said on the first day than to drink [their]2283-they good health ; but on the second it led to something farther . [William]228-william was kindly commended and [his]228-william promotion hoped for . “ And there is no reason to suppose , ”[101-sir thomas] added [Sir Thomas]101-sir thomas , “ but that [his]228-william visits to [us]2283-they may now be tolerably frequent . As to [Edmund]108-edmund , [we]2283-they must learn to do without [him]228-william . This will be the last winter of [his]228-william belonging to [us]2283-they , as [he]228-william has done . ”[101-sir thomas] “ Yes , ”[106-lady bertram] said [Lady Bertram]106-lady bertram , “ but [I]106-lady bertram wish [he]228-william was not going away . [They]5519-they are all going away , [I]106-lady bertram think . [I]106-lady bertram wish [they]5519-they would stay at [home]367-home . ”[106-lady bertram] This wish was levelled principally at [Julia]112-julia , who had just applied for permission to go to [town]3698-town with [Maria]126-maria ; and as [Sir Thomas]101-sir thomas thought it best for [each daughter]2289-each daughter that the permission should be granted , [Lady Bertram]106-lady bertram , though in [her]106-lady bertram own good - nature [she]106-lady bertram would not have prevented it , was lamenting the change it made in the prospect of [Julia]112-julia ’s return , which would otherwise have taken place about this time . A great deal of good sense followed on [Sir Thomas]101-sir thomas ’s side , tending to reconcile [[his]101-sir thomas wife]546-his wife to the arrangement . Everything that [a considerate parent]2291-a considerate parent _ ought _ to feel was advanced for [her]546-his wife use ; and everything that [an affectionate mother]2292-an affectionate mother _ must _ feel in promoting [[her]2292-an affectionate mother children]386-her children ’s enjoyment was attributed to [her]2292-an affectionate mother nature . [Lady Bertram]106-lady bertram agreed to it all with a calm “ Yes ”[106-lady bertram] ; and at the end of a quarter of an hour ’s silent consideration spontaneously observed , “ [Sir Thomas]101-sir thomas , [I]101-sir thomas have been thinking — and [I]101-sir thomas am very glad [we]5521-we took [Fanny]113-fanny as [we]5521-we did , for now [the others]347-the others are away [we]5521-we feel the good of it . ”[101-sir thomas] [Sir Thomas]101-sir thomas immediately improved this compliment by adding , “ Very true . [We]5521-we shew [Fanny]113-fanny what [a good girl]410-a good girl [we]5521-we think [her]410-a good girl by praising [her]410-a good girl to [her]410-a good girl face , [she]410-a good girl is now [a very valuable companion]5524-a very valuable companion . If [we]5521-we have been kind to _ [her]410-a good girl _ , [she]410-a good girl is now quite as necessary to _ [us]5521-we _ . ”[101-sir thomas] “ Yes , ”[106-lady bertram] said [Lady Bertram]106-lady bertram presently ; “ and it is a comfort to think that [we]5521-we shall always have _ [her]410-a good girl _ . ”[106-lady bertram] [Sir Thomas]101-sir thomas paused , half smiled , glanced at [[his]101-sir thomas niece]724-his niece , and then gravely replied , “ [She]410-a good girl will never leave [us]5521-we , [I]101-sir thomas hope , till invited to [some other home that may reasonably promise [her]410-a good girl greater happiness than [she]410-a good girl knows [here]3798-here]5525-some other home that may reasonably promise her greater happiness than she knows here . ”[101-sir thomas] “ And _ that _ is not very likely to be , [Sir Thomas]101-sir thomas . Who should invite [her]410-a good girl ? [Maria]126-maria might be very glad to see [her]410-a good girl at [Sotherton]27-sotherton now and then , but [she]126-maria would not think of asking [her]410-a good girl to live [there]3696-there ; and [I]106-lady bertram am sure [she]410-a good girl is better off [here]3798-here ; and besides , [I]106-lady bertram can not do without [her]410-a good girl . ”[106-lady bertram] The week which passed so quietly and peaceably at [the great house in [Mansfield]3-mansfield]2295-the great house in mansfield had a very different character at [the Parsonage]368-the parsonage . To [the young lady]666-the young lady , at least , in [each family]2298-each family , it brought very different feelings . What was tranquillity and comfort to [Fanny]113-fanny was tediousness and vexation to [Mary]132-mary . Something arose from difference of disposition and habit : one so easily satisfied , [the other so unused to endure]2299-the other so unused to endure ; but still more might be imputed to difference of circumstances . In some points of interest [they]2300-they were exactly opposed to each other . To [Fanny]113-fanny ’s mind , [Edmund]108-edmund ’s absence was really , in its cause and its tendency , a relief . To [Mary]132-mary it was every way painful . [She]132-mary felt the want of [his]108-edmund society every day , almost every hour , and was too much in want of it to derive anything but irritation from considering the object for which [he]108-edmund went . [He]108-edmund could not have devised anything more likely to raise [his]108-edmund consequence than this week ’s absence , occurring as it did at the very time of [[her]132-mary brother]451-her brother ’s going away , of [William Price]228-william ’s going too , and completing the sort of general break - up of a party which had been so animated . [She]132-mary felt it keenly . [They]2302-they were now [a miserable trio , confined within doors by a series of rain and snow , with nothing to do and no variety to hope for]2303-a miserable trio , confined within doors by a series of rain and snow , with nothing to do and no variety to hope for . Angry as [she]132-mary was with [Edmund]108-edmund for adhering to [his]108-edmund own notions , and acting on them in defiance of [her]132-mary ( and [she]132-mary had been so angry that [they]2302-they had hardly parted [friends]3751-friends at the ball ) , [she]132-mary could not help thinking of [him]108-edmund continually when absent , dwelling on [his]108-edmund merit and affection , and longing again for the almost daily meetings [they]2302-they lately had . [His]108-edmund absence was unnecessarily long . [He]108-edmund should not have planned such an absence — [he]108-edmund should not have left [home]367-home for a week , when [her]132-mary own departure from [Mansfield]3-mansfield was so near . Then [she]132-mary began to blame [herself]132-mary . [She]132-mary wished [she]132-mary had not spoken so warmly in [their]2302-they last conversation . [She]132-mary was afraid [she]132-mary had used some strong , some contemptuous expressions in speaking of [the clergy]4386-the clergy , and that should not have been . It was ill - bred ; it was wrong . [She]132-mary wished such words unsaid with all [her]132-mary heart . [Her]132-mary vexation did not end with the week . All this was bad , but [she]132-mary had still more to feel when [Friday]241-friday came round again and brought no [Edmund]108-edmund ; when Saturday came and still no [Edmund]108-edmund ; and when , through the slight communication with [the other family]2307-the other family which [Sunday]242-sunday produced , [she]132-mary learned that [he]108-edmund had actually written [home]367-home to defer [his]108-edmund return , having promised to remain some days longer with [[his]108-edmund friend]319-his friend . If [she]132-mary had felt impatience and regret before — if [she]132-mary had been sorry for what [she]132-mary said , and feared its too strong effect on [him]108-edmund — [she]132-mary now felt and feared it all tenfold more . [She]132-mary had , moreover , to contend with one disagreeable emotion entirely new to [her]132-mary — jealousy . [[His]108-edmund friend]319-his friend [Mr. Owen]243-mr. owen had [sisters]3676-sisters ; [he]108-edmund might find [them]3676-sisters attractive . But , at any rate , [his]108-edmund staying away at a time when , according to all preceding plans , [she]132-mary was to remove to [London]6-london , meant something that [she]132-mary could not bear . Had [Henry]131-henry returned , as [he]131-henry talked of doing , at the end of three or four days , [she]132-mary should now have been leaving [Mansfield]3-mansfield . It became absolutely necessary for [her]132-mary to get to [Fanny]113-fanny and try to learn something more . [She]132-mary could not live any longer in such solitary wretchedness ; and [she]132-mary made [her]132-mary way to [the Park]3753-the park , through difficulties of walking which [she]132-mary had deemed unconquerable a week before , for the chance of hearing a little in addition , for the sake of at least hearing [his]108-edmund name . The first half - hour was lost , for [Fanny]113-fanny and [Lady Bertram]106-lady bertram were together , and unless [she]132-mary had [Fanny]113-fanny to [herself]132-mary [she]132-mary could hope for nothing . But at last [Lady Bertram]106-lady bertram left [the room]412-the room , and then almost immediately [Miss Crawford]127-miss crawford thus began , with a voice as well regulated as [she]127-miss crawford could—“And how do _ [you]127-miss crawford _ like [[your]127-miss crawford cousin]3780-your cousin [Edmund]108-edmund ’s staying away so long ? Being [the only young person at [home]367-home]5530-the only young person at home , [I]127-miss crawford consider _ [you]127-miss crawford _ as [the greatest sufferer]5532-the greatest sufferer . [You]127-miss crawford must miss [him]108-edmund . Does [his]108-edmund staying longer surprise [you]127-miss crawford ? ”[127-miss crawford] “ [I]113-fanny do not know , ”[113-fanny] said [Fanny]113-fanny hesitatingly . “ Yes ; [I]113-fanny had not particularly expected it . ”[113-fanny] “ Perhaps [he]108-edmund will always stay longer than [he]108-edmund talks of . It is the general way [all young men]5533-all young men do . ”[127-miss crawford] “ [He]108-edmund did not , the only time [he]108-edmund went to see [Mr. Owen]243-mr. owen before . ”[127-miss crawford] “ [He]108-edmund finds [the house]427-the house more agreeable _ now _ . [He]108-edmund is a very — [a very pleasing young man]5535-a very pleasing young man [himself]108-edmund , and [I]113-fanny can not help being rather concerned at not seeing [him]108-edmund again before [I]113-fanny go to [London]6-london , as will now undoubtedly be the case . [I]113-fanny am looking for [Henry]131-henry every day , and as soon as [he]108-edmund comes there will be nothing to detain [me]113-fanny at [Mansfield]3-mansfield . [I]113-fanny should like to have seen [him]108-edmund once more , [I]113-fanny confess . But [you]5536-you must give [my]113-fanny compliments to [him]108-edmund . Yes ; [I]113-fanny think it must be compliments . Is not there a something wanted , [Miss Price]137-miss price , in [our]5537-our language — a something between compliments and — and love — to suit the sort of friendly acquaintance [we]5537-our have had together ? So many months ’ acquaintance ! But compliments may be sufficient here . Was [his]108-edmund letter a long one ? Does [he]108-edmund give [you]5536-you much account of what [he]108-edmund is doing ? Is it Christmas gaieties that [he]108-edmund is staying for ? ”[113-fanny] “ [I]127-miss crawford only heard a part of the letter ; it was to [[my]127-miss crawford uncle]3761-my uncle ; but [I]127-miss crawford believe it was very short ; indeed [I]127-miss crawford am sure it was but a few lines . A _ few _ days longer , or _ some _ days longer ; [I]127-miss crawford am not quite sure which . ”[127-miss crawford] “ Oh ! if [he]108-edmund wrote to [[his]108-edmund father]534-his father ; but [I]127-miss crawford thought it might have been to [Lady Bertram]106-lady bertram or [you]5536-you . How many [Miss Owens]244-the miss owens are there ? ”[127-miss crawford] “ [Three grown up]5543-three grown up . ”[113-fanny] “ Are [they]5543-three grown up musical ? ”[127-miss crawford] “ [I]127-miss crawford do not at all know . [I]127-miss crawford never heard . ”[127-miss crawford] “ That is the first question , [you]5536-you know , ”[127-miss crawford] said [Miss Crawford]127-miss crawford , trying to appear gay and unconcerned , “ which [every woman who plays [herself]5544-every woman who plays herself]5544-every woman who plays herself is sure to ask about another . [Two play on the pianoforte]5550-two play on the pianoforte , and [one on the harp]5551-one on the harp ; and [all]874-all sing , or would sing if [they]874-all were taught , or sing all the better for not being taught ; or something like it . ”[127-miss crawford] “ [I]113-fanny know nothing of [the Miss Owens]244-the miss owens , ”[113-fanny] said [Fanny]113-fanny calmly . “ [You]5536-you know nothing and [you]5536-you care less , as [people]3906-people say . Never did tone express indifference plainer . Indeed , how can one care for those one has never seen ? Well , when [[your]5536-you cousin]3780-your cousin comes back , [he]3780-your cousin will find [Mansfield]130-mansfield very quiet ; [all the noisy ones]5555-all the noisy ones gone , [[your]5536-you brother]3938-your brother and [mine]113-fanny and [myself]113-fanny . [I]113-fanny do not like the idea of leaving [Mrs. Grant]123-mrs. grant now the time draws near . But [I]127-miss crawford am not fishing ; do n’t compliment [me]127-miss crawford . If [I]127-miss crawford _ am _ missed , it will appear . [I]127-miss crawford may be discovered by those who want to see [me]127-miss crawford . [I]127-miss crawford shall not be in any doubtful , or [distant , or unapproachable region]5558-distant , or unapproachable region . ”[127-miss crawford] Now [Fanny]113-fanny could not bring [herself]113-fanny to speak , and [Miss Crawford]127-miss crawford was disappointed ; for [she]127-miss crawford had hoped to hear some pleasant assurance of [her]127-miss crawford power from [one who [she]127-miss crawford thought must know]2315-one who she thought must know , and [her]127-miss crawford spirits were clouded again . “ [The Miss Owens]244-the miss owens , ”[127-miss crawford] said [she]127-miss crawford , soon afterwards ; “ suppose [you]2314-you were to have one of [the Miss Owens]244-the miss owens settled at [Thornton Lacey]231-thornton lacey ; how should [you]2314-you like it ? Stranger things have happened . [I]127-miss crawford dare say [they]5559-their are trying for it . And [they]5559-their are quite in the right , for it would be a very pretty establishment for [them]5559-their . [I]127-miss crawford do not at all wonder or blame [them]5559-their . It is [everybody]408-everybody ’s duty to do as well for [themselves]408-everybody as [they]408-everybody can . [[Sir Thomas Bertram]101-sir thomas ’s son]5561-sir thomas bertram ’s son is [somebody]1115-somebody ; and now [he]5561-sir thomas bertram ’s son is in [[their]5559-their own line]5563-their own line . [[Their]5559-their father]398-their father is [a clergyman]500-a clergyman , and [[their]5559-their brother]469-their brother is [a clergyman]500-a clergyman , and [they]5559-their are [all clergymen]5568-all clergymen together . [You]113-fanny do n’t speak , [Fanny]113-fanny ; [Miss Price]137-miss price , [you]113-fanny do n’t speak . But [I]113-fanny dare say [you]113-fanny know exactly — [I]113-fanny always imagine [you]113-fanny are — perhaps [you]113-fanny do not think [him]881-her companion likely to marry at all — or not at present . ”[113-fanny] “ No , [I]113-fanny do not , ”[113-fanny] said [Fanny]113-fanny softly , hoping [she]127-miss crawford did not err either in the belief or the acknowledgment of it . [[Her]127-miss crawford companion]881-her companion looked at [her]127-miss crawford keenly ; and gathering greater spirit from the blush soon produced from such a look , only said , “ [He]881-her companion is best off as [he]881-her companion is , ”[881-her companion] and turned the subject . CHAPTER XXX [Miss Crawford]127-miss crawford ’s uneasiness was much lightened by this conversation , and [she]127-miss crawford walked [home]367-home again in spirits which might have defied almost another week of the same small party in the same bad weather , had [they]2318-they been put to the proof ; but as that very evening brought [[her]127-miss crawford brother]451-her brother down from [London]6-london again in quite , or more than quite , [his]451-her brother usual cheerfulness , [she]127-miss crawford had nothing farther to try [her]127-miss crawford own . [His]451-her brother still refusing to tell [her]127-miss crawford what [he]451-her brother had gone for was but the promotion of gaiety ; a day before it might have irritated , but now it was a pleasant joke — suspected only of concealing something planned as a pleasant surprise to [herself]127-miss crawford . And the next day [_]2320-_ did _ bring a surprise to [her]127-miss crawford . [Henry]131-henry had said [he]131-henry should just go and ask [the Bertrams]114-the miss bertrams how [they]2318-they did , and be back in ten minutes , but [he]131-henry was gone above an hour ; and when [[his]131-henry sister]511-his sister , who had been waiting for [him]131-henry to walk with [her]511-his sister in [the garden]5294-the garden , met [him]131-henry at last most impatiently in the sweep , and cried out , “ [[My]131-henry dear]3657-my dear [Henry]131-henry , where can [you]131-henry have been all this time ? ”[131-henry] [he]131-henry had only to say that [he]131-henry had been sitting with [Lady Bertram]106-lady bertram and [Fanny]113-fanny . “ Sitting with [them]5571-them an hour and a half ! ”[132-mary] exclaimed [Mary]132-mary . But this was only the beginning of [her]132-mary surprise . “ Yes , [Mary]132-mary , ”[131-henry] said [he]131-henry , drawing [her]132-mary arm within [his]131-henry , and walking along [the sweep]2323-the sweep as if not knowing where [he]131-henry was : “ [I]131-henry could not get away sooner ; [Fanny]113-fanny looked so lovely ! [I]131-henry am quite determined , [Mary]132-mary . [My]131-henry mind is entirely made up . Will it astonish [you]132-mary ? No : [you]132-mary must be aware that [I]131-henry am quite determined to marry [Fanny Price]113-fanny . ”[131-henry] The surprise was now complete ; for , in spite of whatever [his]131-henry consciousness might suggest , a suspicion of [his]131-henry having any such views had never entered [[his]131-henry sister]511-his sister ’s imagination ; and [she]132-mary looked so truly the astonishment [she]132-mary felt , that [he]131-henry was obliged to repeat what [he]131-henry had said , and more fully and more solemnly . The conviction of [his]131-henry determination once admitted , it was not unwelcome . There was even pleasure with the surprise . [Mary]132-mary was in a state of mind to rejoice in a connexion with [the Bertram family]2325-the bertram family , and to be not displeased with [[her]132-mary brother]451-her brother ’s marrying a little beneath [him]131-henry . “ Yes , [Mary]132-mary , ”[131-henry] was [Henry]131-henry ’s concluding assurance . “ [I]131-henry am fairly caught . [You]132-mary know with what idle designs [I]131-henry began ; but this is the end of them . [I]131-henry have , [I]131-henry flatter [myself]131-henry , made no inconsiderable progress in [her]132-mary affections ; but [my]131-henry own are entirely fixed . ”[131-henry] “ Lucky , [lucky girl]5572-lucky girl ! ”[132-mary] cried [Mary]132-mary , as soon as [she]132-mary could speak ; “ what a match for [her]132-mary ! [[My]132-mary dearest]5134-my dearest [Henry]131-henry , this must be [my]132-mary _ first _ feeling ; but [my]132-mary _ second _ , which [you]131-henry shall have as sincerely , is , that [I]132-mary approve [your]131-henry choice from [my]132-mary soul , and foresee [your]131-henry happiness as heartily as [I]132-mary wish and desire it . [You]131-henry will have [a sweet little wife]5574-a sweet little wife ; all gratitude and devotion . Exactly what [you]131-henry deserve . What an amazing match for [her]132-mary ! [Mrs. Norris]105-mrs. norris often talks of [her]132-mary luck ; what will [she]132-mary say now ? The delight of [all the family]5575-all the family , indeed ! And [she]132-mary has [some _ true _ friends]5576-some _ true _ friends in it ! How _ [they]5576-some _ true _ friends _ will rejoice ! But tell [me]132-mary all about it ! Talk to [me]132-mary for ever . When did [you]131-henry begin to think seriously about [her]132-mary ? ”[132-mary] Nothing could be more impossible than to answer such a question , though nothing could be more agreeable than to have it asked . “ How the pleasing plague had stolen on [him]2327-he ”[2327-he] [he]2327-he could not say ; and before [he]2327-he had expressed the same sentiment with a little variation of words three times over , [[his]2327-he sister]511-his sister eagerly interrupted [him]2327-he with , “ Ah , [[my]511-his sister dear]3657-my dear [Henry]131-henry , and this is what took [you]2327-he to [London]6-london ! This was [your]2327-he business ! [You]2327-he chose to consult [the Admiral]715-the admiral before [you]2327-he made up [your]2327-he mind . ”[511-his sister] But this [he]2327-he stoutly denied . [He]2327-he knew [[his]2327-he uncle]526-his uncle too well to consult [him]526-his uncle on any matrimonial scheme . [The Admiral]715-the admiral hated marriage , and thought it never pardonable in [a young man of independent fortune]2331-a young man of independent fortune . “ When [Fanny]113-fanny is known to [him]715-the admiral , ”[131-henry] continued [Henry]131-henry , “ [he]715-the admiral will doat on [her]5579-she . [She]5579-she is exactly [the woman to do away every prejudice of such a man as [the Admiral]715-the admiral]5580-the woman to do away every prejudice of such a man as the admiral , for [she]5579-she is exactly [such a woman as [he]715-the admiral thinks does not exist in [the world]315-the world]5582-such a woman as he thinks does not exist in the world . [She]5579-she is the very impossibility [he]715-the admiral would describe , if indeed [he]715-the admiral has now delicacy of language enough to embody [his]715-the admiral own ideas . But till it is absolutely settled — settled beyond all interference , [he]715-the admiral shall know nothing of the matter . No , [Mary]132-mary , [you]132-mary are quite mistaken . [You]132-mary have not discovered [my]131-henry business yet . ”[131-henry] “ Well , well , [I]715-the admiral am satisfied . [I]715-the admiral know now to whom it must relate , and am in no hurry for the rest . [Fanny Price]113-fanny ! wonderful , quite wonderful ! That [Mansfield]130-mansfield should have done so much for — that _ [you]132-mary _ should have found [your]132-mary fate in [Mansfield]3-mansfield ! But [you]132-mary are quite right ; [you]132-mary could not have chosen better . There is not [a better girl in [the world]315-the world]5584-a better girl in the world , and [you]132-mary do not want for fortune ; and as to [her]5584-a better girl in the world connexions , they are more than good . [The Bertrams]114-the miss bertrams are undoubtedly [some of the first people in [this country]3672-this country]5586-some of the first people in this country . [She]5584-a better girl in the world is niece to [Sir Thomas Bertram]101-sir thomas ; that will be enough for [the world]315-the world . But go on , go on . Tell [me]715-the admiral more . What are [your]132-mary plans ? Does [she]5584-a better girl in the world know [her]5584-a better girl in the world own happiness ? ”[715-the admiral] “ No . ”[131-henry] “ What are [you]132-mary waiting for ? ”[131-henry] “ For — for very little more than opportunity . [Mary]132-mary , [she]5584-a better girl in the world is not like [[her]5584-a better girl in the world cousins]3671-her cousins ; but [I]715-the admiral think [I]715-the admiral shall not ask in vain . ”[715-the admiral] “ Oh no ! [you]132-mary can not . Were [you]132-mary even less pleasing — supposing [her]5584-a better girl in the world not to love [you]132-mary already ( of which , however , [I]131-henry can have little doubt)—you would be safe . The gentleness and gratitude of [her]5584-a better girl in the world disposition would secure [her]5584-a better girl in the world all [your]132-mary own immediately . From [my]131-henry soul [I]131-henry do not think [she]5584-a better girl in the world would marry [you]132-mary _ without _ love ; that is , if there is [a girl in [the world]315-the world]5590-a girl in the world capable of being uninfluenced by ambition , [I]131-henry can suppose it [her]5584-a better girl in the world ; but ask [her]5584-a better girl in the world to love [you]132-mary , and [she]5584-a better girl in the world will never have the heart to refuse . ”[131-henry] As soon as [her]2332-her eagerness could rest in silence , [he]2333-he was as happy to tell as [she]2332-her could be to listen ; and a conversation followed almost as deeply interesting to [her]2332-her as to [himself]2333-he , though [he]2333-he had in fact nothing to relate but [his]2333-he own sensations , nothing to dwell on but [Fanny]113-fanny ’s charms . [Fanny]113-fanny ’s beauty of face and figure , [Fanny]113-fanny ’s graces of manner and goodness of heart , were the exhaustless theme . The gentleness , modesty , and sweetness of [her]2332-her character were warmly expatiated on ; that sweetness which makes so essential a part of [every woman]2334-every woman ’s worth in the judgment of [man]2335-man , that though [he]2335-man sometimes loves where it is not , [he]2335-man can never believe it absent . [Her]2332-her temper [he]2333-he had good reason to depend on and to praise . [He]2333-he had often seen it tried . Was there [one of [the family]3724-the family]2336-one of the family , excepting [Edmund]108-edmund , who had not in some way or other continually exercised [her]2332-her patience and forbearance ? [Her]2332-her affections were evidently strong . To see [her]2332-her with [[her]2332-her brother]451-her brother ! What could more delightfully prove that the warmth of [her]2332-her heart was equal to its gentleness ? What could be more encouraging to [a man who had [her]2332-her love in view]2339-a man who had her love in view ? Then , [her]2332-her understanding was beyond every suspicion , quick and clear ; and [her]2332-her manners were the mirror of [her]2332-her own modest and elegant mind . Nor was this all . [Henry Crawford]131-henry had too much sense not to feel the worth of good principles in [a wife]537-a wife , though [he]131-henry was too little accustomed to serious reflection to know [them]2341-them by [their]2341-them proper name ; but when [he]131-henry talked of [her]2332-her having such a steadiness and regularity of conduct , such a high notion of honour , and such an observance of decorum as might warrant [any man]845-any man in the fullest dependence on [her]2332-her faith and integrity , [he]131-henry expressed what was inspired by the knowledge of [her]2332-her being well principled and religious . “ [I]131-henry could so wholly and absolutely confide in [her]2332-her , ”[131-henry] said [he]131-henry ; “ and _ that _ is what [I]131-henry want . ”[131-henry] Well might [[his]131-henry sister]511-his sister , believing as [she]511-his sister really did that [his]131-henry opinion of [Fanny Price]113-fanny was scarcely beyond [her]511-his sister merits , rejoice in [her]511-his sister prospects . “ The more [I]511-his sister think of it , ”[511-his sister] [she]511-his sister cried , “ the more am [I]511-his sister convinced that [you]131-henry are doing quite right ; and though [I]511-his sister should never have selected [Fanny Price]113-fanny as [the girl most likely to attach [you]131-henry]5592-the girl most likely to attach you , [I]511-his sister am now persuaded [she]2332-her is the very one to make [you]131-henry happy . [Your]131-henry wicked project upon [her]2332-her peace turns out a clever thought indeed . [You]131-henry will both find [your]131-henry good in it . ”[511-his sister] “ It was bad , very bad in [me]511-his sister against [such a creature]5593-such a creature ; but [I]511-his sister did not know [her]2332-her then ; and [she]2332-her shall have no reason to lament the hour that first put it into [my]511-his sister head . [I]511-his sister will make [her]2332-her very happy , [Mary]132-mary ; happier than [she]2332-her has ever yet been [herself]2332-her , or ever seen [anybody else]4752-anybody else . [I]511-his sister will not take [her]2332-her from [Northamptonshire]15-northamptonshire . [I]511-his sister shall let [Everingham]31-everingham , and rent a place in [this neighbourhood]3670-this neighbourhood ; perhaps [Stanwix Lodge]77-stanwix lodge . [I]511-his sister shall let a seven years ’ lease of [Everingham]31-everingham . [I]511-his sister am sure of [an excellent tenant at half a word]5596-an excellent tenant at half a word . [I]511-his sister could name [three people]1858-three people now , who would give [me]511-his sister [my]511-his sister own terms and thank [me]511-his sister . ”[511-his sister] “ Ha ! ”[132-mary] cried [Mary]132-mary ; “ settle in [Northamptonshire]15-northamptonshire ! That is pleasant ! Then [we]5598-we shall be [all together]5599-all together . ”[132-mary] When [she]132-mary had spoken it , [she]132-mary recollected [herself]132-mary , and wished it unsaid ; but there was no need of confusion ; for [[her]132-mary brother]451-her brother saw [her]132-mary only as [the supposed inmate of [Mansfield parsonage]2346-mansfield parsonage]2345-the supposed inmate of mansfield parsonage , and replied but to invite [her]132-mary in the kindest manner to [[his]451-her brother own house]1569-his own house , and to claim the best right in [her]132-mary . “ [You]132-mary must give [us]5598-we more than half [your]132-mary time , ”[451-her brother] said [he]451-her brother . “ [I]451-her brother can not admit [Mrs. Grant]123-mrs. grant to have an equal claim with [Fanny]113-fanny and [myself]451-her brother , for [we]5598-we shall both have a right in [you]132-mary . [Fanny]113-fanny will be so truly [[your]132-mary sister]4444-your sister ! ”[451-her brother] [Mary]132-mary had only to be grateful and give general assurances ; but [she]132-mary was now very fully purposed to be [the guest of [neither brother]2349-neither brother nor [sister]3704-sister]2348-the guest of neither brother nor sister many months longer . “ [You]132-mary will divide [your]132-mary year between [London]6-london and [Northamptonshire]15-northamptonshire ? ”[2348-the guest of neither brother nor sister] “ Yes . ”[451-her brother] “ That ’s right ; and in [London]6-london , of course , [a house of [your]132-mary own]5601-a house of your own : no longer with [the Admiral]715-the admiral . [[My]2348-the guest of neither brother nor sister dearest]5134-my dearest [Henry]131-henry , the advantage to [you]132-mary of getting away from [the Admiral]715-the admiral before [your]132-mary manners are hurt by the contagion of [his]715-the admiral , before [you]132-mary have contracted any of [his]715-the admiral foolish opinions , or learned to sit over [your]132-mary dinner as if it were the best blessing of life ! _ [You]132-mary _ are not sensible of the gain , for [your]132-mary regard for [him]715-the admiral has blinded [you]132-mary ; but , in [my]2348-the guest of neither brother nor sister estimation , [your]132-mary marrying early may be the saving of [you]132-mary . To have seen [you]132-mary grow like [the Admiral]715-the admiral in word or deed , look or gesture , would have broken [my]2348-the guest of neither brother nor sister heart . ”[2348-the guest of neither brother nor sister] “ Well , well , [we]5606-we do not think quite alike here . [The Admiral]715-the admiral has [his]715-the admiral faults , but [he]715-the admiral is [a very good man]5608-a very good man , and has been more than [a father]5609-a father to [me]132-mary . but [she]132-mary could not help _ this _ reflection on [the Admiral]128-admiral crawford . “ [Henry]131-henry , [I]132-mary think so highly of [Fanny Price]113-fanny , that if [I]132-mary could suppose [the next Mrs. Crawford]129-mrs. crawford would have half the reason which [[my]132-mary poor ill - used aunt]5613-my poor ill - used aunt had to abhor the very name , [I]132-mary would prevent the marriage , if possible ; but [I]132-mary know [you]131-henry : [I]132-mary know that [a wife [you]131-henry _ loved]5614-a wife you _ loved _ would be the happiest of [women]988-women , and that even when [you]131-henry ceased to love , [she]5614-a wife you _ loved would yet find in [you]131-henry the liberality and good - breeding of [a gentleman]4549-a gentleman . ”[132-mary] The impossibility of not doing everything in [the world]315-the world to make [Fanny Price]113-fanny happy , or of ceasing to love [Fanny Price]113-fanny , was of course the groundwork of [his]2354-his eloquent answer . “ Had [you]132-mary seen [her]5614-a wife you _ loved this morning , [Mary]132-mary , ”[2354-his] [he]2354-his continued , “ attending with such ineffable sweetness and patience to all the demands of [[her]5614-a wife you _ loved aunt]463-her aunt ’s stupidity , working with [her]5614-a wife you _ loved , and for [her]5614-a wife you _ loved , [her]5614-a wife you _ loved colour beautifully heightened as [she]5614-a wife you _ loved leant over the work , then returning to [her]5614-a wife you _ loved seat to finish a note which [she]5614-a wife you _ loved was previously engaged in writing for [that stupid woman]5618-that stupid woman ’s service , and all this with such unpretending gentleness , so much as if it were a matter of course that [she]5614-a wife you _ loved was not to have a moment at [her]5614-a wife you _ loved own command , [her]5614-a wife you _ loved hair arranged as neatly as it always is , and one little curl falling forward as [she]5614-a wife you _ loved wrote , which [she]5614-a wife you _ loved now and then shook back , and in the midst of all this , still speaking at intervals to _ [me]2354-his _ , or listening , and as if [she]5614-a wife you _ loved liked to listen , to what [I]2354-his said . Had [you]2355-you seen [her]5614-a wife you _ loved so , [Mary]132-mary , [you]2355-you would not have implied the possibility of [her]5614-a wife you _ loved power over [my]2354-his heart ever ceasing . ”[2354-his] “ [[My]132-mary dearest]5134-my dearest [Henry]131-henry , ”[132-mary] cried [Mary]132-mary , stopping short , and smiling in [his]2355-you face , “ how glad [I]132-mary am to see [you]2355-you so much in love ! It quite delights [me]132-mary . But what will [Mrs. Rushworth]126-maria and [Julia]112-julia say ? ”[132-mary] “ [I]2356-i care neither what [they]5620-they say nor what [they]5620-they feel . [They]5620-they will now see what sort of woman it is that can attach [me]2356-i , that can attach [a man of sense]5621-a man of sense . [I]2356-i wish the discovery may do [them]5620-they any good . And [they]5620-they will now see [[their]5620-they cousin]3735-their cousin treated as [she]3735-their cousin ought to be , and [I]2356-i wish [they]5620-they may be heartily ashamed of [their]5620-they own abominable neglect and unkindness . [They]5620-they will be angry , ”[2356-i] [he]2356-i added , after a moment ’s silence , and in a cooler tone ; “ [Mrs. Rushworth]126-maria will be very angry . It will be a bitter pill to [her]126-maria ; that is , like other bitter pills , it will have two moments ’ ill flavour , and then be swallowed and forgotten ; for [I]2356-i am [not such a coxcomb]5623-not such a coxcomb as to suppose [her]126-maria feelings more lasting than [other women]5068-other women ’s , though _ [I]2356-i _ was the object of them . Yes , [Mary]132-mary , [[my]2356-i Fanny]5625-my fanny will feel a difference indeed : a daily , hourly difference , in the behaviour of [every being who approaches [her]5625-my fanny]5626-every being who approaches her ; and it will be the completion of [my]2356-i happiness to know that [I]2356-i am [the doer of it]5627-the doer of it , that [I]2356-i am the person to give the consequence so justly [her]5625-my fanny due . Now [she]5625-my fanny is dependent , helpless , friendless , neglected , forgotten . ”[2356-i] “ Nay , [Henry]131-henry , not by all ; not forgotten by all ; not friendless or forgotten . [[Her]5625-my fanny cousin]3692-her cousin [Edmund]108-edmund never forgets [her]5625-my fanny . ”[132-mary] “ [Edmund]108-edmund ! True , [I]2356-i believe [he]108-edmund is , generally speaking , kind to [her]5625-my fanny , and so is [Sir Thomas]101-sir thomas in [his]108-edmund way ; but it is the way of [a rich , superior , long - worded , arbitrary uncle]5629-a rich , superior , long - worded , arbitrary uncle . What can [Sir Thomas]101-sir thomas and [Edmund]108-edmund together do , what _ do _ [they]1504-the two ladies do for [her]5625-my fanny happiness , comfort , honour , and dignity in [the world]315-the world , to what [I]2356-i _ shall _ do ? ”[2356-i] CHAPTER XXXI [Henry Crawford]131-henry was at [Mansfield Park]130-mansfield again the next morning , and at an earlier hour than common visiting warrants . [The two ladies]1504-the two ladies were together in [the breakfast - room]3756-the breakfast - room , and , fortunately for [him]131-henry , [Lady Bertram]106-lady bertram was on the very point of quitting it as [he]131-henry entered . [She]106-lady bertram was almost at the door , and not chusing by any means to take so much trouble in vain , [she]106-lady bertram still went on , after a civil reception , a short sentence about being waited for , and a “ Let [Sir Thomas]101-sir thomas know ”[106-lady bertram] to [the servant]2068-the servant . [Henry]131-henry , overjoyed to have [her]106-lady bertram go , bowed and watched [her]106-lady bertram off , and without losing another moment , turned instantly to [Fanny]113-fanny , and , taking out some letters , said , with a most animated look , “ [I]113-fanny must acknowledge [myself]113-fanny infinitely obliged to any creature who gives [me]113-fanny such an opportunity of seeing [you]113-fanny alone : [I]113-fanny have been wishing it more than [you]113-fanny can have any idea . Knowing as [I]113-fanny do what [your]113-fanny feelings as [a sister]3681-a sister are , [I]113-fanny could hardly have borne that [any one in [the house]427-the house]5632-any one in the house should share with [you]113-fanny in the first knowledge of the news [I]113-fanny now bring . [He]5632-any one in the house is made . [[Your]113-fanny brother]3938-your brother is [a lieutenant]5408-a lieutenant . [I]113-fanny have the infinite satisfaction of congratulating [you]113-fanny on [[your]113-fanny brother]3938-your brother ’s promotion . Here are the letters which announce it , this moment come to hand . [You]113-fanny will , perhaps , like to see them . ”[113-fanny] [Fanny]113-fanny could not speak , but [he]2360-he did not want [her]2361-her to speak . To see the expression of [her]2361-her eyes , the change of [her]2361-her complexion , the progress of [her]2361-her feelings , their doubt , confusion , and felicity , was enough . [She]2361-her took the letters as [he]2360-he gave them . The first was from [the Admiral]715-the admiral to inform [[his]715-the admiral nephew]1994-his nephew , in a few words , of [his]715-the admiral having succeeded in the object [he]715-the admiral had undertaken , the promotion of [young Price]113-fanny , and enclosing two more , one from [the Secretary of [the First Lord]2365-the first lord]2364-the secretary of the first lord to [a friend]456-a friend , whom [the Admiral]715-the admiral had set to work in the business , the other from [that friend to [himself]2360-he]2368-that friend to himself , by which it appeared that [[his]715-the admiral lordship]2369-his lordship had the very great happiness of attending to the recommendation of [Sir Charles]245-charles ; that [Sir Charles]245-charles was much delighted in having such an opportunity of proving [his]245-charles regard for [Admiral Crawford]128-admiral crawford , and that the circumstance of [Mr. William Price]228-william ’s commission as [Second Lieutenant of H.M. Sloop Thrush]2370-second lieutenant of h.m. sloop thrush being made out was spreading general joy through a wide circle of [great people]2371-great people . While [her]2372-her hand was trembling under these letters , [her]2372-her eye running from one to the other , and [her]2372-her heart swelling with emotion , [Crawford]131-henry thus continued , with unfeigned eagerness , to express [his]131-henry interest in the event — “ [I]131-henry will not talk of [my]131-henry own happiness , ”[131-henry] said [he]131-henry , “ great as it is , for [I]131-henry think only of [yours]2372-her . Compared with [you]2372-her , who has a right to be happy ? [I]131-henry have almost grudged [myself]131-henry [my]131-henry own prior knowledge of what [you]2372-her ought to have known before all [the world]315-the world . [I]131-henry have not lost a moment , however . The post was late this morning , but there has not been since a moment ’s delay . How impatient , how anxious , how wild [I]131-henry have been on the subject , [I]131-henry will not attempt to describe ; how severely mortified , how cruelly disappointed , in not having it finished while [I]131-henry was in [London]6-london ! [I]131-henry was kept [there]3696-there from day to day in the hope of it , for nothing less dear to [me]131-henry than such an object would have detained [me]131-henry half the time from [Mansfield]3-mansfield . But though [[my]131-henry uncle]3761-my uncle entered into [my]131-henry wishes with all the warmth [I]131-henry could desire , and exerted [himself]3761-my uncle immediately , there were difficulties from the absence of [one friend]5640-one friend , and the engagements of another , which at last [I]131-henry could no longer bear to stay the end of , and knowing in what good hands [I]131-henry left the cause , [I]131-henry came away on Monday , trusting that many posts would not pass before [I]131-henry should be followed by such very letters as these . [[My]131-henry uncle]3761-my uncle , who is [the very best man in [the world]315-the world]5642-the very best man in the world , has exerted [himself]3761-my uncle , as [I]131-henry knew [he]3761-my uncle would , after seeing [[your]5644-your brother]3938-your brother . [He]3761-my uncle was delighted with [him]3761-my uncle . [I]131-henry would not allow [myself]131-henry yesterday to say how delighted , or to repeat half that [the Admiral]715-the admiral said in [his]3761-my uncle praise . [I]131-henry deferred it all till [his]3761-my uncle praise should be proved the praise of [a friend]456-a friend , as this day _ does _ prove it . _ Now _ [I]131-henry may say that even [I]131-henry could not require [William Price]228-william to excite a greater interest , or be followed by warmer wishes and higher commendation , than were most voluntarily bestowed by [[my]131-henry uncle]3761-my uncle after the evening [they]5649-they had passed together . ”[131-henry] “ Has this been all _ [your]131-henry _ doing , then ? ”[113-fanny] cried [Fanny]113-fanny . “ Good heaven ! how very , very kind ! Have [you]131-henry really — was it by _ [your]131-henry _ desire ? [I]113-fanny beg [your]131-henry pardon , but [I]113-fanny am bewildered . Did [Admiral Crawford]128-admiral crawford apply ? How was it ? [I]113-fanny am stupefied . ”[113-fanny] [Henry]131-henry was most happy to make it more intelligible , by beginning at an earlier stage , and explaining very particularly what [he]131-henry had done . [His]131-henry last journey to [London]6-london had been undertaken with no other view than that of introducing [[her]2373-she brother]451-her brother in [Hill Street]20-hill street , and prevailing on [the Admiral]715-the admiral to exert whatever interest [he]131-henry might have for getting [him]715-the admiral on . This had been [his]131-henry business . [He]131-henry had communicated it to [no creature]2376-no creature : [he]131-henry had not breathed a syllable of it even to [Mary]132-mary ; while uncertain of the issue , [he]131-henry could not have borne any participation of [his]131-henry feelings , but this had been [his]131-henry business ; and [he]131-henry spoke with such a glow of what [his]131-henry solicitude had been , and used such strong expressions , was so abounding in the _ deepest _ _ interest _ , in _ twofold _ _ motives _ , in _ views _ _ and _ _ wishes _ _ more _ _ than _ _ could _ _ be _ _ told _ , that [Fanny]113-fanny could not have remained insensible of [his]131-henry drift , had [she]2373-she been able to attend ; but [her]2373-she heart was so full and [her]2373-she senses still so astonished , that [she]2373-she could listen but imperfectly even to what [he]131-henry told [her]2373-she of [William]228-william , and saying only when [he]131-henry paused , “ How kind ! how very kind ! Oh , [Mr. Crawford]133-mr. crawford , [we]5650-we are infinitely obliged to [you]2373-she ! Dearest , dearest [William]228-william ! ”[131-henry] [She]2373-she jumped up and moved in haste towards the door , crying out , “ [I]2373-she will go to [[my]2373-she uncle]3761-my uncle . [[My]2373-she uncle]3761-my uncle ought to know it as soon as possible . ”[2373-she] But this could not be suffered . The opportunity was too fair , and [his]131-henry feelings too impatient . [He]131-henry was after [her]2373-she immediately . “ [She]2373-she must not go , [she]2373-she must allow [him]131-henry five minutes longer , ”[131-henry] and [he]131-henry took [her]2373-she hand and led [her]2373-she back to [her]2373-she seat , and was in the middle of [his]131-henry farther explanation , before [she]2373-she had suspected for what [she]2373-she was detained . When [she]2373-she did understand it , however , and found [herself]2373-she expected to believe that [she]2373-she had created sensations which [his]131-henry heart had never known before , and that everything [he]131-henry had done for [William]228-william was to be placed to the account of [his]131-henry excessive and unequalled attachment to [her]2373-she , [she]2373-she was exceedingly distressed , and for some moments unable to speak . [She]2373-she considered it all as nonsense , as mere trifling and gallantry , which meant only to deceive for the hour ; [she]2373-she could not but feel that it was treating [her]2373-she improperly and unworthily , and in such a way as [she]2373-she had not deserved ; but it was like [himself]131-henry , and entirely of a piece with what [she]2373-she had seen before ; and [she]2373-she would not allow [herself]2373-she to shew half the displeasure [she]2373-she felt , because [he]131-henry had been conferring an obligation , which no want of delicacy on [his]131-henry part could make a trifle to [her]2373-she . While [her]2373-she heart was still bounding with joy and gratitude on [William]228-william ’s behalf , [she]2373-she could not be severely resentful of anything that injured only [herself]2373-she ; and after having twice drawn back [her]2373-she hand , and twice attempted in vain to turn away from [him]131-henry , [she]2373-she got up , and said only , with much agitation , “ Do n’t , [Mr. Crawford]133-mr. crawford , pray do n’t ! [I]2373-she beg [you]131-henry would not . This is a sort of talking which is very unpleasant to [me]2373-she . [I]2373-she must go away . [I]2373-she can not bear it . ”[2373-she] But [he]131-henry was still talking on , describing [his]131-henry affection , soliciting a return , and , finally , in words so plain as to bear but one meaning even to [her]2373-she , offering [himself]131-henry , hand , fortune , everything , to [her]2373-she acceptance . It was so ; [he]131-henry had said it . [Her]2373-she astonishment and confusion increased ; and though still not knowing how to suppose [him]131-henry serious , [she]2373-she could hardly stand . [He]131-henry pressed for an answer . “ No , no , no ! ”[2373-she] [she]2373-she cried , hiding [her]2373-she face . “ This is all nonsense . Do not distress [me]2373-she . [I]2373-she can hear no more of this . [Your]131-henry kindness to [William]228-william makes [me]2373-she more obliged to [you]131-henry than words can express ; but [I]2373-she do not want , [I]2373-she can not bear , [I]2373-she must not listen to such — No , no , do n’t think of [me]2373-she . But [you]131-henry are _ not _ thinking of [me]2373-she . [I]2373-she know it is all nothing . ”[2373-she] [She]2373-she had burst away from [him]131-henry , and at that moment [Sir Thomas]101-sir thomas was heard speaking to [a servant in [his]101-sir thomas way towards [the room [they]2379-they were in]2378-the room they were in]2377-a servant in his way towards the room they were in . It was no time for farther assurances or entreaty , though to part with [her]2373-she at a moment when [her]2373-she modesty alone seemed , to [his]101-sir thomas sanguine and preassured mind , to stand in the way of the happiness [he]101-sir thomas sought , was a cruel necessity . [She]2373-she rushed out at an opposite door from [the one [[her]2373-she uncle]312-her uncle was approaching]2380-the one her uncle was approaching , and was walking up and down [the East room]1380-the east room in the utmost confusion of contrary feeling , before [Sir Thomas]101-sir thomas ’s politeness or apologies were over , or [he]101-sir thomas had reached the beginning of the joyful intelligence which [[his]101-sir thomas visitor]2383-his visitor came to communicate . [She]2373-she was feeling , thinking , trembling about everything ; agitated , happy , miserable , infinitely obliged , absolutely angry . It was all beyond belief ! [He]101-sir thomas was inexcusable , incomprehensible ! But such were [his]101-sir thomas habits that [he]101-sir thomas could do nothing without a mixture of evil . [He]101-sir thomas had previously made [her]2373-she the happiest of [human beings]2384-human beings , and now [he]101-sir thomas had insulted — [she]2373-she knew not what to say , how to class , or how to regard it . [She]2373-she would not have [him]101-sir thomas be serious , and yet what could excuse the use of such words and offers , if they meant but to trifle ? But [William]228-william was [a lieutenant]5408-a lieutenant . _ That _ was a fact beyond a doubt , and without an alloy . [She]2373-she would think of it for ever and forget all the rest . [Mr. Crawford]133-mr. crawford would certainly never address [her]2373-she so again : [he]133-mr. crawford must have seen how unwelcome it was to [her]2373-she ; and in that case , how gratefully [she]2373-she could esteem [him]133-mr. crawford for [his]133-mr. crawford friendship to [William]228-william ! [She]2373-she would not stir farther from [the East room]1380-the east room than the head of the great staircase , till [she]2373-she had satisfied [herself]2373-she of [Mr. Crawford]133-mr. crawford ’s having left [the house]427-the house ; but when convinced of [his]101-sir thomas being gone , [she]2373-she was eager to go down and be with [[her]2373-she uncle]312-her uncle , and have all the happiness of [his]101-sir thomas joy as well as [her]2373-she own , and all the benefit of [his]101-sir thomas information or [his]101-sir thomas conjectures as to what would now be [William]228-william ’s destination . [Sir Thomas]101-sir thomas was as joyful as [she]2373-she could desire , and very kind and communicative ; and [she]2373-she had so comfortable a talk with [him]101-sir thomas about [William]228-william as to make [her]2373-she feel as if nothing had occurred to vex [her]2373-she , till [she]2373-she found , towards the close , that [Mr. Crawford]133-mr. crawford was engaged to return and dine [there]3696-there that very day . This was a most unwelcome hearing , for though [he]133-mr. crawford might think nothing of what had passed , it would be quite distressing to [her]2373-she to see [him]133-mr. crawford again so soon . [She]2373-she tried to get the better of it ; tried very hard , as the dinner hour approached , to feel and appear as usual ; but it was quite impossible for [her]2373-she not to look most shy and uncomfortable when [[their]2390-their visitor]2391-their visitor entered [the room]412-the room . [She]2373-she could not have supposed it in the power of any concurrence of circumstances to give [her]2373-she so many painful sensations on the first day of hearing of [William]228-william ’s promotion . [Mr. Crawford]133-mr. crawford was not only in [the room]412-the room — [he]133-mr. crawford was soon close to [her]2373-she . [He]133-mr. crawford had a note to deliver from [[his]133-mr. crawford sister]511-his sister . [Fanny]113-fanny could not look at [him]133-mr. crawford , but there was no consciousness of past folly in [his]133-mr. crawford voice . [She]2373-she opened [her]2373-she note immediately , glad to have anything to do , and happy , as [she]2373-she read it , to feel that the fidgetings of [[her]2373-she aunt]463-her aunt Norris , who was also to dine [there]3696-there , screened [her]2373-she a little from view . “ [[MY]463-her aunt DEAR]3657-my dear FANNY,—for so [I]463-her aunt may now always call [you]113-fanny , to the infinite relief of a tongue that has been stumbling at _ Miss _ _ Price _ for at least the last six weeks — [I]463-her aunt can not let [[my]463-her aunt brother]5456-my brother go without sending [you]113-fanny a few lines of general congratulation , and giving [my]463-her aunt most joyful consent and approval . Go on , [[my]463-her aunt dear]3657-my dear [Fanny]113-fanny , and without fear ; there can be no difficulties worth naming . [I]463-her aunt chuse to suppose that the assurance of [my]463-her aunt consent will be something ; so [you]113-fanny may smile upon [him]5456-my brother with [your]113-fanny sweetest smiles this afternoon , and send [him]5456-my brother back to [me]463-her aunt even happier than [he]5456-my brother goes . [Yours]113-fanny affectionately , [M. C. ”]5656-m. c. ”[463-her aunt] These were not expressions to do [Fanny]113-fanny any good ; for though [she]2397-she read in too much haste and confusion to form the clearest judgment of [Miss Crawford]127-miss crawford ’s meaning , it was evident that [she]127-miss crawford meant to compliment [her]2397-she on [[her]2397-she brother]451-her brother ’s attachment , and even to _ appear _ to believe it serious . [She]2397-she did not know what to do , or what to think . There was wretchedness in the idea of its being serious ; there was perplexity and agitation every way . [She]2397-she was distressed whenever [Mr. Crawford]133-mr. crawford spoke to [her]2397-she , and [he]133-mr. crawford spoke to [her]2397-she much too often ; and [she]2397-she was afraid there was a something in [his]133-mr. crawford voice and manner in addressing [her]2397-she very different from what [they]2399-they were when [he]133-mr. crawford talked to [the others]347-the others . [Her]2397-she comfort in that day ’s dinner was quite destroyed : [she]2397-she could hardly eat anything ; and when [Sir Thomas]101-sir thomas good - humouredly observed that joy had taken away [her]2397-she appetite , [she]2397-she was ready to sink with shame , from the dread of [Mr. Crawford]133-mr. crawford ’s interpretation ; for though nothing could have tempted [her]2397-she to turn [her]2397-she eyes to the right hand , where [he]133-mr. crawford sat , [she]2397-she felt that _ [his]133-mr. crawford _ were immediately directed towards [her]2397-she . [She]2397-she was more silent than ever . [She]2397-she would hardly join even when [William]228-william was the subject , for [his]228-william commission came all from the right hand too , and there was pain in the connexion . [She]2397-she thought [Lady Bertram]106-lady bertram sat longer than ever , and began to be in despair of ever getting away ; but at last [they]2401-they were in [the drawing - room]420-the drawing - room , and [she]2397-she was able to think as [she]2397-she would , while [[her]2397-she aunts]624-her aunts finished the subject of [William]228-william ’s appointment in [their]624-her aunts own style . [Mrs. Norris]105-mrs. norris seemed as much delighted with the saving it would be to [Sir Thomas]101-sir thomas as with any part of it . “ _ Now _ [William]228-william would be able to keep [himself]228-william , which would make a vast difference to [[his]228-william uncle]526-his uncle , for it was unknown how much [he]228-william had cost [[his]228-william uncle]526-his uncle ; and , indeed , it would make some difference in _ [her]2397-she _ presents too . [She]2397-she was very glad that [she]2397-she had given [William]228-william what [she]2397-she did at parting , very glad , indeed , that it had been in [her]2397-she power , without material inconvenience , just at that time to give [him]228-william something rather considerable ; that is , for _ [her]2397-she _ , with _ [her]2397-she _ limited means , for now it would all be useful in helping to fit up [[his]228-william cabin]5659-his cabin . [She]2397-she knew [he]228-william must be at some expense , that [he]228-william would have many things to buy , though to be sure [[his]228-william father]534-his father and [mother]3977-mother would be able to put [him]228-william in the way of getting everything very cheap ; but [she]2397-she was very glad [she]2397-she had contributed [her]2397-she mite towards it . ”[105-mrs. norris] “ [I]106-lady bertram am glad [you]106-lady bertram gave [him]228-william something considerable , ”[106-lady bertram] said [Lady Bertram]106-lady bertram , with most unsuspicious calmness , “ for _ [I]106-lady bertram _ gave [him]228-william only £ 10 . ”[106-lady bertram] “ Indeed ! ”[105-mrs. norris] cried [Mrs. Norris]105-mrs. norris , reddening . “ Upon [my]105-mrs. norris word , [he]228-william must have gone off with [his]228-william pockets well lined , and at no expense for [his]228-william journey to [London]6-london either ! ”[105-mrs. norris] “ [Sir Thomas]101-sir thomas told [me]105-mrs. norris £ 10 would be enough . ”[105-mrs. norris] [Mrs. Norris]105-mrs. norris , being not at all inclined to question its sufficiency , began to take the matter in another point . “ It is amazing , ”[105-mrs. norris] said [she]105-mrs. norris , “ how much [young people]4599-young people cost [[their]4599-young people friends]4511-their friends , what with bringing [them]4599-young people up and putting [them]4599-young people out in [the world]315-the world ! [They]4599-young people little think how much it comes to , or what [[their]4599-young people parents]5665-their parents , or [[their]4599-young people uncles]5666-their uncles and [aunts]5667-aunts , pay for [them]4599-young people in the course of the year . Now , here are [[my]105-mrs. norris sister [Price]228-william ’s children]5668-my sister price ’s children ; take [them]5668-my sister price ’s children all together , [I]105-mrs. norris dare say [nobody]360-nobody would believe what a sum [they]5668-my sister price ’s children cost [Sir Thomas]101-sir thomas every year , to say nothing of what _ [I]105-mrs. norris _ do for [them]5668-my sister price ’s children . ”[105-mrs. norris] “ Very true , [sister]3704-sister , as [you]3704-sister say . But , poor things ! [they]5668-my sister price ’s children can not help it ; and [you]3704-sister know it makes very little difference to [Sir Thomas]101-sir thomas . [Fanny]113-fanny , [William]228-william must not forget [my]113-fanny shawl if [he]228-william goes to [the East Indies]78-the east indies ; and [I]113-fanny shall give [him]228-william a commission for anything else that is worth having . [I]113-fanny wish [he]228-william may go to [the East Indies]78-the east indies , that [I]113-fanny may have [my]113-fanny shawl . [I]113-fanny think [I]113-fanny will have two shawls , [Fanny]113-fanny . ”[113-fanny] [Fanny]113-fanny , meanwhile , speaking only when [she]2404-she could not help it , was very earnestly trying to understand what [Mr.]2405-mr. and [Miss Crawford]127-miss crawford were at . There was everything in [the world]315-the world _ against _ [their]2407-their being serious but [his]2405-mr. words and manner . Everything natural , probable , reasonable , was against it ; all [their]2407-their habits and ways of thinking , and all [her]2404-she own demerits . How could _ [she]2404-she _ have excited serious attachment in [a man who had seen so many , and been admired by so many , and flirted with so many]2408-a man who had seen so many , and been admired by so many , and flirted with so many , infinitely [[her]2404-she superiors]2409-her superiors ; who seemed so little open to serious impressions , even where pains had been taken to please [him]2405-mr. ; who thought so slightly , so carelessly , so unfeelingly on all such points ; who was everything to [everybody]408-everybody , and seemed to find [no one]404-no one essential to [him]2405-mr. ? And farther , how could it be supposed that [[his]2405-mr. sister]511-his sister , with all [her]511-his sister high and worldly notions of matrimony , would be forwarding anything of a serious nature in such a quarter ? Nothing could be more unnatural in either . [Fanny]113-fanny was ashamed of [her]2404-she own doubts . Everything might be possible rather than serious attachment , or serious approbation of it toward [her]2404-she . [She]2404-she had quite convinced [herself]2404-she of this before [Sir Thomas]101-sir thomas and [Mr. Crawford]133-mr. crawford joined [them]2407-their . The difficulty was in maintaining the conviction quite so absolutely after [Mr. Crawford]133-mr. crawford was in [the room]412-the room ; for once or twice a look seemed forced on [her]2404-she which [she]2404-she did not know how to class among the common meaning ; in [any other man]5243-any other man , at least , [she]2404-she would have said that it meant something very earnest , very pointed . But [she]2404-she still tried to believe it no more than what [he]2405-mr. might often have expressed towards [[her]2404-she cousins]3671-her cousins and [fifty other women]2416-fifty other women . [She]2404-she thought [he]2405-mr. was wishing to speak to [her]2404-she unheard by [the rest]441-the rest . [She]2404-she fancied [he]2405-mr. was trying for it the whole evening at intervals , whenever [Sir Thomas]101-sir thomas was out of [the room]412-the room , or at all engaged with [Mrs. Norris]105-mrs. norris , and [she]2404-she carefully refused [him]2405-mr. every opportunity . At last — it seemed an at last to [Fanny]113-fanny ’s nervousness , though not remarkably late — [he]2405-mr. began to talk of going away ; but the comfort of the sound was impaired by [his]2405-mr. turning to [her]2404-she the next moment , and saying , “ Have [you]2404-she nothing to send to [Mary]132-mary ? No answer to [her]132-mary note ? [She]132-mary will be disappointed if [she]132-mary receives nothing from [you]2405-mr. . Pray write to [her]132-mary , if it be only a line . ”[2405-mr.] “ Oh yes ! certainly , ”[113-fanny] cried [Fanny]113-fanny , rising in haste , the haste of embarrassment and of wanting to get away—“I will write directly . ”[2405-mr.] [She]2404-she went accordingly to the table , where [she]2404-she was in the habit of writing for [[her]2404-she aunt]463-her aunt , and prepared [her]2404-she materials without knowing what in [the world]315-the world to say . [She]2404-she had read [Miss Crawford]127-miss crawford ’s note only once , and how to reply to anything so imperfectly understood was most distressing . Quite unpractised in such sort of note - writing , had there been time for scruples and fears as to style [she]2404-she would have felt them in abundance : but something must be instantly written ; and with only one decided feeling , that of wishing not to appear to think anything really intended , [she]2404-she wrote thus , in great trembling both of spirits and hand — “ [I]2404-she am very much obliged to [you]2405-mr. , [[my]2404-she dear]3657-my dear [Miss Crawford]127-miss crawford , for [your]2405-mr. kind congratulations , as far as they relate to [[my]2404-she dearest]5134-my dearest [William]228-william . The rest of [your]2405-mr. note [I]2404-she know means nothing ; but [I]2404-she am so unequal to anything of the sort , that [I]2404-she hope [you]2405-mr. will excuse [my]2404-she begging [you]2405-mr. to take no farther notice . [I]2404-she have seen too much of [Mr. Crawford]133-mr. crawford not to understand [his]133-mr. crawford manners ; if [he]133-mr. crawford understood [me]2404-she as well , [he]133-mr. crawford would , [I]2404-she dare say , behave differently . [I]2404-she do not know what [I]2404-she write , but it would be a great favour of [you]2405-mr. never to mention the subject again . With thanks for the honour of [your]2405-mr. note , [I]2404-she remain , [dear Miss Crawford]127-miss crawford , & c. , & c. ”[2404-she] The conclusion was scarcely intelligible from increasing fright , for [she]2421-she found that [Mr. Crawford]133-mr. crawford , under pretence of receiving the note , was coming towards [her]2421-she . “ [You]2421-she can not think [I]133-mr. crawford mean to hurry [you]2421-she , ”[133-mr. crawford] said [he]133-mr. crawford , in an undervoice , perceiving the amazing trepidation with which [she]2421-she made up the note , “ [you]2421-she can not think [I]133-mr. crawford have any such object . Do not hurry [yourself]2421-she , [I]133-mr. crawford entreat . ”[133-mr. crawford] “ Oh ! [I]133-mr. crawford thank [you]2421-she ; [I]133-mr. crawford have quite done , just done ; it will be ready in a moment ; [I]133-mr. crawford am very much obliged to [you]2421-she ; if [you]2421-she will be so good as to give _ that _ to [Miss Crawford]127-miss crawford . ”[133-mr. crawford] The note was held out , and must be taken ; and as [she]2421-she instantly and with averted eyes walked towards the fireplace , where sat [the others]347-the others , [he]133-mr. crawford had nothing to do but to go in good earnest . [Fanny]113-fanny thought [she]2421-she had never known a day of greater agitation , both of pain and pleasure ; but happily the pleasure was not of a sort to die with the day ; for every day would restore the knowledge of [William]228-william ’s advancement , whereas the pain , [she]2421-she hoped , would return no more . [She]2421-she had no doubt that [her]2421-she note must appear excessively ill - written , that the language would disgrace [a child]376-a child , for [her]2421-she distress had allowed no arrangement ; but at least it would assure [them]2424-them both of [her]2421-she being neither imposed on nor gratified by [Mr. Crawford]133-mr. crawford ’s attentions . CHAPTER XXXII [Fanny]113-fanny had by no means forgotten [Mr. Crawford]133-mr. crawford when [she]2421-she awoke the next morning ; but [she]2421-she remembered the purport of [her]2421-she note , and was not less sanguine as to its effect than [she]2421-she had been the night before . If [Mr. Crawford]133-mr. crawford would but go away ! That was what [she]2421-she most earnestly desired : go and take [[his]133-mr. crawford sister]511-his sister with [him]133-mr. crawford , as [he]133-mr. crawford was to do , and as [he]133-mr. crawford returned to [Mansfield]3-mansfield on purpose to do . And why it was not done already [she]2421-she could not devise , for [Miss Crawford]127-miss crawford certainly wanted no delay . [Fanny]113-fanny had hoped , in the course of [his]133-mr. crawford yesterday ’s visit , to hear the day named ; but [he]133-mr. crawford had only spoken of [their]2426-their journey as what would take place ere long .
