But [Mrs. Norris]105-mrs. norris wanted to persuade [her]105-mrs. norris that [Fanny]113-fanny could be very well spared—_she _ being ready to give up all [her]106-lady bertram own time to [her]106-lady bertram as requested — and , in short , could not really be wanted or missed . “ That may be , [sister]3704-sister , ”[106-lady bertram] was all [Lady Bertram]106-lady bertram ’s reply . “ [I]106-lady bertram dare say [you]3704-sister are very right ; but [I]106-lady bertram am sure [I]106-lady bertram shall miss [her]106-lady bertram very much . ”[106-lady bertram] The next step was to communicate with [Portsmouth]7-portsmouth . [Fanny]113-fanny wrote to offer [herself]113-fanny ; and [[her]106-lady bertram mother]446-her mother ’s answer , though short , was so kind — a few simple lines expressed so natural and motherly a joy in the prospect of seeing [[her]446-her mother child]2708-her child again , as to confirm all [the daughter]703-the daughter ’s views of happiness in being with [her]106-lady bertram — convincing [her]106-lady bertram that [she]106-lady bertram should now find [a warm and affectionate friend in [the “ mama]5999-the “ mama ”[106-lady bertram] who had certainly shewn no remarkable fondness for [her]106-lady bertram formerly]2710-a warm and affectionate friend in the “ mama ” who had certainly shewn no remarkable fondness for her formerly ; but this [she]106-lady bertram could easily suppose to have been [her]106-lady bertram own fault or [her]106-lady bertram own fancy . [She]106-lady bertram had probably alienated love by the helplessness and fretfulness of a fearful temper , or been unreasonable in wanting a larger share than any one among so many could deserve . Now , when [she]106-lady bertram knew better how to be useful , and how to forbear , and when [[her]106-lady bertram mother]446-her mother could be no longer occupied by the incessant demands of [a house full of [little children]2713-little children]2712-a house full of little children , there would be leisure and inclination for every comfort , and [they]2714-they should soon be what [mother]3977-mother and [daughter]2716-daughter ought to be to [each other]681-each other . [William]228-william was almost as happy in the plan as [[his]228-william sister]511-his sister . It would be the greatest pleasure to [him]228-william to have [her]511-his sister there to the last moment before [he]228-william sailed , and perhaps find [her]511-his sister there still when [he]228-william came in from [his]228-william first cruise . And besides , [he]228-william wanted [her]511-his sister so very much to see [the Thrush]265-the thrush before [she]511-his sister went out of [harbour]2719-harbour — [the Thrush]2720-the thrush was certainly [the finest sloop in the service]2721-the finest sloop in the service — and there were several improvements in [the dockyard]2722-the dockyard , too , which [he]228-william quite longed to shew [her]511-his sister . [He]228-william did not scruple to add that [her]511-his sister being at [home]367-home for a while would be a great advantage to [everybody]408-everybody . “ [I]228-william do not know how it is , ”[228-william] said [he]228-william ; “ but [we]6000-we seem to want some of [your]511-his sister nice ways and orderliness at [[my]228-william father]3762-my father ’s . [The house]427-the house is always in confusion . [You]511-his sister will set things going in a better way , [I]228-william am sure . [You]511-his sister will tell [[my]228-william mother]3827-my mother how it all ought to be , and [you]511-his sister will be so useful to [Susan]264-susan , and [you]511-his sister will teach [Betsey]148-betsey , and make [the boys]6004-the boys love and mind [you]511-his sister . How right and comfortable it will all be ! ”[228-william] By the time [Mrs. Price]107-mrs. price ’s answer arrived , there remained but a very few days more to be spent at [Mansfield]3-mansfield ; and for part of one of those days [the young travellers]2725-the young travellers were in a good deal of alarm on the subject of [their]2725-the young travellers journey , for when the mode of it came to be talked of , and [Mrs. Norris]105-mrs. norris found that all [her]105-mrs. norris anxiety to save [[her]105-mrs. norris brother - in - law]318-her brother - in - law ’s money was vain , and that in spite of [her]105-mrs. norris wishes and hints for a less expensive conveyance of [Fanny]113-fanny , [they]2725-the young travellers were to travel post ; when [she]105-mrs. norris saw [Sir Thomas]101-sir thomas actually give [William]228-william notes for the purpose , [she]105-mrs. norris was struck with the idea of there being room for a third in [the carriage]969-the carriage , and suddenly seized with a strong inclination to go with [them]2725-the young travellers , to go and see [[her]105-mrs. norris poor dear sister]2728-her poor dear sister [Price]107-mrs. price . [She]105-mrs. norris proclaimed [her]105-mrs. norris thoughts . [She]105-mrs. norris must say that [she]105-mrs. norris had more than half a mind to go with [the young people]391-the young people ; it would be such an indulgence to [her]105-mrs. norris ; [she]105-mrs. norris had not seen [[her]105-mrs. norris poor dear sister]2728-her poor dear sister [Price]107-mrs. price for more than twenty years ; and it would be a help to [the young people]391-the young people in [their]391-the young people journey to have [her]105-mrs. norris older head to manage for [them]391-the young people ; and [she]105-mrs. norris could not help thinking [[her]105-mrs. norris poor dear sister]2728-her poor dear sister [Price]107-mrs. price would feel it very unkind of [her]105-mrs. norris not to come by such an opportunity . [William]228-william and [Fanny]113-fanny were horror - struck at the idea . All the comfort of [their]391-the young people comfortable journey would be destroyed at once . With woeful countenances [they]391-the young people looked at [each other]681-each other . [Their]391-the young people suspense lasted an hour or two . [No one]404-no one interfered to encourage or dissuade . [Mrs. Norris]105-mrs. norris was left to settle the matter by [herself]105-mrs. norris ; and it ended , to the infinite joy of [[her]105-mrs. norris nephew]1987-her nephew and niece , in the recollection that [she]105-mrs. norris could not possibly be spared from [Mansfield Park]130-mansfield at present ; that [she]105-mrs. norris was a great deal too necessary to [Sir Thomas]101-sir thomas and [Lady Bertram]106-lady bertram for [her]105-mrs. norris to be able to answer it to [herself]105-mrs. norris to leave [them]391-the young people even for a week , and therefore must certainly sacrifice every other pleasure to that of being useful to [them]391-the young people . It had , in fact , occurred to [her]105-mrs. norris , that though taken to [Portsmouth]7-portsmouth for nothing , it would be hardly possible for [her]105-mrs. norris to avoid paying [her]105-mrs. norris own expenses back again . So [[her]105-mrs. norris poor dear sister]2728-her poor dear sister [Price]107-mrs. price was left to all the disappointment of [her]105-mrs. norris missing such an opportunity , and another twenty years ’ absence , perhaps , begun . [Edmund]108-edmund ’s plans were affected by this [Portsmouth]7-portsmouth journey , this absence of [Fanny]113-fanny ’s . [He]108-edmund too had a sacrifice to make to [Mansfield Park]130-mansfield as well as [[his]108-edmund aunt]630-his aunt . [He]108-edmund had intended , about this time , to be going to [London]6-london ; but [he]108-edmund could not leave [[his]108-edmund father]534-his father and [mother]3977-mother just when [everybody else of most importance to [their]2740-everybody else of most importance to their comfort comfort]2740-everybody else of most importance to their comfort was leaving [them]2740-everybody else of most importance to their comfort ; and with an effort , felt but not boasted of , [he]108-edmund delayed for a week or two longer a journey which [he]108-edmund was looking forward to with the hope of its fixing [his]108-edmund happiness for ever . [He]108-edmund told [Fanny]113-fanny of it . [She]2741-she knew so much already , that [she]2741-she must know everything . It made the substance of one other confidential discourse about [Miss Crawford]127-miss crawford ; and [Fanny]113-fanny was the more affected from feeling it to be the last time in which [Miss Crawford]127-miss crawford ’s name would ever be mentioned between [them]2742-them with any remains of liberty . Once afterwards [she]2741-she was alluded to by [him]108-edmund . [Lady Bertram]106-lady bertram had been telling [[her]106-lady bertram niece]642-her niece in the evening to write to [her]642-her niece soon and often , and promising to be [a good correspondent]2744-a good correspondent [herself]642-her niece ; and [Edmund]108-edmund , at a convenient moment , then added in a whisper , “ And _ [I]108-edmund _ shall write to [you]113-fanny , [Fanny]113-fanny , when [I]108-edmund have anything worth writing about , anything to say that [I]108-edmund think [you]113-fanny will like to hear , and that [you]113-fanny will not hear so soon from any other quarter . ”[108-edmund] Had [she]2741-she doubted [his]108-edmund meaning while [she]2741-she listened , the glow in [his]108-edmund face , when [she]2741-she looked up at [him]108-edmund , would have been decisive . For this letter [she]2741-she must try to arm [herself]2741-she . That a letter from [Edmund]108-edmund should be a subject of terror ! [She]2741-she began to feel that [she]2741-she had not yet gone through all the changes of opinion and sentiment which the progress of time and variation of circumstances occasion in this world of changes . The vicissitudes of the human mind had not yet been exhausted by [her]2741-she . [Poor Fanny]113-fanny ! though going as [she]2741-she did willingly and eagerly , the last evening at [Mansfield Park]130-mansfield must still be wretchedness . [Her]2741-she heart was completely sad at parting . [She]2741-she had tears for [every room in [the house]427-the house]2745-every room in the house , much more for [every beloved inhabitant]2747-every beloved inhabitant . [She]2741-she clung to [[her]2741-she aunt]463-her aunt , because [she]463-her aunt would miss [her]463-her aunt ; [she]2741-she kissed the hand of [[her]2741-she uncle]312-her uncle with struggling sobs , because [she]2741-she had displeased [him]312-her uncle ; and as for [Edmund]108-edmund , [she]2741-she could neither speak , nor look , nor think , when the last moment came with _ [him]108-edmund _ ; and it was not till it was over that [she]2741-she knew [he]108-edmund was giving [her]2741-she the affectionate farewell of [a brother]4109-a brother . All this passed overnight , for the journey was to begin very early in the morning ; and when [the small , diminished party]2751-the small , diminished party met at breakfast , [William]228-william and [Fanny]113-fanny were talked of as already advanced one stage . CHAPTER XXXVIII The novelty of travelling , and the happiness of being with [William]228-william , soon produced their natural effect on [Fanny]113-fanny ’s spirits , when [Mansfield Park]130-mansfield was fairly left behind ; and by the time [their]2752-their first stage was ended , and [they]2752-their were to quit [[Sir Thomas]101-sir thomas ’s carriage]2753-sir thomas ’s carriage , [she]2741-she was able to take leave of [the old coachman]892-the old coachman , and send back proper messages , with cheerful looks . Of pleasant talk between [the brother]695-the brother and [sister]3704-sister there was no end . Everything supplied an amusement to the high glee of [William]228-william ’s mind , and [he]228-william was full of frolic and joke in the intervals of [their]2752-their higher - toned subjects , all of which ended , if [they]2752-their did not begin , in praise of [the Thrush]265-the thrush , conjectures how [she]2741-she would be employed , schemes for an action with some superior force , which ( supposing [the first lieutenant]2757-the first lieutenant out of the way , and [William]228-william was not very merciful to [the first lieutenant]2757-the first lieutenant ) was to give [himself]228-william the next step as soon as possible , or speculations upon prize - money , which was to be generously distributed at [home]367-home , with only the reservation of enough to make [the little cottage]2760-the little cottage comfortable , in which [he]228-william and [Fanny]113-fanny were to pass all [their]2752-their middle and later life together . [Fanny]113-fanny ’s immediate concerns , as far as [they]2752-their involved [Mr. Crawford]133-mr. crawford , made no part of [their]2752-their conversation . [William]228-william knew what had passed , and from [his]228-william heart lamented that [[his]228-william sister]511-his sister ’s feelings should be so cold towards [a man whom [he]228-william must consider as [the first of human characters]2763-the first of human characters]2762-a man whom he must consider as the first of human characters ; but [he]228-william was of an age to be all for love , and therefore unable to blame ; and knowing [her]511-his sister wish on the subject , [he]228-william would not distress [her]511-his sister by the slightest allusion . [She]511-his sister had reason to suppose [herself]511-his sister not yet forgotten by [Mr. Crawford]133-mr. crawford . [She]511-his sister had heard repeatedly from [[his]133-mr. crawford sister]511-his sister within the three weeks which had passed since [their]2752-their leaving [Mansfield]3-mansfield , and in each letter there had been a few lines from [himself]133-mr. crawford , warm and determined like [his]133-mr. crawford speeches . It was a correspondence which [Fanny]113-fanny found quite as unpleasant as [she]511-his sister had feared . [Miss Crawford]127-miss crawford ’s style of writing , lively and affectionate , was itself an evil , independent of what [she]511-his sister was thus forced into reading from [the brother]695-the brother ’s pen , for [Edmund]108-edmund would never rest till [she]511-his sister had read the chief of the letter to [him]108-edmund ; and then [she]511-his sister had to listen to [his]108-edmund admiration of [her]511-his sister language , and the warmth of [her]511-his sister attachments . There had , in fact , been so much of message , of allusion , of recollection , so much of [Mansfield]130-mansfield in every letter , that [Fanny]113-fanny could not but suppose it meant for [him]108-edmund to hear ; and to find [herself]113-fanny forced into a purpose of that kind , compelled into a correspondence which was bringing [her]511-his sister the addresses of [the man [she]511-his sister did not love]2766-the man she did not love , and obliging [her]511-his sister to administer to the adverse passion of [the man [she]511-his sister did]2767-the man she did , was cruelly mortifying . Here , too , [her]511-his sister present removal promised advantage . When no longer under the same roof with [Edmund]108-edmund , [she]511-his sister trusted that [Miss Crawford]127-miss crawford would have no motive for writing strong enough to overcome the trouble , and that at [Portsmouth]7-portsmouth [their]2768-they correspondence would dwindle into nothing . With such thoughts as these , among ten hundred others , [Fanny]113-fanny proceeded in [her]511-his sister journey safely and cheerfully , and as expeditiously as could rationally be hoped in the dirty month of February . [They]2768-they entered [Oxford]39-oxford , but [she]511-his sister could take only a hasty glimpse of [[Edmund]108-edmund ’s college]2769-edmund ’s college as [they]2768-they passed along , and made no stop anywhere till [they]2768-they reached [Newbury]83-newbury , where a comfortable meal , uniting dinner and supper , wound up the enjoyments and fatigues of the day . The next morning saw [them]2768-they off again at an early hour ; and with no events , and no delays , [they]2768-they regularly advanced , and were in [the environs of [Portsmouth]7-portsmouth]2770-the environs of portsmouth while there was yet daylight for [Fanny]113-fanny to look around [her]511-his sister , and wonder at [the new buildings]2771-the new buildings . [They]2768-they passed [the drawbridge]2772-the drawbridge , and entered [the town]2773-the town ; and the light was only beginning to fail as , guided by [William]228-william ’s powerful voice , [they]2768-they were rattled into [a narrow street]2774-a narrow street , leading from [the High Street]2775-the high street , and drawn up before the door of [a small house now inhabited by [Mr. Price]228-william]2776-a small house now inhabited by mr. price . [Fanny]113-fanny was all agitation and flutter ; all hope and apprehension . The moment [they]2768-they stopped , [a trollopy - looking maidservant]2777-a trollopy - looking maidservant , seemingly in waiting for [them]2768-they at the door , stepped forward , and more intent on telling the news than giving [them]2768-they any help , immediately began with , “ [The Thrush]2720-the thrush is gone out of [harbour]2719-harbour , please [sir]4023-sir , and [one of [the officers]6009-the officers]6008-one of the officers has been here to — ”[2777-a trollopy - looking maidservant] [She]2777-a trollopy - looking maidservant was interrupted by [a fine tall boy of eleven years old]2778-a fine tall boy of eleven years old , who , rushing out of [the house]427-the house , pushed [the maid]2780-the maid aside , and while [William]228-william was opening the chaise - door [himself]228-william , called out , “ [You]113-fanny are just in time . [We]2768-they have been looking for [you]113-fanny this half - hour . [The Thrush]265-the thrush went out of [harbour]2719-harbour this morning . [I]228-william saw [her]265-the thrush . It was a beautiful sight . And [they]2768-they think [she]265-the thrush will have [her]265-the thrush orders in a day or two . And [Mr. Campbell]266-mr. campbell was here at four o’clock to ask for [you]113-fanny : [he]266-mr. campbell has got [one of [the Thrush]265-the thrush ’s boats]6011-one of the thrush ’s boats , and is going off to [her]265-the thrush at six , and hoped [you]113-fanny would be here in time to go with [him]266-mr. campbell . ”[228-william] A stare or two at [Fanny]113-fanny , as [William]228-william helped [her]2781-her out of [the carriage]969-the carriage , was all the voluntary notice which [this brother]2783-this brother bestowed ; but [he]228-william made no objection to [her]2781-her kissing [him]228-william , though still entirely engaged in detailing farther particulars of [the Thrush]265-the thrush ’s going out of harbour , in which [he]228-william had a strong right of interest , being to commence [his]228-william career of seamanship in [her]2781-her at this very time . Another moment and [Fanny]113-fanny was in [the narrow entrance - passage of [the house]427-the house]2784-the narrow entrance - passage of the house , and in [[her]2781-her mother]446-her mother ’s arms , who met [her]2781-her there with looks of true kindness , and with features which [Fanny]113-fanny loved the more , because [they]2787-they brought [her]2781-her aunt [Bertram]108-edmund ’s before [her]2781-her , and there were [[her]2781-her two sisters]2788-her two sisters : [Susan]264-susan , [a well - grown fine girl of fourteen]2789-a well - grown fine girl of fourteen , and [Betsey]148-betsey , [the youngest of [the family]3724-the family]2790-the youngest of the family , about five — both glad to see [her]2781-her in [their]2787-they way , though with no advantage of manner in receiving [her]2781-her . But [manner Fanny]113-fanny did not want . Would [they]2787-they but love [her]2781-her , [she]2781-her should be satisfied . [She]2781-her was then taken into [a parlour]2792-a parlour , so small that [her]2781-her first conviction was of its being only [a passage - room]2793-a passage - room to something better , and [she]2781-her stood for a moment expecting to be invited on ; but when [she]2781-her saw there was no other door , and that there were signs of habitation before [her]2781-her , [she]2781-her called back [her]2781-her thoughts , reproved [herself]2781-her , and grieved lest they should have been suspected . [[Her]2781-her mother]446-her mother , however , could not stay long enough to suspect anything . [She]446-her mother was gone again to [the street]5420-the street - door , to welcome [William]228-william . “ Oh ! [[my]637-her son dear]3657-my dear [William]228-william , how glad [I]637-her son am to see [you]228-william . But have [you]228-william heard about [the Thrush]265-the thrush ? [She]265-the thrush is gone out of [harbour]2719-harbour already ; three days before [we]6014-we had any thought of it ; and [I]637-her son do not know what [I]637-her son am to do about [Sam]267-sam ’s things , [they]6015-they will never be ready in time ; for [she]265-the thrush may have [her]265-the thrush orders to - morrow , perhaps . It takes [me]637-her son quite unawares . And now [you]228-william must be off for [Spithead]68-spithead too . [Campbell]266-mr. campbell has been [here]3798-here , quite in a worry about [you]228-william ; and now what shall [we]6014-we do ? [I]637-her son thought to have had such a comfortable evening with [you]228-william , and here everything comes upon [me]637-her son at once . ”[637-her son] [[Her]2796-her son]637-her son answered cheerfully , telling [her]2796-her that everything was always for the best ; and making light of [his]637-her son own inconvenience in being obliged to hurry away so soon . “ To be sure , [I]107-mrs. price had much rather [she]265-the thrush had stayed in [harbour]2719-harbour , that [I]107-mrs. price might have sat a few hours with [you]228-william in comfort ; but as there is [a boat]6018-a boat [ashore]6019-ashore , [I]107-mrs. price had better go off at once , and there is no help for it . Whereabouts does [the Thrush]2720-the thrush lay at [Spithead]68-spithead ? Near [the Canopus]84-the canopus ? But no matter ; here ’s [Fanny]113-fanny in [the parlour]6021-the parlour , and why should [we]2798-we stay in [the passage]6022-the passage ? Come , [mother]3977-mother , [you]228-william have hardly looked at [your]228-william own dear [Fanny]113-fanny yet . ”[107-mrs. price] In [they]2798-we both came , and [Mrs. Price]107-mrs. price having kindly kissed [[her]107-mrs. price daughter]382-her daughter again , and commented a little on [her]382-her daughter growth , began with very natural solicitude to feel for [their]2798-we fatigues and wants as [travellers]2800-travellers . “ [Poor dears]6024-poor dears ! how tired [you]6024-poor dears must both be ! and now , what will [you]6024-poor dears have ? [I]2801-i began to think [you]6024-poor dears would never come . [Betsey]148-betsey and [I]2801-i have been watching for [you]6024-poor dears this half - hour . And when did [you]6024-poor dears get anything to eat ? And what would [you]6024-poor dears like to have now ? [I]2801-i could not tell whether [you]6024-poor dears would be for some meat , or only a dish of tea , after [your]6024-poor dears journey , or else [I]2801-i would have got something ready . And now [I]2801-i am afraid [Campbell]266-mr. campbell will be here before there is time to dress a steak , and [we]2801-i have [no butcher at hand]6025-no butcher at hand . It is very inconvenient to have [no butcher]6026-no butcher in [the street]5420-the street . [We]2801-i were better off in [[our]2801-i last house]6028-our last house . Perhaps [you]6024-poor dears would like some tea as soon as it can be got . ”[2801-i] [They]2801-i both declared [they]2801-i should prefer it to anything . “ Then , [Betsey]148-betsey , [[my]148-betsey dear]3657-my dear , run into [the kitchen]6030-the kitchen and see if [Rebecca]268-rebecca has put the water on ; and tell [her]268-rebecca to bring in the tea - things as soon as [she]268-rebecca can . [I]148-betsey wish [we]2801-i could get the bell mended ; but [Betsey]148-betsey is [a very handy little messenger]6031-a very handy little messenger . ”[148-betsey] [Betsey]148-betsey went with alacrity , proud to shew [her]148-betsey abilities before [[her]148-betsey fine new sister]2802-her fine new sister . “ [Dear]6032-dear [me]2803-the anxious mother ! ”[2803-the anxious mother] continued [the anxious mother]2803-the anxious mother , “ what a sad fire [we]2801-i have got , and [I]2803-the anxious mother dare say [you]3657-my dear are both starved with cold . Draw [your]3657-my dear chair nearer , [[my]2803-the anxious mother dear]3657-my dear . [I]2803-the anxious mother can not think what [Rebecca]268-rebecca has been about . [I]2803-the anxious mother am sure [I]2803-the anxious mother told [her]268-rebecca to bring some coals half an hour ago . [Susan]264-susan , [you]3657-my dear should have taken care of the fire . ”[2803-the anxious mother] “ [I]264-susan was [upstairs]4939-upstairs , [mama]3783-mama , moving [my]264-susan things , ”[264-susan] said [Susan]264-susan , in a fearless , self - defending tone , which startled [Fanny]113-fanny . “ [You]3657-my dear know [you]3657-my dear had but just settled that [[my]264-susan sister]3790-my sister [Fanny]113-fanny and [I]264-susan should have [the other room]6037-the other room ; and [I]264-susan could not get [Rebecca]268-rebecca to give [me]264-susan any help . ”[264-susan] Farther discussion was prevented by various bustles : first , [the driver]2804-the driver came to be paid ; then there was a squabble between [Sam]267-sam and [Rebecca]268-rebecca about the manner of carrying up [[his]2804-the driver sister]511-his sister ’s trunk , which [he]2804-the driver would manage all [his]2804-the driver own way ; and lastly , in walked [Mr. Price]228-william [himself]228-william , [his]228-william own loud voice preceding [him]228-william , as with something of the oath kind [he]228-william kicked away [[his]228-william son]581-his son ’s portmanteau and [[his]228-william daughter]1739-his daughter ’s bandbox in [the passage]6022-the passage , and called out for a candle ; no candle was brought , however , and [he]228-william walked into [the room]412-the room . [Fanny]113-fanny with doubting feelings had risen to meet [him]228-william , but sank down again on finding [herself]113-fanny undistinguished in the dusk , and unthought of . With a friendly shake of [[his]228-william son]581-his son ’s hand , and an eager voice , [he]228-william instantly began—“Ha ! welcome back , [[my]228-william boy]6038-my boy . Glad to see [you]6038-my boy . Have [you]6038-my boy heard the news ? [The Thrush]2720-the thrush went out of [harbour]2719-harbour this morning . [Sharp]269-sharp is the word , [you]6038-my boy see ! By G — , [you]6038-my boy are just in time ! [The doctor]572-the doctor has been here inquiring for [you]6038-my boy : [he]572-the doctor has got one of [the boats]6042-the boats , and is to be off for [Spithead]68-spithead by six , so [you]6038-my boy had better go with [him]572-the doctor . [I]228-william have been to [Turner]270-turner ’s about [your]6038-my boy mess ; it is all in a way to be done . [I]228-william should not wonder if [you]6038-my boy had [your]6038-my boy orders to - morrow : but [you]6038-my boy can not sail with this wind , if [you]6038-my boy are to cruise to the westward ; and [Captain Walsh]271-captain walsh thinks [you]6038-my boy will certainly have a cruise to the westward , with [the Elephant]6043-the elephant . By G — , [I]228-william wish [you]6038-my boy may ! But [old Scholey]272-old scholey was saying , just now , that [he]572-the doctor thought [you]6038-my boy would be sent first to [the Texel]85-the texel . Well , well , [we]6044-we are ready , whatever happens . But by G — , [you]6038-my boy lost a fine sight by not being here in the morning to see [the Thrush]265-the thrush go out of [harbour]2719-harbour ! [I]228-william would not have been out of the way for a thousand pounds . [Old Scholey]272-old scholey ran in at breakfast - time , to say [she]272-old scholey had slipped [her]272-old scholey moorings and was coming out , [I]228-william jumped up , and made but two steps to [the platform]6046-the platform . If ever there was [a perfect beauty afloat]6047-a perfect beauty afloat , [she]272-old scholey is one ; and there [she]272-old scholey lays at [Spithead]68-spithead , and anybody in [England]14-england would take [her]272-old scholey for an eight - and - twenty . [I]228-william was upon [the platform]6046-the platform two hours this afternoon looking at [her]272-old scholey . [She]272-old scholey lays close to [the Endymion]86-the endymion , between [her]272-old scholey and [the Cleopatra]87-the cleopatra , just to the eastward of the sheer hulk . ”[228-william] “ Ha ! ”[228-william] cried [William]228-william , “ _ that ’s _ just where [I]228-william should have put [her]272-old scholey [myself]228-william . It ’s [the best berth at [Spithead]68-spithead]6049-the best berth at spithead . But here is [[my]228-william sister]3790-my sister , [sir]4023-sir ; here is [Fanny]113-fanny , ”[228-william] turning and leading [her]2811-her forward ; “ it is so dark [you]4023-sir do not see [her]272-old scholey . ”[228-william] With an acknowledgment that [he]228-william had quite forgot [her]2811-her , [Mr. Price]228-william now received [[his]228-william daughter]1739-his daughter ; and having given [her]1739-his daughter a cordial hug , and observed that [she]1739-his daughter was grown into [a woman]644-a woman , and [he]228-william supposed would be wanting [a husband]1155-a husband soon , seemed very much inclined to forget [her]2811-her again . [Fanny]113-fanny shrunk back to [her]2811-her seat , with feelings sadly pained by [his]228-william language and [his]228-william smell of spirits ; and [he]228-william talked on only to [[his]228-william son]581-his son , and only of [the Thrush]265-the thrush , though [William]228-william , warmly interested as [he]228-william was in that subject , more than once tried to make [[his]228-william father]534-his father think of [Fanny]113-fanny , and [her]2811-her long absence and long journey . After sitting some time longer , a candle was obtained ; but as there was still no appearance of tea , nor , from [Betsey]148-betsey ’s reports from [the kitchen]6030-the kitchen , much hope of any under a considerable period , [William]228-william determined to go and change [his]228-william dress , and make the necessary preparations for [his]228-william removal on board directly , that [he]228-william might have [his]228-william tea in comfort afterwards . As [he]228-william left [the room]412-the room , [two rosy - faced boys , ragged and dirty]2819-two rosy - faced boys , ragged and dirty , about eight and nine years old , rushed into [it]412-the room just released from [school]2820-school , and coming eagerly to see [[their]2819-two rosy - faced boys , ragged and dirty sister]705-their sister , and tell that [the Thrush]2720-the thrush was gone out of [harbour]2719-harbour ; [Tom]101-sir thomas and [Charles]245-charles . [Charles]245-charles had been born since [Fanny]113-fanny ’s going away , but [Tom]101-sir thomas [she]705-their sister had often helped to nurse , and now felt a particular pleasure in seeing again . [Both]5359-both were kissed very tenderly , but [Tom]101-sir thomas [she]705-their sister wanted to keep by [her]705-their sister , to try to trace the features of [the baby [she]705-their sister had loved]2825-the baby she had loved , and talked to , of [his]101-sir thomas infant preference of [herself]705-their sister . [Tom]101-sir thomas , however , had no mind for such treatment : [he]101-sir thomas came [home]367-home not to stand and be talked to , but to run about and make a noise ; and [both boys]2827-both boys had soon burst from [her]705-their sister , and slammed the parlour - door till [her]705-their sister temples ached . [She]705-their sister had now seen all that were at [home]367-home ; there remained only [two brothers]2829-two brothers between [herself]705-their sister and [Susan]264-susan , [one of whom was a clerk in [a public office in [London]6-london]2831-a public office in london]2830-one of whom was a clerk in a public office in london , and [the other midshipman on board an Indiaman]2832-the other midshipman on board an indiaman . But though [she]705-their sister had _ seen _ [all the members of [the family]3724-the family]2833-all the members of the family , [she]705-their sister had not yet _ heard _ all the noise [they]2833-all the members of the family could make . Another quarter of an hour brought [her]705-their sister a great deal more . [William]228-william was soon calling out from [the landing - place of [the second story]2836-the second story]2835-the landing - place of the second story for [[his]228-william mother]629-his mother and for [Rebecca]268-rebecca . [He]228-william was in distress for something that [he]228-william had left [there]3696-there , and did not find again . A key was mislaid , [Betsey]148-betsey accused of having got at [his]228-william new hat , and some slight , but essential alteration of [his]228-william uniform waistcoat , which [he]228-william had been promised to have done for [him]228-william , entirely neglected . [Mrs. Price]107-mrs. price , [Rebecca]268-rebecca , and [Betsey]148-betsey all went up to defend [themselves]2839-themselves , all talking together , but [Rebecca]268-rebecca loudest , and the job was to be done as well as it could in a great hurry ; [William]228-william trying in vain to send [Betsey]148-betsey down again , or keep [her]268-rebecca from being troublesome where [she]268-rebecca was ; the whole of which , as almost every door in [the house]427-the house was open , could be plainly distinguished in the parlour , except when drowned at intervals by the superior noise of [Sam]267-sam , [Tom]101-sir thomas , and [Charles]245-charles chasing [each other]681-each other up and down stairs , and tumbling about and hallooing . [Fanny]113-fanny was almost stunned . The smallness of [the house]427-the house and thinness of the walls brought everything so close to [her]2843-her , that , added to the fatigue of [her]2843-her journey , and all [her]2843-her recent agitation , [she]2843-her hardly knew how to bear it . _ Within _ [the room]412-the room all was tranquil enough , for [Susan]264-susan having disappeared with [the others]347-the others , there were soon only [[her]264-susan father]667-her father and [herself]264-susan remaining ; and [he]667-her father , taking out a newspaper , the accustomary loan of [a neighbour]2847-a neighbour , applied [himself]667-her father to studying it , without seeming to recollect [her]264-susan existence . The solitary candle was held between [himself]667-her father and the paper , without any reference to [her]264-susan possible convenience ; but [she]264-susan had nothing to do , and was glad to have the light screened from [her]264-susan aching head , as [she]264-susan sat in bewildered , broken , sorrowful contemplation . [She]264-susan was at [home]367-home . But , alas ! it was not such [a home]5117-a home , [she]264-susan had not such a welcome , as — [she]264-susan checked [herself]264-susan ; [she]264-susan was unreasonable . What right had [she]264-susan to be of importance to [[her]264-susan family]322-her family ? [She]264-susan could have none , so long lost sight of ! [William]228-william ’s concerns must be dearest , they always had been , and [he]228-william had every right . Yet to have so little said or asked about [herself]264-susan , to have scarcely an inquiry made after [Mansfield]130-mansfield ! It did pain [her]264-susan to have [Mansfield]130-mansfield forgotten ; [the friends who had done so much]2851-the friends who had done so much — [the dear , dear friends]2852-the dear , dear friends ! But here , one subject swallowed up all the rest . Perhaps it must be so . The destination of the Thrush must be now preeminently interesting . A day or two might shew the difference . _ [She]264-susan _ only was to blame . Yet [she]264-susan thought it would not have been so at [Mansfield]3-mansfield . No , in [[[her]264-susan uncle]312-her uncle ’s house]721-her uncle ’s house there would have been a consideration of times and seasons , a regulation of subject , a propriety , an attention towards everybody which there was not [here]3798-here . The only interruption which thoughts like these received for nearly half an hour was from a sudden burst of [[her]264-susan father]667-her father ’s , not at all calculated to compose them . At a more than ordinary pitch of thumping and hallooing in [the passage]6022-the passage , [he]667-her father exclaimed , “ [Devil]273-devil take those young dogs ! How [they]6052-they are singing out ! Ay , [Sam]267-sam ’s voice louder than all the rest ! [That boy]6053-that boy is fit for [a boatswain]6054-a boatswain . [Holla]274-holla , [you]267-sam there ! [Sam]267-sam , stop [your]267-sam confounded pipe , or [I]667-her father shall be after [you]267-sam . ”[667-her father] This threat was so palpably disregarded , that though within five minutes afterwards [the three boys]2858-the three boys all burst into [the room]412-the room together and sat down , [Fanny]113-fanny could not consider it as a proof of anything more than [their]2858-the three boys being for the time thoroughly fagged , which [their]2858-the three boys hot faces and panting breaths seemed to prove , especially as [they]2858-the three boys were still kicking each other ’s shins , and hallooing out at sudden starts immediately under [[their]2858-the three boys father]398-their father ’s eye . The next opening of the door brought something more welcome : it was for the tea - things , which [she]2861-her had begun almost to despair of seeing that evening . [Susan]264-susan and [an attendant girl]2862-an attendant girl , whose inferior appearance informed [Fanny]113-fanny , to [her]2861-her great surprise , that [she]2861-her had previously seen [the upper servant]2863-the upper servant , brought in everything necessary for the meal ; [Susan]264-susan looking , as [she]264-susan put the kettle on the fire and glanced at [[her]264-susan sister]331-her sister , as if divided between the agreeable triumph of shewing [her]264-susan activity and usefulness , and the dread of being thought to demean [herself]2861-her by such an office . “ [She]2861-her had been into [the kitchen]6030-the kitchen , ”[2861-her] [she]2861-her said , “ to hurry [Sally]275-sally and help make the toast , and spread the bread and butter , or [she]2861-her did not know when [they]6056-they should have got tea , and [she]2861-her was sure [[her]2861-her sister]331-her sister must want something after [her]2861-her journey . ”[2861-her] [Fanny]113-fanny was very thankful . [She]2861-her could not but own that [she]2861-her should be very glad of a little tea , and [Susan]264-susan immediately set about making it , as if pleased to have the employment all to [herself]264-susan ; and with only a little unnecessary bustle , and some few injudicious attempts at keeping [[her]2861-her brothers]3878-her brothers in better order than [she]2861-her could , acquitted [herself]2861-her very well . [Fanny]113-fanny ’s spirit was as much refreshed as [her]2861-her body ; [her]2861-her head and heart were soon the better for such well - timed kindness . [Susan]264-susan had an open , sensible countenance ; [she]264-susan was like [William]228-william , and [Fanny]113-fanny hoped to find [her]264-susan like [him]228-william in disposition and goodwill towards [herself]113-fanny . In this more placid state of things [William]228-william reentered , followed not far behind by [[his]228-william mother]629-his mother and [Betsey]148-betsey . [He]228-william , complete in [[his]228-william lieutenant]2867-his lieutenant ’s uniform , looking and moving all the taller , firmer , and more graceful for it , and with the happiest smile over [his]228-william face , walked up directly to [Fanny]113-fanny , who , rising from [her]2861-her seat , looked at [him]228-william for a moment in speechless admiration , and then threw [her]2861-her arms round [his]228-william neck to sob out [her]2861-her various emotions of pain and pleasure . Anxious not to appear unhappy , [she]2861-her soon recovered [herself]2861-her ; and wiping away [her]2861-her tears , was able to notice and admire all the striking parts of [his]228-william dress ; listening with reviving spirits to [his]228-william cheerful hopes of being on [shore]1983-shore some part of every day before [they]2869-they sailed , and even of getting [her]2861-her to [Spithead]68-spithead to see [the sloop]2870-the sloop . The next bustle brought in [Mr. Campbell]266-mr. campbell , [the surgeon of the Thrush]2871-the surgeon of the thrush , [a very well - behaved young man]2872-a very well - behaved young man , who came to call for [[his]266-mr. campbell friend]319-his friend , and for whom there was with some contrivance found a chair , and with some hasty washing of [the young tea - maker]2874-the young tea - maker ’s , a cup and saucer ; and after another quarter of an hour of earnest talk between [the gentlemen , noise rising upon noise , and bustle upon bustle]2875-the gentlemen , noise rising upon noise , and bustle upon bustle , [men]395-men and [boys]4685-boys at last all in motion together , the moment came for setting off ; everything was ready , [William]228-william took leave , and [all of [them]2878-all of them]2878-all of them were gone ; for [the three boys]2858-the three boys , in spite of [[their]2858-the three boys mother]1249-their mother ’s entreaty , determined to see [[their]2858-the three boys brother]469-their brother and [Mr. Campbell]266-mr. campbell to [the sally - port]2882-the sally - port ; and [Mr. Price]228-william walked off at the same time to carry back [[his]228-william neighbour]2883-his neighbour ’s newspaper . Something like tranquillity might now be hoped for ; and accordingly , when [Rebecca]268-rebecca had been prevailed on to carry away the tea - things , and [Mrs. Price]107-mrs. price had walked about [the room]412-the room some time looking for a shirt - sleeve , which [Betsey]148-betsey at last hunted out from a drawer in [the kitchen]6030-the kitchen , [the small party of females]2886-the small party of females were pretty well composed , and [the mother]3960-the mother having lamented again over the impossibility of getting [Sam]267-sam ready in time , was at leisure to think of [[her]3960-the mother eldest daughter]3652-her eldest daughter and [the friends [she]3960-the mother had come from]2889-the friends she had come from . A few inquiries began : but one of the earliest—“How did [sister Bertram]101-sir thomas manage about [[her]3960-the mother servants]556-her servants ? ”[3960-the mother] “ Was [she]3960-the mother as much plagued as [herself]3960-the mother to get [tolerable servants?”—soon]6059-tolerable servants?”—soon[3960-the mother] led [her]3960-the mother mind away from [Northamptonshire]15-northamptonshire , and fixed it on [her]3960-the mother own domestic grievances , and the shocking character of all [the [Portsmouth]7-portsmouth servants , of whom [she]3960-the mother believed [her]3960-the mother own two]2890-the portsmouth servants , of whom she believed her own two were the very worst , engrossed [her]3960-the mother completely . [The Bertrams]2891-the bertrams were all forgotten in detailing the faults of [Rebecca]268-rebecca , against whom [Susan]264-susan had also much to depose , and [little Betsey]148-betsey a great deal more , and [who did seem so thoroughly without a single recommendation]2892-who did seem so thoroughly without a single recommendation , that [Fanny]113-fanny could not help modestly presuming that [[her]3960-the mother mother]446-her mother meant to part with [her]3960-the mother when [her]3960-the mother year was up . “ [Her]268-rebecca year ! ”[107-mrs. price] cried [Mrs. Price]107-mrs. price ; “ [I]107-mrs. price am sure [I]107-mrs. price hope [I]107-mrs. price shall be rid of [her]268-rebecca before [she]268-rebecca has staid a year , for that will not be up till November . [Servants]6060-servants are come to such a pass , [[my]107-mrs. price dear]3657-my dear , in [Portsmouth]7-portsmouth , that it is quite a miracle if one keeps [them]6060-servants more than half a year . [I]107-mrs. price have no hope of ever being settled ; and if [I]107-mrs. price was to part with [Rebecca]268-rebecca , [I]107-mrs. price should only get something worse . And yet [I]107-mrs. price do not think [I]107-mrs. price am [a very difficult mistress]6062-a very difficult mistress to please ; and [I]107-mrs. price am sure [the place]459-the place is easy enough , for there is always [a girl under [her]268-rebecca]6064-a girl under her , and [I]107-mrs. price often do half the work [myself]107-mrs. price . ”[107-mrs. price] [Fanny]113-fanny was silent ; but not from being convinced that there might not be a remedy found for some of these evils . As [she]2894-she now sat looking at [Betsey]148-betsey , [she]2894-she could not but think particularly of [another sister]2895-another sister , [a very pretty little girl , whom [she]2894-she had left there not much younger when [she]2894-she went into [Northamptonshire]15-northamptonshire , who had died a few years afterwards]2896-a very pretty little girl , whom she had left there not much younger when she went into northamptonshire , who had died a few years afterwards . There had been something remarkably amiable about [her]2895-another sister . [Fanny]113-fanny in those early days had preferred [her]2895-another sister to [Susan]264-susan ; and when the news of [her]2895-another sister death had at last reached [Mansfield]130-mansfield , had for a short time been quite afflicted . The sight of [Betsey]148-betsey brought the image of [little Mary]132-mary back again , but [she]2894-she would not have pained [[her]2894-she mother]446-her mother by alluding to [her]2895-another sister for [the world]315-the world . While considering [her]2894-she with these ideas , [Betsey]148-betsey , at a small distance , was holding out something to catch [her]2894-she eyes , meaning to screen it at the same time from [Susan]264-susan ’s . “ What have [you]148-betsey got there , [[my]113-fanny love]6065-my love ? ”[113-fanny] said [Fanny]113-fanny ; “ come and shew it to [me]113-fanny . ”[113-fanny] It was a silver knife . Up jumped [Susan]264-susan , claiming it as [her]264-susan own , and trying to get it away ; but [the child]3656-the child ran to [[her]3656-the child mother]446-her mother ’s protection , and [Susan]264-susan could only reproach , which [she]264-susan did very warmly , and evidently hoping to interest [Fanny]113-fanny on [her]264-susan side . “ It was very hard that [she]2895-another sister was not to have [her]2895-another sister _ own _ knife ; it was [her]2895-another sister own knife ; [little sister [Mary]132-mary]6066-little sister mary had left it to [her]2895-another sister upon [her]2895-another sister deathbed , and [she]2895-another sister ought to have had it to keep [herself]2895-another sister long ago . But [mama]3783-mama kept it from [her]2895-another sister , and was always letting [Betsey]148-betsey get hold of it ; and the end of it would be that [Betsey]148-betsey would spoil it , and get it for [her]148-betsey own , though [mama]3783-mama had _ promised _ [her]2895-another sister that [Betsey]148-betsey should not have it in [her]148-betsey own hands . ”[264-susan] [Fanny]113-fanny was quite shocked . Every feeling of duty , honour , and tenderness was wounded by [[her]2901-her sister]331-her sister ’s speech and [[her]2901-her mother]446-her mother ’s reply . “ Now , [Susan]264-susan , ”[107-mrs. price] cried [Mrs. Price]107-mrs. price , in a complaining voice , “ now , how can [you]264-susan be so cross ? [You]264-susan are always quarrelling about that knife . [I]107-mrs. price wish [you]264-susan would not be so quarrelsome . [Poor little Betsey]148-betsey ; how cross [Susan]264-susan is to [you]264-susan ! But [you]264-susan should not have taken it out , [[my]107-mrs. price dear]3657-my dear , when [I]107-mrs. price sent [you]264-susan to the drawer . [You]264-susan know [I]107-mrs. price told [you]264-susan not to touch it , because [Susan]264-susan is so cross about it . [I]107-mrs. price must hide it another time , [Betsey]148-betsey . [Poor Mary]276-mary little thought it would be such a bone of contention when [she]276-mary gave it [me]107-mrs. price to keep , only two hours before [she]276-mary died . [Poor little soul]6070-poor little soul ! [she]276-mary could but just speak to be heard , and [she]276-mary said so prettily , ‘ Let [sister Susan]264-susan have [my]107-mrs. price knife , [mama]3783-mama , when [I]107-mrs. price am dead and buried . ’ [Poor little dear]6072-poor little dear ! [she]276-mary was so fond of it , [Fanny]113-fanny , that [she]276-mary would have it lay by [her]276-mary in bed , all through [her]276-mary illness . It was the gift of [[her]276-mary good godmother]6073-her good godmother , [old Mrs. Admiral Maxwell]277-old mrs. admiral maxwell , only six weeks before [she]276-mary was taken for death . [Poor little sweet creature]6074-poor little sweet creature ! Well , [she]276-mary was taken away from evil to come . [My]107-mrs. price own [Betsey]148-betsey ”[107-mrs. price] ( fondling [her]2904-her ) , “ _ [you]113-fanny _ have not the luck of [such a good godmother]6075-such a good godmother . [Aunt Norris]278-aunt norris lives too far off to think of [such little people as [you]113-fanny]6076-such little people as you . ”[107-mrs. price] [Fanny]113-fanny had indeed nothing to convey from [aunt Norris]278-aunt norris , but a message to say [she]2904-her hoped that [[her]2904-her god - daughter]2905-her god - daughter was [a good girl]410-a good girl , and learnt [her]2904-her book . There had been at one moment a slight murmur in [the drawing - room at [Mansfield Park]130-mansfield]2907-the drawing - room at mansfield park about sending [her]2904-her a prayer - book ; but no second sound had been heard of such a purpose . [Mrs. Norris]105-mrs. norris , however , had gone [home]367-home and taken down two old prayer - books of [[her]105-mrs. norris husband]325-her husband with that idea ; but , upon examination , the ardour of generosity went off . [One]766-one was found to have too small a print for [a child]376-a child ’s eyes , and the other to be too cumbersome for [her]2904-her to carry about . [Fanny]113-fanny , fatigued and fatigued again , was thankful to accept the first invitation of going to bed ; and before [Betsey]148-betsey had finished [her]148-betsey cry at being allowed to sit up only one hour extraordinary in honour of [sister]3704-sister , [she]148-betsey was off , leaving all below in confusion and noise again ; [the boys]6004-the boys begging for toasted cheese , [[her]2904-her father]667-her father calling out for [his]667-her father rum and water , and [Rebecca]268-rebecca never where [she]2904-her ought to be . There was nothing to raise [her]2904-her spirits in [the confined and scantily furnished chamber that [she]2904-her was to share with [Susan]264-susan]2915-the confined and scantily furnished chamber that she was to share with susan . The smallness of [the rooms above and below]2916-the rooms above and below , indeed , and the narrowness of [the passage]6022-the passage and staircase , struck [her]2904-her beyond [her]2904-her imagination . [She]2904-her soon learned to think with respect of [[her]2904-her own little attic at [Mansfield Park]130-mansfield]2918-her own little attic at mansfield park , in [_ that _ house reckoned too small for [anybody]3668-anybody ’s comfort]2919-_ that _ house reckoned too small for anybody ’s comfort . CHAPTER XXXIX Could [Sir Thomas]101-sir thomas have seen all [[his]101-sir thomas niece]724-his niece ’s feelings , when [she]724-his niece wrote [her]724-his niece first letter to [[her]724-his niece aunt]463-her aunt , [he]101-sir thomas would not have despaired ; for though a good night ’s rest , a pleasant morning , the hope of soon seeing [William]228-william again , and the comparatively quiet state of [the house]427-the house , from [Tom]101-sir thomas and [Charles]245-charles being gone to [school]2820-school , [Sam]267-sam on some project of [his]267-sam own , and [[her]724-his niece father]667-her father on [his]667-her father usual lounges , enabled [her]724-his niece to express [herself]724-his niece cheerfully on the subject of [home]367-home , there were still , to [her]724-his niece own perfect consciousness , many drawbacks suppressed . Could [he]101-sir thomas have seen only half that [she]724-his niece felt before the end of a week , [he]101-sir thomas would have thought [Mr. Crawford]133-mr. crawford sure of [her]724-his niece , and been delighted with [his]667-her father own sagacity . Before the week ended , it was all disappointment . In the first place , [William]228-william was gone . [The Thrush]265-the thrush had had [her]724-his niece orders , the wind had changed , and [he]228-william was sailed within four days from [their]2927-their reaching [Portsmouth]7-portsmouth ; and during those days [she]724-his niece had seen [him]228-william only twice , in a short and hurried way , when [he]228-william had come ashore on duty . There had been no free conversation , no walk on [the ramparts]2928-the ramparts , no visit to [the dockyard]2722-the dockyard , no acquaintance with [the Thrush]265-the thrush , nothing of all that [they]2927-their had planned and depended on . Everything in [that quarter]2930-that quarter failed [her]724-his niece , except [William]228-william ’s affection . [His]228-william last thought on leaving [home]367-home was for [her]724-his niece . [He]228-william stepped back again to the door to say , “ Take care of [Fanny]113-fanny , [mother]3977-mother . [She]724-his niece is tender , and not used to rough it like the rest of [us]2927-their . [I]228-william charge [you]724-his niece , take care of [Fanny]113-fanny . ”[228-william] [William]228-william was gone : and [the home [he]228-william had left [her]724-his niece in]2932-the home he had left her in was , [Fanny]113-fanny could not conceal it from [herself]113-fanny , in almost every respect the very reverse of what [she]724-his niece could have wished . It was the abode of noise , disorder , and impropriety . [Nobody]360-nobody was in [[their]360-nobody right place]2934-their right place , nothing was done as it ought to be . [She]724-his niece could not respect [[her]724-his niece parents]2443-her parents as [she]724-his niece had hoped . On [[her]724-his niece father]667-her father , [her]724-his niece confidence had not been sanguine , but [he]667-her father was more negligent of [[his]667-her father family]582-his family , [his]667-her father habits were worse , and [his]667-her father manners coarser , than [she]724-his niece had been prepared for . [He]667-her father did not want abilities but [he]667-her father had no curiosity , and no information beyond [his]667-her father profession ; [he]667-her father read only the newspaper and the navy - list ; [he]667-her father talked only of [the dockyard]2722-the dockyard , [the harbour]2939-the harbour , [Spithead]68-spithead , and [the Motherbank]2940-the motherbank ; [he]667-her father swore and [he]667-her father drank , [he]667-her father was dirty and gross . [She]724-his niece had never been able to recall anything approaching to tenderness in [his]667-her father former treatment of [herself]724-his niece . There had remained only a general impression of roughness and loudness ; and now [he]667-her father scarcely ever noticed [her]724-his niece , but to make [her]724-his niece the object of a coarse joke . [Her]724-his niece disappointment in [[her]724-his niece mother]446-her mother was greater : _ there _ [she]724-his niece had hoped much , and found almost nothing . Every flattering scheme of being of consequence to [her]724-his niece soon fell to the ground . [Mrs. Price]107-mrs. price was not unkind ; but , instead of gaining on [her]107-mrs. price affection and confidence , and becoming more and more dear , [[her]107-mrs. price daughter]382-her daughter never met with greater kindness from [her]107-mrs. price than on the first day of [her]107-mrs. price arrival . The instinct of nature was soon satisfied , and [Mrs. Price]107-mrs. price ’s attachment had no other source . [Her]107-mrs. price heart and [her]107-mrs. price time were already quite full ; [she]107-mrs. price had neither leisure nor affection to bestow on [Fanny]113-fanny . [[Her]107-mrs. price daughters]480-her daughters never had been much to [her]107-mrs. price . [She]107-mrs. price was fond of [[her]107-mrs. price sons]503-her sons , especially of [William]228-william , but [Betsey]148-betsey was [the first of [[her]107-mrs. price girls]484-her girls whom [she]107-mrs. price had ever much regarded]2945-the first of her girls whom she had ever much regarded . To [her]107-mrs. price [she]148-betsey was most injudiciously indulgent . [William]228-william was [her]107-mrs. price pride ; [Betsey]148-betsey [[her]107-mrs. price darling]2947-her darling ; and [John]223-mr. john , [Richard]180-frederick , [Sam]267-sam , [Tom]101-sir thomas , and [Charles]245-charles occupied all the rest of [her]107-mrs. price maternal solicitude , alternately [her]107-mrs. price worries and [her]107-mrs. price comforts . These shared [her]107-mrs. price heart : [her]107-mrs. price time was given chiefly to [[her]107-mrs. price house]5120-her house and [[her]107-mrs. price servants]556-her servants . [Her]107-mrs. price days were spent in a kind of slow bustle ; all was busy without getting on , always behindhand and lamenting it , without altering [her]107-mrs. price ways ; wishing to be [an economist]575-an economist , without contrivance or regularity ; dissatisfied with [[her]107-mrs. price servants]556-her servants , without skill to make [them]556-her servants better , and whether helping , or reprimanding , or indulging [them]556-her servants , without any power of engaging [their]556-her servants respect . Of [[her]107-mrs. price two sisters]2788-her two sisters , [Mrs. Price]107-mrs. price very much more resembled [Lady Bertram]106-lady bertram than [Mrs. Norris]105-mrs. norris . [She]107-mrs. price was [a manager]2953-a manager by necessity , without any of [Mrs. Norris]105-mrs. norris ’s inclination for it , or any of [her]107-mrs. price activity . [Her]107-mrs. price disposition was naturally easy and indolent , like [[Lady Bertram]106-lady bertram ’s]2954-lady bertram ’s ; and a situation of similar affluence and do - nothingness would have been much more suited to [her]107-mrs. price capacity than the exertions and self - denials of the one which [her]107-mrs. price imprudent marriage had placed [her]107-mrs. price in . [She]107-mrs. price might have made just as good [a woman of consequence]2955-a woman of consequence as [Lady Bertram]106-lady bertram , but [Mrs. Norris]105-mrs. norris would have been [a more respectable mother of [nine children]2957-nine children on a small income]2956-a more respectable mother of nine children on a small income . Much of all this [Fanny]113-fanny could not but be sensible of . [She]107-mrs. price might scruple to make use of the words , but [she]107-mrs. price must and did feel that [[her]107-mrs. price mother]446-her mother was [a partial , ill - judging parent]2959-a partial , ill - judging parent , [a dawdle]2960-a dawdle , [a slattern]2961-a slattern , who neither taught nor restrained [[her]446-her mother children]386-her children , whose house was the scene of mismanagement and discomfort from beginning to end , and who had no talent , no conversation , no affection towards [herself]107-mrs. price ; no curiosity to know [her]107-mrs. price better , no desire of [her]107-mrs. price friendship , and no inclination for [her]107-mrs. price company that could lessen [her]107-mrs. price sense of such feelings . [Fanny]113-fanny was very anxious to be useful , and not to appear above [[her]107-mrs. price home]3744-her home , or in any way disqualified or disinclined , by [her]107-mrs. price foreign education , from contributing [her]107-mrs. price help to its comforts , and therefore set about working for [Sam]267-sam immediately ; and by working early and late , with perseverance and great despatch , did so much that [the boy]513-the boy was shipped off at last , with more than half [his]513-the boy linen ready . [She]107-mrs. price had great pleasure in feeling [her]107-mrs. price usefulness , but could not conceive how [they]2965-they would have managed without [her]107-mrs. price . [Sam]267-sam , loud and overbearing as [he]267-sam was , [she]107-mrs. price rather regretted when [he]267-sam went , for [he]267-sam was clever and intelligent , and glad to be employed in any errand in [the town]2773-the town ; and though spurning the remonstrances of [Susan]264-susan , given as [they]2965-they were , though very reasonable in [themselves]2965-they , with ill - timed and powerless warmth , was beginning to be influenced by [Fanny]113-fanny ’s services and gentle persuasions ; and [she]107-mrs. price found that the best of [the three younger ones]2967-the three younger ones was gone in [him]267-sam : [Tom]101-sir thomas and [Charles]245-charles being at least as many years as [they]2965-they were [[his]267-sam juniors]2968-his juniors distant from that age of feeling and reason , which might suggest the expediency of making [friends]3751-friends , and of endeavouring to be less disagreeable . [[Their]2965-they sister]705-their sister soon despaired of making the smallest impression on _ [them]2965-they _ ; [they]2965-they were quite untameable by any means of address which [she]705-their sister had spirits or time to attempt . Every afternoon brought a return of [their]2965-they riotous games all over [the house]427-the house ; and [she]705-their sister very early learned to sigh at the approach of [Saturday]279-saturday ’s constant half - holiday . [Betsey]148-betsey , too , [a spoiled child , trained up to think the alphabet]2972-a spoiled child , trained up to think the alphabet [[her]148-betsey greatest enemy]1440-her greatest enemy , left to be with [the servants]601-the servants at [her]148-betsey pleasure , and then encouraged to report any evil of [them]601-the servants , [she]148-betsey was almost as ready to despair of being able to love or assist ; and of [Susan]264-susan ’s temper [she]148-betsey had many doubts . [Her]148-betsey continual disagreements with [[her]148-betsey mother]446-her mother , [her]148-betsey rash squabbles with [Tom]101-sir thomas and [Charles]245-charles , and petulance with [Betsey]148-betsey , were at least so distressing to [Fanny]113-fanny that , though admitting [they]2976-them were by no means without provocation , [she]148-betsey feared the disposition that could push [them]2976-them to such length must be far from amiable , and from affording any repose to [herself]148-betsey . Such was [the home which was to put [Mansfield]130-mansfield out of [her]148-betsey head]2977-the home which was to put mansfield out of her head , and teach [her]148-betsey to think of [[her]148-betsey cousin]3692-her cousin [Edmund]108-edmund with moderated feelings . On the contrary , [she]148-betsey could think of nothing but [Mansfield]3-mansfield , [[its]3-mansfield beloved inmates]2979-its beloved inmates , [its]3-mansfield happy ways . Everything where [she]148-betsey now was in full contrast to it . The elegance , propriety , regularity , harmony , and perhaps , above all , the peace and tranquillity of [Mansfield]130-mansfield , were brought to [her]148-betsey remembrance every hour of the day , by the prevalence of everything opposite to [them]2976-them _ here _ . [The living in incessant noise]2980-the living in incessant noise was , to a frame and temper delicate and nervous like [Fanny]113-fanny ’s , an evil which no superadded elegance or harmony could have entirely atoned for . It was the greatest misery of all . At [Mansfield]3-mansfield , no sounds of contention , no raised voice , no abrupt bursts , no tread of violence , was ever heard ; all proceeded in a regular course of cheerful orderliness ; [everybody]408-everybody had [their]408-everybody due importance ; [everybody]408-everybody ’s feelings were consulted . If tenderness could be ever supposed wanting , good sense and good breeding supplied its place ; and as to the little irritations sometimes introduced by [aunt Norris]105-mrs. norris , they were short , they were trifling , they were as a drop of water to [the ocean]2983-the ocean , compared with the ceaseless tumult of [[her]148-betsey present abode]2984-her present abode . Here [everybody]408-everybody was noisy , every voice was loud ( excepting , perhaps , [[her]148-betsey mother]446-her mother ’s , which resembled the soft monotony of [Lady Bertram]106-lady bertram ’s , only worn into fretfulness ) . Whatever was wanted was hallooed for , and [the servants]601-the servants hallooed out [their]601-the servants excuses from [the kitchen]6030-the kitchen . The doors were in constant banging , the stairs were never at rest , nothing was done without a clatter , [nobody]360-nobody sat still , and [nobody]360-nobody could command attention when [they]601-the servants spoke . In a review of [the two houses]2991-the two houses , as [they]2991-the two houses appeared to [her]148-betsey before the end of a week , [Fanny]113-fanny was tempted to apply to [them]2991-the two houses [Dr. Johnson]280-dr. johnson ’s celebrated judgment as to matrimony and celibacy , and say , that though [Mansfield Park]130-mansfield might have some pains , [Portsmouth]7-portsmouth could have no pleasures . CHAPTER [XL Fanny]113-fanny was right enough in not expecting to hear from [Miss Crawford]127-miss crawford now at the rapid rate in which [their]2991-the two houses correspondence had begun ; [Mary]276-mary ’s next letter was after a decidedly longer interval than the last , but [she]276-mary was not right in supposing that such an interval would be felt a great relief to [herself]276-mary . Here was another strange revolution of mind ! [She]148-betsey was really glad to receive the letter when it did come . In [her]148-betsey present exile from good society , and distance from everything that had been wo nt to interest [her]148-betsey , a letter from one belonging to the set where [her]148-betsey heart lived , written with affection , and some degree of elegance , was thoroughly acceptable . The usual plea of increasing engagements was made in excuse for not having written to [her]148-betsey earlier ; “ And now that [I]148-betsey have begun , ”[148-betsey] [she]148-betsey continued , “ [my]148-betsey letter will not be worth [your]6078-your reading , for there will be no little offering of love at the end , no three or four lines _ passionnées _ from [the most devoted H. C. in [the world]315-the world]6079-the most devoted h. c. in the world , for [Henry]131-henry is in [Norfolk]19-norfolk ; business called [him]131-henry to [Everingham]31-everingham ten days ago , or perhaps [he]131-henry only pretended the call , for the sake of being travelling at the same time that [you]6078-your were . But there [he]131-henry is , and , by the bye , [his]131-henry absence may sufficiently account for any remissness of [[his]131-henry sister]511-his sister ’s in writing , for there has been no ‘ Well , [Mary]276-mary , when do [you]276-mary write to [Fanny]113-fanny ? Is not it time for [you]276-mary to write to [Fanny]113-fanny ? ’ to spur [me]148-betsey on . At last , after various attempts at meeting , [I]148-betsey have seen [[your]6078-your cousins]4848-your cousins , ‘ dear [Julia]112-julia and dearest [Mrs. Rushworth]126-maria ’ ; [they]4848-your cousins found [me]148-betsey at [home]367-home yesterday , and [we]4848-your cousins were glad to see [each other]681-each other again . [We]4848-your cousins _ seemed _ _ very _ glad to see [each other]681-each other , and [I]148-betsey do really think [we]4848-your cousins were a little . [We]4848-your cousins had a vast deal to say . Shall [I]148-betsey tell [you]6078-your how [Mrs. Rushworth]126-maria looked when [your]6078-your name was mentioned ? [I]148-betsey did not use to think [her]126-maria wanting in self - possession , but [she]126-maria had not quite enough for the demands of yesterday . Upon the whole , [Julia]112-julia was in the best looks of [the two]390-the two , at least after [you]6078-your were spoken of . There was no recovering the complexion from the moment that [I]148-betsey spoke of ‘ [Fanny]113-fanny , ’ and spoke of [her]126-maria as [a sister]3681-a sister should . But [Mrs. Rushworth]126-maria ’s day of good looks will come ; [we]4848-your cousins have cards for [her]126-maria first party on the 28th . Then [she]126-maria will be in beauty , for [she]126-maria will open [one of [the best houses in [Wimpole Street]88-wimpole street]6089-the best houses in wimpole street]6088-one of the best houses in wimpole street . [I]148-betsey was in [it]6088-one of the best houses in wimpole street two years ago , when it was [Lady Lascelle]282-lady lascelle ’s , and prefer it to almost any [I]148-betsey know in [London]6-london , and certainly [she]126-maria will then feel , to use a vulgar phrase , that [she]126-maria has got [her]126-maria pennyworth for [her]126-maria penny . [Henry]131-henry could not have afforded [her]126-maria such [a house]742-a house . [I]148-betsey hope [she]126-maria will recollect it , and be satisfied , as well as [she]126-maria may , with moving [the queen of [a palace]6092-a palace]6091-the queen of a palace , though [the king]4118-the king may appear best in the background ; and as [I]148-betsey have no desire to tease [her]126-maria , [I]148-betsey shall never _ force _ [your]6094-your name upon [her]126-maria again . [She]126-maria will grow sober by degrees . From all that [I]148-betsey hear and guess , [Baron Wildenheim]196-baron wildenheim ’s attentions to [Julia]112-julia continue , but [I]148-betsey do not know that [he]196-baron wildenheim has any serious encouragement . [She]112-julia ought to do better . [A poor honourable]6095-a poor honourable is no catch , and [I]148-betsey can not imagine any liking in the case , for take away [his]196-baron wildenheim rants , and [the poor baron]6096-the poor baron has nothing . What a difference [a vowel]6097-a vowel makes ! If [his]196-baron wildenheim rents were but equal to [his]196-baron wildenheim rants ! [[Your]6094-your cousin]3780-your cousin [Edmund]108-edmund moves slowly ; detained , perchance , by parish duties . There may be [some old woman at [Thornton Lacey]231-thornton lacey]6099-some old woman at thornton lacey to be converted . [I]148-betsey am unwilling to fancy [myself]148-betsey neglected for [a _ young _ one]6100-a _ young _ one . Adieu ! [[my]148-betsey dear]3657-my dear sweet [Fanny]113-fanny , this is a long letter from [London]6-london : write [me]148-betsey a pretty one in reply to [gladden Henry]131-henry ’s eyes , when [he]131-henry comes back , and send [me]148-betsey an account of all [the dashing young captains whom [you]113-fanny disdain for [his]131-henry sake]6102-the dashing young captains whom you disdain for his sake . ”[148-betsey] There was great food for meditation in this letter , and chiefly for unpleasant meditation ; and yet , with all the uneasiness it supplied , it connected [her]2992-her with [the absent]4735-the absent , it told [her]2992-her of [people]3906-people and things about whom [she]2992-her had never felt so much curiosity as now , and [she]2992-her would have been glad to have been sure of such a letter every week . [Her]2992-her correspondence with [[her]2992-her aunt]463-her aunt [Bertram]106-lady bertram was [her]2992-her only concern of higher interest . As for [any society in [Portsmouth]7-portsmouth]2996-any society in portsmouth , that could at all make amends for deficiencies at [home]367-home , there were [none within the circle of [[her]2992-her father]667-her father ’s and [mother]3977-mother ’s acquaintance]2998-none within the circle of her father ’s and mother ’s acquaintance to afford [her]2992-her the smallest satisfaction : [she]2992-her saw nobody in whose favour [she]2992-her could wish to overcome [her]2992-her own shyness and reserve . [The men]4832-the men appeared to [her]2992-her all coarse , [the women]3002-the women all pert , [everybody underbred]3003-everybody underbred ; and [she]2992-her gave as little contentment as [she]2992-her received from introductions either to old or new acquaintance . [The young ladies who approached [her]2992-her at first with some respect , in consideration of [her]2992-her coming from [a baronet ’s family]3005-a baronet ’s family]3004-the young ladies who approached her at first with some respect , in consideration of her coming from a baronet ’s family , were soon offended by what [they]3004-the young ladies who approached her at first with some respect , in consideration of her coming from a baronet ’s family termed “ airs ”[3004-the young ladies who approached her at first with some respect , in consideration of her coming from a baronet ’s family] ; for , as [she]2992-her neither played on the pianoforte nor wore fine pelisses , [they]3004-the young ladies who approached her at first with some respect , in consideration of her coming from a baronet ’s family could , on farther observation , admit no right of superiority . The first solid consolation which [Fanny]113-fanny received for the evils of [home]367-home , the first which [her]2992-her judgment could entirely approve , and which gave any promise of durability , was in a better knowledge of [Susan]264-susan , and a hope of being of service to [her]2992-her . [Susan]264-susan had always behaved pleasantly to [herself]264-susan , but the determined character of [her]264-susan general manners had astonished and alarmed [her]264-susan , and it was at least a fortnight before [she]264-susan began to understand a disposition so totally different from [her]264-susan own . [Susan]264-susan saw that much was wrong at [home]367-home , and wanted to set it right . That [a girl of fourteen]3008-a girl of fourteen , acting only on [her]3008-a girl of fourteen own unassisted reason , should err in the method of reform , was not wonderful ; and [Fanny]113-fanny soon became more disposed to admire the natural light of the mind which could so early distinguish justly , than to censure severely the faults of conduct to which it led . [Susan]264-susan was only acting on the same truths , and pursuing the same system , which [her]264-susan own judgment acknowledged , but which [her]264-susan more supine and yielding temper would have shrunk from asserting . [Susan]264-susan tried to be useful , where _ [she]264-susan _ could only have gone away and cried ; and that [Susan]264-susan was useful [she]264-susan could perceive ; that things , bad as they were , would have been worse but for such interposition , and that both [[her]264-susan mother]446-her mother and [Betsey]148-betsey were restrained from some excesses of very offensive indulgence and vulgarity . In every argument with [[her]264-susan mother]446-her mother , [Susan]264-susan had in point of reason the advantage , and never was there any maternal tenderness to buy [her]264-susan off . The blind fondness which was for ever producing evil around [her]264-susan [she]264-susan had never known . There was no gratitude for affection past or present to make [her]264-susan better bear with its excesses to the others . All this became gradually evident , and gradually placed [Susan]264-susan before [[her]264-susan sister]331-her sister as an object of mingled compassion and respect . That [her]264-susan manner was wrong , however , at times very wrong , [her]264-susan measures often ill - chosen and ill - timed , and [her]264-susan looks and language very often indefensible , [Fanny]113-fanny could not cease to feel ; but [she]264-susan began to hope [they]3012-they might be rectified . [Susan]264-susan , [she]264-susan found , looked up to [her]264-susan and wished for [her]264-susan good opinion ; and new as anything like [an office of authority]3013-an office of authority was to [Fanny]113-fanny , new as it was to imagine [herself]264-susan capable of guiding or informing [any one]3817-any one , [she]264-susan did resolve to give occasional hints to [Susan]264-susan , and endeavour to exercise for [her]264-susan advantage the juster notions of what was due to [everybody]408-everybody , and what would be wisest for [herself]264-susan , which [her]264-susan own more favoured education had fixed in [her]264-susan . [Her]264-susan influence , or at least the consciousness and use of it , originated in an act of kindness by [Susan]264-susan , which , after many hesitations of delicacy , [she]264-susan at last worked [herself]264-susan up to . It had very early occurred to [her]264-susan that a small sum of money might , perhaps , restore peace for ever on the sore subject of the silver knife , canvassed as it now was continually , and the riches which [she]264-susan was in possession of [herself]264-susan , [[her]264-susan uncle]312-her uncle having given [her]264-susan £ 10 at parting , made [her]264-susan as able as [she]264-susan was willing to be generous . But [she]264-susan was so wholly unused to confer favours , except on [the very poor]3017-the very poor , so unpractised in removing evils , or bestowing kindnesses among [[her]264-susan equals]3018-her equals , and so fearful of appearing to elevate [herself]264-susan as [a great lady]3019-a great lady at [home]367-home , that it took some time to determine that it would not be unbecoming in [her]264-susan to make such a present . It was made , however , at last : a silver knife was bought for [Betsey]148-betsey , and accepted with great delight , its newness giving [it]3021-it every advantage over the other that could be desired ; [Susan]264-susan was established in the full possession of [her]264-susan own , [Betsey]148-betsey handsomely declaring that now [she]148-betsey had got one so much prettier [herself]148-betsey , [she]148-betsey should never want _ that _ again ; and no reproach seemed conveyed to [the equally satisfied mother]3022-the equally satisfied mother , which [Fanny]113-fanny had almost feared to be impossible . The deed thoroughly answered : a source of domestic altercation was entirely done away , and it was the means of opening [Susan]264-susan ’s heart to [her]148-betsey , and giving [her]148-betsey something more to love and be interested in . [Susan]264-susan shewed that [she]264-susan had delicacy : pleased as [she]264-susan was to be mistress of property which [she]264-susan had been struggling for at least two years , [she]264-susan yet feared that [[her]264-susan sister]331-her sister ’s judgment had been against [her]264-susan , and that a reproof was designed [her]264-susan for having so struggled as to make the purchase necessary for the tranquillity of [the house]427-the house .
